She is very grateful to Ceprodel because with the loans she’s increased her inventory and made improvements to her dwelling.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, assorted juices, water, candy, cigarettes and chocolates.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia, necesita realizar la inversión en el negocio, por eso a través de un nuevo préstamo piensa comprarse cerdos para el destazo, algunos los mantendrá en la granja para engordarlos, este préstamo le ayudara para tener la oportunidad de seguir trabajando y proveyendo para su familia lo necesario.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue positivo, ayudándole a generar más ventas y ganancias para el sustento familiar.
texts.en:
Lucia needs to make an investment in her business. That is why she will use a new loan to purchase pigs for butchering, although she will keep some on the farm in order to fatten them up. This loan will help her have the opportunity to keep working and provide what her family needs.
The previous loan generated positive results, helping her increase her sales and income in order to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase pigs for butchering.

loans.name: Saul Humberto

texts.es:
Saul, se dedica a la reparación de llantas y chatarrería, vive solo, tiene un hijo de 30 años, su ocupación es la compra, venta y reparación de llantas, también la compra y venta de chatarra, de este negocio logra sostenerse.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de llantas, pues esto le ayudara a mantener surtido el inventario para atender las necesidades de los clientes, esta inversión le ayudara también a ser más competente, dándole mas oportunidades de ganancias.
La aspiración de Saul es tener un negocio con la capacidad para atender bien a los clientes, pues esto le asegura los ingresos para subsistir.
texts.en:
Saul repairs tires and runs a scrapyard. He lives alone and has a 30-year-old son. He buys, sells, and repairs tires and deals in scrap metal. This business sustains him.

He is requesting a loan to buy tires, which will allow him to keep inventory in stock to meet his customers' needs. This investment will also make him more competitive and give him more profit opportunities. Saul's goal is to have a business that serves his customers well. This will ensure that he has enough income to live.

loans.use: to buy tires.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a 37-year-old married woman with five children, three enrolled in school. She operates a green grocery and sells her goods from home.  She has been in the business for the last three years. Her ambition is to open a kiosk. Her other sources of income include earnings from her husband. She joined Yehu so as to get funds to expand her business. 

Mwanakombo owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She describes her major challenge to be price fluctuation and her greatest monthly expense to be food for the family. She intends to use the loan of Ksh 25,000 to purchase tomatoes and potatoes.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and potatoes.

loans.name: Canastitos Group

texts.es:
El grupo los canastitos lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Rosa quien vende frituras como platanitos, yuquitas, enchiladas y papas…etc. Este negocio en el que trabaja desde hace 40 años e invertirá el crédito en materia prima como plátanos, aceite, leña…etc.
Las otras integrantes son Maribel del Socorro quien Elabora Canasta s de bambú y Kenia quien vende pan como bonetes, picos, pan de molde…etc.
texts.en:
Los Canastitos Group is made up of three hardworking and enterprising women.  One of them is Rosa, who sells fried snacks such as plantains, yucca, enchiladas, potatoes, etc.  She started this business forty years ago, and she will invest the loan in basic supplies such as plantains, oil, firewood, etc.

The other members are Maribel del Socorro, who makes bamboo baskets, and Kenia, who sells bread such as "bonetes," "picos," sandwich bread, etc.

loans.use: to buy basic supplies such as plantains, oil, and bags.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La señora María Elena es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien se dedica a la venta de comida. Este negocio lo inicio hace 33 años empezó trabajando en una comideria y luego puso su negocio. 
Ella es del grupo Magnolia y solicita este crédito autoestima para poder realizarse un chequeo médico y comprar la medicina.
texts.en: Señora María Elena is a hard-working and enterprising woman who sells food.  She started this business 33 years ago by working in a restaurant and later started her own business.  She is part of the communal bank, "Magnolia," and she is requesting this loan to be able to have a medical checkup and to buy medicine.

loans.use: to have a medical checkup.

loans.name: Yarha Group

texts.es:
El grupo Yarha está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Rosa Argentina quien se dedica al comercio de cartera desde hace 25 años con lo cual saco adelante a sus 6 hijos los cuales todos son mayores.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería en carteras.
Las otras integrantes son Karla Patricia quien desde hace 15 años tiene una pulpería y María Ligia quien tiene una comideria.
texts.en:
The group Yarha is made up of three hardworking and entrepreneurial women. One of them is Rosa Argentina, who has made a living selling handbags for 25 years and by which she got her 6 older children ahead.

She will invest the loan in the purchase of handbag merchandise.

The other members of the group are Karla Patricia, who has had a small grocery store for fifteen years, and Ligia, who has an eatery.

loans.use: to purchase handbag merchandise.

loans.name: Rios De Agua Viva Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rio de agua viva está conformado por tres mujeres trabadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Zoila quien es comerciante de bisutería y ropa desde hace 15 años. Este negocio lo inicio con un pequeño tramo en el mercado más populoso de Managua y ahora también tiene una tienda en su casa. 
Ella es soltera y tiene una niña de 11 años y su meta es terminar sus estudios universitarios actualmente está terminando su tesis.
Las otras integrantes son Eufemia de 53 años de edad y Yessenia de 30 años de edad quienes desde hace 15 años comercializan bisutería.
texts.en:
The group Rio de Agua Viva is made up of three hardworking and entrepreneurial women. One of them is Zoila who has been a storekeeper of costume jewelry and clothing for 15 years. She began this business with a small stretch in Managua's most populous market, and she now also has a store in her home.

She is single and has an 11-year-old daughter. Her goal is to complete her university studies and she is currently completing her thesis.

The other members of the group are 53-year-old Eufemnia and 30-year-old Yesica, both of whom have been selling costume jewelry for 15 years.

loans.use: to buy costume jewelry.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
La Señora. Ana es socia del banco comunal El Crédito, vive por la ciudad de Cuenca lugar de clima frió, siendo una ciudad privilegiada por su cultura y tradiciones, desde Diciembre de 1999 es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gastronomía es muy variada la cual cautiva a propios y extraños, su gente se caracteriza por ser amable y gentil.

La Señora. Ana tiene 47 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de los cuales dos son casados y viven independientes, su hijo soltero trabaja para sus gastos personales. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora prestando sus servicios, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Ana se dedica a vender juguetes, su producto lo vende en diferentes escuelas, negocio en el que se encuentra hace 19 años, labora de lunes a viernes todo el día.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 13 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir comprando juguetes para continuar con su negocio.
 
Su meta es de terminar su casa la cual se encuentra en construcción.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of El Crédito Communal Bank.  She lives in Cuenca, an exceptional city known for its culture and traditions as well as its cold climate.  In 1999, it was named a UNESCO World Heritage Site.  It has a diverse gastronomy that captivates locals and visitors alike.  The people are known for being friendly and helpful.  

Ana is 47 years old.  She is married and has three children from this union, two of which are married and living independently; her unmarried son works to pay his personal expenses.  Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services.  She doesn’t own her own home so she is renting.

Ana is in the business of selling toys and sells her products in various schools.  She has been in this business for nineteen years and works from Monday to Friday all day.  She has been a member of the communal banks for thirteen years and she will invest her new loan in the purchase of toys to continue her business.  Her goal is to complete her home which is under construction.

loans.use: to purchase toys.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de mèches et habits depuis 2004, Akouvi est  une femme âgée de 29ans. Elle a commencé son activité depuis 2004. Elle a loué une boutique et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Vu que la demande au niveau des clients est élevée, elle sollicite un troisième crédit de WAGES pour acheter des tissages, bijoux et habits pour enfants. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité en augmentant le stock, étendre l’activité en installant d’autres points de vente.
texts.en: Akouvi, age 29, has been reselling hair extensions and clothing since 2004.  She started her business in 2004.  She rents a shop and buys her goods in  Lomé.  Because of a high customer demand, she is requesting a third loan from WAGES for the purchase of braids, jewelry and children's clothing.  She wants to reinvest in the activity and increase her stock.  She also wants to expand her business and open other retail outlets.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, braids, and children's clothes.

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
This is Minerva, 42, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. Single, she manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Minerva operates a used car business. What she basically does is buy second-hand cars from sellers then she upgrades or repairs them and the sells them for a profit. Cars can range from older to more modern models. Customers are attracted to buy due to the fair selling prices she offered. Her regular customers are people who wanted to acquire a vehicle in their local community. She earns a minimum of Php 10,000 in sales every month.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10, 000 loan.She will be utilizing the loan to do repairs and upgrades to the cars that she buys. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Minerva dreams to expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for upgrades and repairs to vehicles that she acquires in her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 44-years-old married woman with 4 children, all of whom are in school. She operates a poultry business and has been doing this business for the last 5 years.  

With the Ksh. 50,000, she plans to buy chicks and chicken feed. She sells her products both from home and at the market, to friends and neighbors. High transportation cost is her major challenge. Her aim is to become the leading supplier of broilers in the area. Mary owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is family food.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Kayissan

texts.fr: Kayissan est une femme âgée de 40ans. Elle est mariée à un enseignant et a 03 enfants tous scolarisés. L’ainé a 18ans et le dernier 10ans. Elle est coiffeuse de profession et vend en même temps des sacs et des produits divers (lait, sucre, détergents). Elle est à son premier crédit et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des sacs dames et des produits divers.  Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité en l’agrandissant et mieux s’occuper de sa famille. Son activité a été démarrée en 2002.
texts.en: Kayissan, age 40, is married to a teacher and has three children who all attend school.  Her oldest child is 18 years old and the youngest is 10.  By training a hairdresser, Kayissan also sells handbags and other various items (milk, sugar, detergent).  This is the first time she is requesting a loan for the purchase of women's handbags and other retail items.  She wants to reinvest into expanding her business.  She also wants to take better care of her family.  Kayissan started her business in 2002.

loans.use: to buy handbags and various other retail items.

loans.name: Mumbua

texts.en:
Mumbua is a 59-years-old a business lady. She is married to Boniface. They are blessed with three children. She has been running a green grocer business in an open air market for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family members.

She is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loans successfully. Mumbua will use the loan to buy a stock of green vegetables and fruits for her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate the last born child since the others are adults. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy a stock of green vegetables and fruits for her business.

loans.name: Rosa Angelica

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal El Crédito, vive por la ciudad de Cuenca lugar de clima frió, siendo una ciudad privilegiada por su cultura y tradiciones, desde Diciembre de 1999 es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gastronomía es muy variada la cual cautiva a propios y extraños, su gente se caracteriza por ser amable y gentil.

Doña Rosa tiene 55 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, casados y viven independientes. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora prestando sus servicios en un taxi que es de su propiedad, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Rosa tiene una tienda de comestibles desde hace 10 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo, también vende pollos pelados hace 2 años.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 8 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir comprando víveres para surtir su tienda.
 
Su meta es de seguir creciendo en su tienda.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the “El Crédito” communal bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a place with a cold climate.  It’s a city that’s privileged because of its culture and traditions.  Since December, 1999 it’s been a Cultural Patrimony of Humanity.  Its cuisine is varied and enchants both locals and foreigners alike.  Its people are noted for being kind and pleasant.

Rosa is 55 years old, married and has had five children who are all adults, married and living on their own.  Her husband is a driver and provides taxi services in a taxi he owns.  The house they live in is their property.

Rosa has had a grocery store for the last 10 years.  She works Sunday to Sunday with no fixed schedule.  She’s also been selling dressed chickens for the last two years.  She’s been in the3 communal bank for 8 years and will use her new loan to buy foodstuffs for her store.  Her goal is to continue growing in her store.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Rayo De Luz 2 Group

texts.en:
Ana is the coordinator of her group Rayo de Luz (Ray of Light) 2. This group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy. The group members are dedicated to selling cloth, food, shoes and many other miscellaneous products. 

Ana has had her business for approximately 5 years, starting with some savings she had. She plans to use this loan to invest in her cafeteria, where she sells natural juices, soda and some snacks. With this loan, she will invest in her business by increasing her inventory.

She lives in a simple structure with her four children and her husband. She says her most difficult challenge has been to improve her business and introduce other products and services. One of her favorite things to do is work. Carmen is excited about her 4th loan with Esperanza. She will use the profits to improve her business and to buy some enamelware to introduce sandwiches and others products. Ana thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To buy snacks, fruit, soda, cookies, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Elsa María

texts.es:
La Señora. Elsa es socia del banco comunal El Crédito, vive por la ciudad de Cuenca lugar de clima frió, siendo una ciudad privilegiada por su cultura y tradiciones, desde Diciembre de 1999 es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gastronomía es muy variada la cual cautiva a propios y extraños, su gente se caracteriza por ser amable y gentil.

La Señora. Elsa tiene 25 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido una hija  de un año y cuatro meses. Su esposo es un profesional en la gasfitería, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Elsa es comerciante ambulante de juguetes, actividad que la viene desempeñando hace 10 años, también vende bisutería y artículos de papelería, trabaja de lunes a viernes sin un horario fijo.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su madre. Su crédito lo va a invertir comprando bisutería, juguetes y artículos de papelería  para su negocio.
 
Su meta es de acabar su casa ya que aun le hacen falta algunos acabados.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of El Crédito Communal Bank.  She lives in Cuenca, an exceptional city known for its culture and traditions as well as its cold climate.  In 1999, it was named a UNESCO World Heritage Site.  It has a diverse gastronomy that captivates locals and visitors alike.  The people are known for being friendly and helpful.  

Elsa is 25 years old.  She is married and has a sixteen month old daughter from this union.  Her husband is a plumber by profession and they own the house in which they live.  

Elsa works a as a street vendor selling toys, and has been engaged in this activity for ten years.  She also sells costume jewelry and stationery products.  She works form Monday to Friday without a fixed schedule.  

Her mother invited her to join the communal bank and this is her first loan.  She will invest the loan in the purchase of costume jewelry, toys, and stationery products for her business.  Her goal is to finish working on her home as there are still further projects to be done.

loans.use: to purchase costume jewelry, toys, and stationery products.

loans.name: Rosa Elba

texts.es: La señora Rosa  es  una persona trabajadora y honesta, ella es cliente distinguida de la  institución ya que  a lo largo de  sus créditos  se  ha  caracterizado  por  tener  una excelente  cultura  de  pago,  nos  comenta  que esta  muy contenta  de habernos encontrado ya que  en diversas  ocasiones   la hemos  apoyado para  la realización de sus  proyectos, en este  momento  ella  requiere  pintar   las  paredes  exteriores  de  su vivienda, ve  en  el crédito la posibilidad  de  que su  casa  tenga  una mejor imagen.
texts.en: Rosa is a hard-working and honest person. She is a distinguished client of the institution, since with all her loans, she has demonstrated an outstanding payment record. She reports that she is very happy to have found us [Credituyo], since on diverse occasions we have helped her to carry out her plans. At this time, she needs to paint the exterior walls of her home. She sees the loan as giving her the opportunity to give her house a better image.

loans.use: to paint the exterior walls of her home.

loans.name: Oulimata

texts.fr: Madame Oulimata vit dans l’une des localités  sénégalaises.  Elle est âgée  de 57 ans et s’active dans le secteur du commerce depuis plus de 5 ans. Elle est spécialisée dans la vente de  détergents ou savon en poudre. Elle a choisi cette activité pour lutter contre l’oisiveté. Son objectif est de participer au développement de sa petite famille. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 17 et 27 ans.  Ce qui lui fait plaisir dans son activité c’est le bon produit et la satisfaction de sa clientèle. Elle est membre du guichet de sa zone d’habitation depuis novembre 2003. Elle a déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur. Elle sollicite un prêt de 100 000 frs prévu pour  augmenter son fond de  roulement et  s’approvisionner  en sacs de savons en poudre. Son objectif est d’acheter a un cout plus compétitif afin de maximiser sa marge bénéficiaire .L’augmentation de ses gains lui permettra de contribuer a l’amélioration  des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Oulimata, age 57, lives in a locality of Senegal.  She has been actively involved in retail business for more than 5 years and specializes in the sale of detergents and powder soap.  She chose this activity to fight idleness.  Her goal is to help her small family prosper.  She is married and has four children, whose ages range between 17 and 27 years.   She particularly enjoys her activity because of the quality of the product and because it brings satisfaction to her customers.  

Oulimata has been a member of her local lending institution since November 2003 and has already repaid a previous loan.  She is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to increase her working capital and to purchase some bags of powder soap.  Her goal is to buy at a more competitive price in order to maximize her profit margin.  With increased earnings, she will be able to participate in the improvement of her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy powder soap for resale.

loans.name: Edgar David

texts.es:
El Sr. Edgar David es profesor de educación física en un colegio de Tarija, y aprovecha su oficio para poder comercializar sus productos deportivos a los estudiantes, el cuenta con un pequeño negocio de venta de productos deportivos como pelotas, zapatos, ropa deportiva, y otros. 

Edgar se encuentra separado pero tiene un hijo quien depende de sus ingresos, el menor estudia aun en colegio, y Edgar trata de darle una buena educación y condición de vida por ello siempre esta buscando la manera de generar mas recursos pues el sueldo de profesor es muy bajo, y aprovechando que se los estudiantes a quien el enseña necesitan material deportivo el les vende y les permite que les cancelen en cuotas, por tal motivo el solicita el credito para poder abastecerse de mas material deportivo.
texts.en:
Edgar David is a physical education teacher at a school in Tarija and takes advantage of his profession to sell sports equipment to students.  He has a small business selling sports products like balls, shoes, sportswear and others.

Edgar is separated and has a son who depends on his income; the youngster is still attending school and Edgar tries to give him a good education and living conditions which is why he’s always looking for ways of generating additional resources because his teacher’s pay is very low.  

Taking advantage of the fact that the students he teaches need sports equipment, he sells it to them and lets them pay him in installments so he’s asking for a loan to stock up on more sports equipment.

loans.use: to buy sports equipment.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: La Sra. Carolina es una persona que se  preocupa por  acondicionar  su  vivienda,  ya  que  considera  que  esta  es  el patrimonio de  sus   hijos,  en esta  ocasión se  acerca  a la  institución  ya  que  requiere  realizar  la compra  de  una  puerta  para  su  casa , agradece  el  apoyo  brindado  para la realización de  su proyecto  ya que  ve  en el crédito la posibilidad  de  que  su  hogar  se  encuentre   protegido.
texts.en: Carolina is a person who cares about her home's condition, since she considers this to be her legacy for her children. At this time, she is turning to Kiva partner Credituyo because she wishes to purchase a door for her home. She is grateful for the support to carry out this project because she sees in the loan the possibility to make her home more secure.

loans.use: to purchase a door for her home.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia, trabaja como parvularia (profesión donde aprenden a  cuidar niños) en una guardería privada y también  cuenta con el dinero que su esposo le envía ya que el trabaja como minero en  la zona de Los Yungas de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar material escolar para sus hijos , pues las clases en los colegios ya han comenzado.
Virginia, es casada y tiene dos hijos con los cuales vive en una casa alquilada en la zona Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la tercera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Virginia works as a "parvularia" [nursery school teacher] (a profession where they learn to care for children) in a private nursery school and she also relies on money her husband sends her since he works as a miner in the Los Yungas de la Paz zone.

She needs the loan to buy school supplies for her children because school classes have already begun.

Virginia is married and has two children she lives with in a rented house in the city of La Paz’s Pasankeri zone.  This is the third time she’s worked with IMPRO and first with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for her children.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, se dedica  a la venta de muñecos de peluche ya que cuenta con un puesto de venta en la ciudad de El Alto y también tiene ingresos de su esposo ya que el trabaja en una mina de los Yungas.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de  más muñecos de peluches para diversificar sus productos y de esta forma tener más ingresos para mantener a su familia.
Isabel, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos con los cuales vive en casa propia en la zona Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Isabel sells stuffed toys; she has a stand in the city of El Alto and she also gets income from her husband who works in a mine in Los Yungas.

She needs the loan to buy more stuffed toys to diversify her products and earn more income to support her family.

Isabel is married and has four children she lives with in her own house in the city of La Paz’s Achachicala zone.  This is the first time she works with IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy more stuffed toys to sell.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou  est âgée de 52 ans. Elle habite au Sénégal. Elle évolue dans le secteur du commerce depuis plus de 5 ans. Elle vend des tissus, des draps, des écharpes, des chaussures et des sacs. C’est une activité qu’elle a choisi par passion dans le but de se procurer une occupation. Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus dans son activité ce sont les gains. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 27 et  34 ans. Elle est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis décembre 2011.Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour acheter des tissus et des chaussures à revendre. Elle veut augmenter son fond de roulement, accroitre ses bénéfices  ^pour participer a l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou is 52 years old and lives in Senegal.  She has been involved in retail business for more than five years.  She sells fabrics, sheets, scarves, shoes and handbags.  As she was looking for an occupation, she chose this activity because she really liked it.  She is particularly interested in the earnings generated by her activity.

Fatou is married and the mother of four children whose ages range between 27 and 34 years.  She has been a member of one of the branches of UIMCEC since December 2011.  She is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs for the purchase of fabrics and shoes for resale.  She wants to increase her working capital and her profits in order to take part in the improvement of her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Josue Daniel

texts.es: El joven Josue  es una  persona  que  día con día se  esfuerza  por salir  adelante, el  actualmente   tiene   una  estética   la  cual le   permite  obtener  ingresos,  el se acerco a la institución ya que  requiere  realizar  la compra  de materia  prima  para   su  negocio,  ya que  nos comenta  que  sus  clientes   han   ido  incrementando de manera  satisfactoria, agradece   el  apoyo  brindado para  la realización de  su  proyecto ya que  le  permitira seguir  brindando a  sus clientes  el excelente servicio que  lo caracteriza.
texts.en: Josue is a young man who works hard to make headway from day to day. He currently has a beauty salon that allows him to make a living. He is turning to Kiva partner Credituyo because he wishes to purchase supplies for his business since he tells us his salon is attracting more customers at a satisfactory rate. He is grateful for the support in carrying out this project, which will allow him to keep providing his customers with the excellent service he is known for.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for his beauty salon.

loans.name: Rudy

texts.es:
Rudy, trabaja como conductor asalariado dentro de un sindicato de transporte público en la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento del vehiculo ya que no cuenta con más ingresos que los provenientes de su profesión de conductor para mantener a su familia.
Rudy, es soltero y tiene dos hijos, también esta a cargo de sus hermanos menores ya que son huérfanos de padres.  Viven en una casa en alquiler en la zona Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Rudy works as a salaried driver in one of the city of La Paz’s transportation syndicates.  He needs the loan to service the vehicle because his only source of income to support his family is what he earns from his profession as a driver.

Rudy is single and has two children; he’s also caring for two younger siblings who are orphans.  They live in a rented house in the city of La Paz’s Pasankeri zone.  This is the first time he’s worked with IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle service and maintenance.

loans.name: Duo Mujeres De Poaquil Group

texts.es: Leidy se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano ella necesita el capital para compra de materia prima para poder elaborar mas tejidos tipicos ya que por la epoca es cuando mas se vende es por eso que esta solicitando este credito, ellos son hermanos y quieren empezar  su propio negocio ya que ellos miran hoy en dia la vida es muy duro y cuesta encontrar un  trabajo para poder sostenerse, por eso necesitan este crédito para que sus sueños de tener su propio negocio se haga una realidad.
texts.en: Leidy makes a living hand-weaving traditional items. She is requesting the loan to purchase supplies to be able to weave more items since this is the time where she sells the most products. She and Eswin are siblings and they want to start their own business because they see how hard life is from day to day and the difficulties in finding a job to sustain one's self. It's for this reason they need this loan, so their dreams of having their own business can become a reality.

loans.use: to purchase weaving supplies.

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en:
Ganbold is a 51-year-old man who lives with his wife and 3 children in Dornogovi province in Southern Mongolia. He has been running an auto repair business for 7 years with his wife and children. When they moved to the center of the province, he started the business activity offering a few services inside his fence. Now the types of service have been extended and he has made many regular customers, not only in the area but from the neighboring provinces. He has just bought two broken-down cars at a lower price and is planning to buy some necessary spare parts to repair them. 

Ganbold is a talented man in his field and says, "I would like to repair these two cars by buying motors and some spare parts. I plan to sell them after repairing them." The total amount he is requesting is 1,000,000 MNT to buy the motors and some spare parts for the cars.

loans.use: To buy motors and some spare parts for two cars

loans.name: Maritza Maribel

texts.es:
La cliente Maritza curso hasta la secundaria, durante ese tiempo sufrió bastante por la crisis económica que atravesó su padre, al perder toda la mercadería que transportaba. Específicamente se dedicaba a la comercialización de celulares y lentes que el traía, fue tan dura la vida para su familia entera por lo cual tuvieron que pasar hambre se encontraban totalmente en la ruina
Esta situasion motivo a Maritza a independizarse trabajando como ayudante en costura desde ese momento aprendió a costurar prendas de vestir para mujer nativa ya que su madre se dedicaba a la misma actividad, ahora ella se dedica a la confeccion y venta de estas prendas.
Maritza cuenta con su propio negocio y tiene mucha clientela, por ello ha desidido incrementar su capital asi podra generar mas ingresos, por tal motivo solicito el credito que le ayudara mucho.
texts.en: Maritza has a high school education, during which time she suffered quite a bit financially when her father lost all the merchandise he was transporting. Specifically, she was making a living selling the cell phones and glasses that her father was bringing. It was very hard on her entire family, which was in shambles as they had to go hungry. This situation motivated Maritza to go out on her own and work as a sewing assistant, and she learned how to sew traditional women's garments since her mother made a living in the same activity. Now she makes a living sewing and selling these items. Maritza has her own business and has a large customer base, and she wants to increase her working capital so she can generate more income. She is requesting the loan because it will help her a lot.

loans.use: to purchase sewing supplies.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is 29 years old. A businessman, he is married to Jennifer, a business lady. They are blessed with one child. Raphael has been running a spare parts business for the past two years with the monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his  loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Raphael will use the loan to purchase a stock of spare parts for his shop. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his child. His hopes and dreams are to expand his business which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of spare parts for his shop

loans.name: Orlom

texts.en:
Orlom is a 41-year-old woman who lives with her husband and 2 children in the suburban area of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her older son studies at a college and the younger son goes to secondary school. She opened a food store in 2007. Since that, the business has expanded and more types of products are sold. She runs the business with her husband in the local area. 

Orlom is a prudent woman who says, "I would like to develop the business by purchasing supplies in large quantities. I am planning to open a second store soon so that I can improve my livelihood and pay for my son's college tuition fees." The total amount she is requesting is 3,000,000 MNT to buy food and other products.

loans.use: To buy food and other products

loans.name: Baya

texts.en: Baya is a 25-year-old married woman with two children, both enrolled in school. She sells foodstuffs to the local residents and sells her goods in a shop. She has been in the business for the last 3 years. Baya intends to use the Ksh. 15,000 to add to her stock of wheat flour and maize flour. Her goal is to open a new kiosk in the future. She joined Yehu so as to access loans to expand her business. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water, and her monthly expenses include food for the family.

loans.use: to add to her stock of wheat flour and maize flour

loans.name: Daisy Francisca

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Daysi, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 17 y 5 años de edad, el menor estudia en una  escuela de la localidad. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de productos  Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad por lo cual cuenta con buena clientela que siempre le compran.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, entre otros productos. Lleva más de 12 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Sus sueños son tener una lancha nueva para que su esposo realice sus faenas de pesca.
texts.en:
The "Virgen Del Mar" communal bank meets every two weeks in the beautiful seaside resort of San Mateo in the city of Manta. It is known for its lovely beaches, which are very popular year-round with tourists from around the country and abroad. Here the majority of the inhabitants fish, and make their living from the sea.

This is where we met Daysi. She is 23, married, and has two children, ages 17 and 5. The youngest goes to a local school. Her husband is a fisherman.

She is a very good housewife, who in order to earn her own income and help her husband with the household expenses, sells Yanbal beauty products such as cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies' accessories. She works three days a week, from two to three hours a day. She sells her products on credit, and collects weekly. She has been doing this work for more than 10 years, so she has a good clientele who always buy from her.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and other products. She has been part of the communal bank for 12 years, and likes it because the payments are easy to make.
 
Her dream is to have a new boat so that her husband can do his fishing.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a 30-year-old married woman with 6 children, all in school. She has been operating a green grocer business for the past 6 years and aspires to open another stall in the future. She describes poor roads to be her challenge in transporting goods. With the KES 15,000, she intends to purchase onions and tomatoes. 

Rehema joined Yehu to access cheap loans. Most of her monthly expenditure is on food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

loans.use: to purchase onions and tomatoes.

loans.name: Malolit

texts.en:
This is Malolit, 34, a resident of Baseco, Manila, Philippines. She is a single parent to her adopted child. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Malolit operates a salon business. She offers hair styling, hair grooming, manicure, pedicure, and the like. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 1000 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy supplies for her salon like shampoo, hair treatment creams and oils, and other things needed for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Malolit dreams of being able to give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and products needed in her business

loans.name: Zafarjon

texts.ru: Зафарчон добрый и трудолюбивый семьянин, который на воспитании имеет четверых детей. Жена является педагогом. Он более 6 лет занимается перевозкой людей(такси). Зафарчон хотел бы получить займ для постройки жилого дома, чтобы жить  в красивом благоустроенном доме. Зафарчон надеется на вашу помощь. Он хочет сказать, что ваша помощь очень нужна ему и он заранее благодарен вам за вашу щедрость и поддержку.
texts.en: Zafarjon is a kind and hardworking family man who is raising four children. His wife is a teacher.  He has been offering transportation services to people (taxi services) for more than six years.  Zafarjon would like to receive a loan to build a house, so that he can live in a nice, well-equipped home.  He looks forward to your help.  He would like to add that he really needs your help, and he thanks you in advance for your generosity and support.

loans.use: to build a house.

loans.name: Clarita Martha

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Clarita, ella tiene  38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 23, 22 y de 13 años de edad, el menor  estudian en escuela, los dos menores aun viven en su casa. Su esposo se dedica al comercio.

Ella para ganar algo por su cuenta se dedica a la venta productos por catálogos de Avon y Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja tres a cuatro días a la semana,  aprovecha cuando llegan los pescadores de alta mar ya que en esos días ellos tiene bastante dinero y es cuando más compran, ella deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente. Lleva más de 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien.

Ella está repitiendo el crédito, nos cuenta que como siempre los créditos le ayudan mucho, tanto para su negocio como para su vida familiar, ya que las ganancias las utiliza para ayudar a su hijo con sus estudios. Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y otros productos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde que se inicio el grupo y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Sus sueños es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The "Virgen Del Mar" communal bank meets every two weeks in the beautiful seaside resort of San Mateo in the city of Manta. It is known for its lovely beaches, which are very popular year-round with tourists from around the country and abroad. Here the majority of the inhabitants fish, and make their living from the sea.

This is where we met Clarita. She is 38, married, and has three children, ages 23, 22, and 13. The youngest goes to school, and the two youngest still live in her home. Her husband is a merchant.

In order to earn something on her own, she sells Avon and Yanbal products by catalog, such as beauty items, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies' accessories. She sells door-to-door, and works three or four days a week.  She makes good use of the times when the fishermen arrive from the high seas, as on those days they have quite a bit of money, and it's when they buy the most. She sells on credit and collects weekly. She has been doing this work for more than 7 years, and it's going very well.

She is taking out another loan, and tells us that as always, the loans help her a great deal, both in terms of her business and her family life; as she uses the earnings to help her son with his schooling.

She is going to use this loan to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams and other products. She has been part of the communal bank since it began, and likes it because of the help they give through the loans.

Her dream is to move forward in her business.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams, etc.

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
El señor Vidal tiene 68 años de edad, tiene cuatro hijos. Él se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde que tiene 12 años de edad, cultiva 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz.

Los insumos agrícolas los compra los días miércoles en una comunidad, para llegar ahí camina treinta minutos a pie hasta donde aborda el vehiculo que lo conduce a la comunidad y tarda cuarenta y cinco minutos en llegar o una hora.

El préstamo que solicita a Fundación Campo, es para comprar insumos agrícolas y para pago de mano de obra. Con el préstamo Vidal dispondrá de capital de trabajo para realizar sus cultivos que es el sustento de su familia. Al final la producción de maíz que obtenga la podrá vender en la temporada que siempre la vende y sus ingresos serán mayores.

Él piensa dejarles a su hijos la tierra donde trabaja, que es propia y espera que ellos continúen trabajando en la agricultura y con las hortalizas que es otro trabajo que piensa realizar.
texts.en:
Vidal is 68 years old and has 4 children. He has been working as a farmer since he was 12 years old. He farms 14,000 square meters of corn. 

He buys his farming supplies on Wednesdays in a nearby community; to get there he walks 30 minutes to where can get a ride, and from that point it takes another 45 minutes to an hour to arrive.  

The loan that he has requested through 'Fundación Campo' is to buy farming supplies and to pay for labor. With the loan Vidal will have capital to be able to maintain his crops and support his family. In the end, the corn that he harvests he will be able to sell in the season that it is always sold and his profits will be improved. 

He plans on leaving the land that he plants on to his children, since he owns it. He hopes that they will continue to work in agriculture, as well as grow vegetables, which is something else he plans to do.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Mwatime

texts.en:
Mwatime is a married woman with 3 children, all attending school. She operates a green grocer's and sells her goods at the market. She has been in the business for 3 years and sells her goods to her neighbors. 

Mwatime intends to use the loan of KES 15,000 to add to her stock of tomatoes and onions. High transportation cost is her major challenge. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She aims to open a kiosk. Mwatime cites food as her main monthly expenditure.

loans.use: to add to her stock of tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
This is Liza, 40, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Roberto, her business partner, and she is a mother to her four children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Liza operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Liza hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries, toiletries and beverages for her inventory.

loans.name: Jorge Sigfredo

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero. Desde los 12 años empezó a trabajar con su papá en la venta de ganado. Antes de dedicarse a la venta de ganado él era jornalero.

El préstamo que solicita a Fundación Campo, es para comprar dos vacas y para la compra de comida para el ganado. Con la inversión él tendrá mejores oportunidades de continuar trabajando con ganado, el cual le genera buenos ingresos a él y a su papá. Jorge desea seguir con su trabajo y construir su casa en un terreno que su papá le ha dado.
texts.en: Jorge is 24 years old and single. He started working with his father 12 years ago selling livestock. Before making a living in livestock he was a day laborer. He is requesting the loan from Kiva partner Fundación Campo with the plan to purchase two cows and livestock feed. With this investment he will have better opportunities of continuing working in this activity, which generates good income for him and his father. Jorge wishes to keep working and build a home on the land his father has given him.

loans.use: to purchase two cows and livestock feed.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel, junto a toda su familia se dedica al espectáculo ya que tienen su orquesta y prestan sus servicios para todo tipo de festejos.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una batería electrónica para su orquesta ya que les ayudara mucho para completar la orquesta y esto mejorará sus ingresos económicos.
Miguel, es casado y tiene tres hijos con los cuales vive en casa propia en la zona El Tejar de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la tercera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Miguel along with his entire family are entertainers since they have an orchestra and provide service at all sorts of festivities.  He needs the loan to buy an electronic drum set for his orchestra which will be of much help to complete the orchestra and this will improve his income.

Miguel is married and has three children he lives with in his own house in the city of La Paz’s El Tejar zone.  This is the third time he’s worked with IMPRO and second with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy an electronic drum set for his band.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es: La señorita Amanda tiene 29 años, termino el colegio con dinero que ella ganaba siendo ayudante de costura de su tía, no tiene conviviente y tampoco hijos, fue criada por sus padres, cuando estaba en el colegio falleció su madre y su padre decidió no colaborarle con sus estudios, la única ayuda que tubo para estudiar en la universidad fue de sus tíos, un tiempo mas adelante ella decidió viajar donde uno de sus tíos en Brasil y dejar su carrera para seguir trabajando en la costura y así ganar algo de dinero. Ella se vino de Brasil, esta viviendo junto a sus tíos a los cuales le paga alquiler por la pieza donde habita. La solicitante como tiene experiencia en el rubro de la costura esta iniciando su negocio propio en Cochabamba asociándose con su tía. La señorita Amanda esta solicitando el crédito para comprar maquinas de costura y así ser independiente. Esto le permitirá tener mejores ingresos y piensa en terminar su carrera mas adelante.
texts.en: Amanda is 29 years old. She was able to finish high school, paying for it with money that she earned working as a helper to her aunt, who is a seamstress. She is single and does not have any children. When she was in high school her mother passed away and her father decided not to continue helping her pay for her studies. The only support she had while studying came from her aunts and uncles. Later on she decided to travel to where one of her uncles lives in Brazil, to stop studying to be able to continue working as a seamstress and in this way earn an income. She has since returned from Brazil and now lives with her aunt and uncle, to whom she pays rent. Since she has experience in the work of a seamstress, she is partnering with her aunt to open a business in Cochabamba. Amanda is requesting the loan to buy sewing machines, so that she has her own equipment. This will allow her to have improved income and she is considering continuing to study later on down the road.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia, trabaja como empleada dentro de una empresa privada que se encarga de la belleza corporal en la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para pagar el costo de un tratamiento para el cáncer de su madre ya que se encuentra muy delicada de salud.
Claudia, es soltera y tiene un hijo con el cual vive en una casa en anticrético en la zona Santa Rosa de la ciudad de La Paz. 
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Claudia is employed at a private firm involved with the beauty industry in the city of La Paz.  She needs the loan to pay for her mother’s cancer treatments who is in very delicate health.

Claudia is single and has a son she lives with in a house under the “anticrético” mode [transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract.  If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you] in the city of La Paz’s Santa Rosa zone.  This is the second time she’s worked with IMPRO and first with KIVA.

loans.use: to pay for her mother's cancer treatments.

loans.name: Severo

texts.es:
Severo, trabaja como conductor propietario en transporte libre de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento de su vehículo ya que es la única fuente de trabajo que tiene para mantener  a su familia.
Severo, es soltero y tiene tres hijos con los cuales vive en una casa en alquiler en la zona Norte de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Severo works as a driver/owner providing taxi services in the city of La Paz.  He needs the loan to pay to service his vehicle since it’s his only source of work to support his family.

Severo is single and has three children he lives with in a rented house in the city of La Paz’s Norte zone.  This is the first time he’s worked with IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to pay to service his taxi.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo, trabaja como empleado en una Institución Pública de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una computadora ya que le será muy útil para el y sus hijos que están en la escuela.
Ricardo, es casado y tiene tres hijos, viven en la casa de sus padres en la zona Villa Fátima de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Ricardo works for a public institution in the city of La Paz.  He needs the loan to buy a computer that will be very useful for him and for his children who are attending school.  Ricardo is married and has three children.  They live in his parents’ house in the city of La Paz’s Fátima zone.  This is the first time he’s worked with IMPRO and with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy a computer for his and his children's personal use.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos, trabaja como Contador General en un Banco de la ciudad de La Paz, también cuenta con ingresos de su jubilación y trabaja horas extras como abogado el cual le pagan por honorarios profesionales según facturas que emite.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de mercadería ya que su esposa se dedica  a la venta de cosméticos y perfumes para ambos sexos.
Carlos, es casado y tiene dos hijos, vive en una casa en alquiler en la zona Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la primera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Carlos works as a general accountant in a bank in the city of La Paz.  He also earns retirement income and works extra hours as an attorney that he’s paid professional honoraria for according to the bills he submits.

He needs the loan to buy merchandise because his wife sells cosmetics and perfumery for both sexes.  Carlos is married and has two children.  He lives in a rented house in the city of La Paz’s Irpavi zone.  This is the second time he’s worked with IMPRO and first with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and perfume for his wife's business.

loans.name: Marythza

texts.es:
Marythza, trabaja como supervisora en una empresa privada, también cuenta con ingresos ya que independientemente vende cosméticos y perfumes.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar más cosméticos y obtener mejores ingresos para mantener a su familia.
Marythza es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos con los cuales vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona Obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la quinta vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la tercera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Marythza works as a supervisor in a private firm and also earns additional income independently selling cosmetics and perfumes.  She needs the loan to buy more cosmetics to earn better income to support her family.  

Marythza is a single mother of two children she lives with in her parents’ house in the city of La Paz’s Obrajes zone.  This is the fifth time she’s worked with IMPRO and third with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy more perfume and cosmetics.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, trabaja como empleada en una fabrica de costura y también recibe ingresos de su vehiculo el cual trabaja como taxi.
El crédito lo requiere para la reparación (mantenimiento y compra de pastillas para los frenos) de su vehiculo ya que cuenta con ingresos diarios para mantener a su familia.
Juana, es soltera y tiene tres hijos vive en casa propia en la zona Pura Pura de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Juana works as an employee in a sewing factory and also earns extra income from her vehicle that works as a taxi.  She needs the loan to repair (maintenance and purchase of brake pads) her vehicle because she relies on its daily income to support her family.

Juana is single and has three children; she lives in her own house in the city of La Paz’s Pura Pura zone.  This is the first time she works with Impro and with Kiva.

loans.use: to service and to repair her taxi's brakes.

loans.name: Django

texts.es:
Django, trabaja como odontólogo en una clínica privada en la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de equipo radiográfico para su consultorio particular y de esta forma tener más ingresos.
Django, es soltero y no tiene hijos vive en casa propia en la zona Pura Pura la misma ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Django works as a dentist in a private clinic in the city of La Paz.  He needs the loan to buy x-ray equipment for his private office in order to have more income.

Django is single and does not have any children.  He lives in his own house in the city of La Paz’s Pura Pura zone.  This is the second time he’s worked with IMPRO and second with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy x-ray equipment for his dental clinic.

loans.name: Edita Dioselina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Edita, tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, ambos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella  tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa, allí vende productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, allí también vende deliciosos helados que ella prepara y que son de mucho agrado de sus clientes,  lleva en este negocio por más de 5 años y nos comenta que desde que está recibiendo los créditos se le ha hecho más fácil poder surtir su local. 

Ella está repitiendo el crédito, nos cuenta que gracias a las ganancias obtenidas en este ciclo está comprando unas sillas y mesas para que cuando lleguen los turistas hasta el lugar puedan consumir sus helados y bebidas que vende en su local, en cuanto a los pagos ella ha estado muy bien ya que es muy cumplida con sus obligaciones y así no tiene problemas para el nuevo crédito que esta por recibir. Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, entre otros productos. Lleva cuatro ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le  da el banco.

Sus sueños es seguir adelante y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
The "Virgen Del Mar" communal bank meets every two weeks in the beautiful seaside resort of San Mateo in the city of Manta. It is known for its lovely beaches, which are very popular year-round with tourists from around the country and abroad. Here the majority of the inhabitants fish, and make their living from the sea.

This is where we met Edita. She is 48, married, and has two children, who are already adults; both still live in her home. Her husband is a fisherman.

She has a grocery store in her home, and there she sells products such as rice, sugar, cooking oils, dishwashing liquid and other items. She works every day from 6:00am to 9:00pm, and sometimes later. There she also sells delicious ice cream that she prepares and that her customers love. She has been in this business for more than five years, and tells us that since she started receiving the loans, it has been easier for her to supply her store. 

She is taking out another loan, and tells us that thanks to her earnings in this loan cycle she is buying some tables and chairs so that when tourists come to her place, they can consume their ice cream and drinks that she sells in her store. She has done very well with respect to the payments, as she has  fulfilled all her obligations, and so has no problem with the new loan that she is about to receive. 

She is going to use this loan to further supply her store. She is going to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, dishwashing liquid, and other products. She has been with the communal bank for four loan cycles, and likes it because of the help the bank gives her.

Her dream is to keep progressing, and enjoy good health.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, dishwashing liquid and other household products.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna, trabaja como empleada en una Institución Policial en la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para el pago de un anticrético (es una forma legal de vivir en un departamento o casa o habitación por un monto acordado entre el dueño de casa y el inquilino, por un periodo de tiempo no mayor a dos años, al cabo del cual el dueño de casa se compromete a devolver la totalidad del dinero) y así poder vivir en forma independiente con su pequeño hijo. 
Reyna, es soltera y tiene un hijo con el cual vive actualmente en la casa de sus padres en la zona Kalajahuira de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Reyna works as an employee for a police department in the city of La Paz.  She needs the loan to pay for an “anticrético” (a legal way of living in a house or apartment for an agreed-upon amount between owner and tenant for a period no greater than two years at the end of which the owner of the house must return the full amount of money) so that she can live independently with her small son.

Reyna is single and has a son she lives with at present in her parents’ house in the city of La Paz’s Kalajahuira zone.  It’s the first time she’s worked with IMPRO and with KIVA.

loans.use: to pay her "anticrético" so she can live independently with her son.

loans.name: Siomara Del Socorro

texts.es: Siomara Del Socorro es una emprendedora que se le apoyado en el financiamiento en la compra de productos que ofrecerle a sus clientes, esta emprendedora ya ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000 en el cual ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con deseos de superación. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para la compra cosméticos para sus clientes ya tiene pedido pendiente para entregar, con el crédito comprara, tratamientos, shampoo, acondicionadores, lápiz labial, brillos, pintura de uñas entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Siomara Del Socorro is an entrepreneur who has relied on loans to buy products to sell her customers.  This entrepreneur has been working with Fundación León 2000 and has shown herself to be a responsible person with the wish to improve.

She is asking for a loan at present to buy cosmetics for her customers since she already has pending orders to fill.  She will use the loan to buy treatments, shampoo, conditioner, lip gloss, lipstick and nail polish, among other products.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Eduardo Enrique

texts.es:
Eduardo es un joven de 22 años, que ha aprendido a independizarse y progresar solo en la vida, por lo que se siente muy contento y feliz. El disfruta mucho de escuchar música en sus tiempos libre o cuando realiza su labor, también se puede decir que disfruta mucho de la comida de la tierra que lo vio nacer (Ica, Perú), unos de sus platillos favoritos es el popular “Ceviche” y también disfruta de los “Tallarines”.

Para poder ganar el dinero que Eduardo necesita diariamente para sus necesidades personales, se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte público en una moto taxi que compró gracias a su esfuerzo en el otro trabajo que tiene, obrero de fabricación de tableros electrónicos, con un poco de disciplina ha podido ahorrar dinero y así ha comprado la moto taxi que tanto deseaba para de ese modo poder convertirse en un microempresario.

Eduardo está seguro que su negocio tiene éxito porque constantemente les brinda un buen servicio a sus clientes, ahora él desea poder comprar un juego de llantas, toldo, mica, puertas delanteras y realizarle un pintado a su moto taxi debido a que ya está algo vieja y necesita un mantenimiento general. Con este apoyo Eduardo se siente capaz de poder brindar mayor seguridad a sus clientes, de esa manera quiere incrementar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá tener una moto super-operativa y juntar el dinero que desea para comprar 2 moto taxis y rentarlas, lo que lo llevará a incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Eduardo is a young man of 22 who had to learn to go out on his own and make progress by himself, for which he feels content and happy. He really enjoys to listen to music in his free time or when he is at work. It also can be said that he really like the native food in Ica, Peru. One of his favorite dishes is the popular ceviche, and he also likes "tallarines" (noodles). In order to make the money he needs on a daily basis, he makes a living providing a motor taxi service. He bought the vehicle thanks to his hard work at his other job as an employee at an electronics manufacturer. With a little discipline he was able to save money and buy the motor taxi he so wanted to be able to turn himself into a small businessman. Eduardo is sure that this business will be successful because he constantly provides good service to his customers. Now he wants to purchase a set of tires, a marquee, tail lights, rear doors and paint his vehicle since it's somewhat old and needs general maintenance. With this support Eduardo feels capable of being able to provide his customers with more security and increase his income. This will allow him to have a highly operational vehicle as he collects the money to purchase two more motor taxis that he can rent out. In this way he will increase his profits and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a set of tires, a marquee, tail lights, rear doors and paint for his motor taxi.

loans.name: Alexandra Karina

texts.es:
Alexandra tiene 40 años de edad vive en la zona de Miraflores de La Paz, ella es madre soltera y vive en casa de su mama ya que su papa se fallecio hace mucho tiempo.
Alexandra es una persona que es dinamica que comenzó a trabajar desde joven a sus 20 años vendiendo productos por catálogo de las líneas de cosmeticos con esta actividad aporta en los gastos familiares y paga los gastos de su pequeño niño, cuenta con 4 años de experiencia en este rubro, actualmente se dedica a este rubro casi la mayoría de su tiempo,pero tambien ella da clases es profesora Sicopedagoga para poder salir adelante y   generar mayores ingresos para su familia. 
Ella se dedica  a trabajar  para poder ayudar en casa a los gastos familiares, el crédito es para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería para el negocio ella tiene mucha experiencia en esto y tiene una buena cartera de clientes.
El Objetivo, el sueño fundamental de Alexandra es tener un negocio prospero que le de un mejor futuro  asi poder vivir bien e independizarse y poder comprarle a su mama una casa propia.
texts.en:
Alexandra, 40, lives in the Miraflores zone in La Paz.  She’s a single mother living in her mother’s house since her father died long ago.  Alexandra is a dynamic person who started working young at the age of 20 selling cosmetics via catalogue.  With this activity she contributes to family expenses and pays her small child’s expenses.  She has four years’ experience in this line of work.  She currently spends most of her time in this line of work but she also teaches classes to be able to get ahead and generate higher income for her family; she’s an educational psychologist.

She works to help with family expenses and the loan is to buy larger amounts of merchandise for the business.  She has much experience in this and a good number of clients.  Alexandra’s objective, her basic dream, is to have a prosperous business that will give her a better future so that she can live well and independently and be able to buy her mother a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Villa De Pescadores Villa Paso 3 Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre kuña Aty Villa de Pescadores Villa Paso III se conformo en el año 2011. Actualmente está en el 2do ciclo, en donde todas ellas trabajan muy arduamente para poder ayudar a sus familias por medio de su trabajo.
La Sra. Claudia es una de las miembros, ella es la presidenta del comité y cuenta que se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de pescados, con lo cual y con mucho esfuerzo puede mantener a su familia y darles el día a día. Su meta es tener una gran pescadería y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo como microempresaria, es por ello que siempre se esfuerza al máximo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de un freezer, para que de esa forma pueda mantener frescos sus pescados y no tenga que tirarlos por el calor. Agradece por la oportunidad de crecimiento que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
The “Kuña Aty Villa de Pescadores Villa Paso III” women’s committee formed in 2011.  It’s currently in its second cycle where they are all working hard to help their families by way of their work.  

Claudia is one of the members.  She’s the committee president and she relates that she sells all types of fish which with much effort makes it possible for her to support her family and provide for their daily needs.  Her goal is to have a great fish store to continue growing as a micro businesswoman and this is why she always strives to the maximum degree.

She asks for the loan to buy a freezer so that she can keep her fish fresh and not have to throw them away because of the heat.  She is grateful for the growth opportunity she’s receiving.

loans.use: to buy a freezer to store fish.

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.es:
La  Sra.  Pelagia  tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo que va a la escuela, el cual es el motivo de lucha de Pelagia, quien es de la ciudad de Carapeguá.
Ella es hija de un comerciante muy conocido en la zona, y nos comenta que desde muy pequeña empezó a trabajar con su padre en el negocio, y con la ayuda de él logró montar su propio negocio donde compra y ventas de ropas de todo tipo y marca. Actualmente ya tiene clientela formada en la zona y así aumenta su pedido de prendas. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ya pudo construirse una pequeña casita. También sigue administrando junto con su padre la despensa familiar.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de camisas, remeras, short, y otros que en están temporada ya que le solicitan mucho sus clientes. Esta agradecida por la ayuda que está recibiendo pues todo lo que ella hace es por darle lo mejor a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Pelagia, 28, is a single mother; she has a son attending school who is Pelagia’s reason to strive.  She’s from the city of Carapeguá.  She’s the daughter of a very well-known local merchant and she comments that since she was very little she started working with her father in the business and with his help managed to open her own business where she sells all types and brands of clothes.  She currently has a well established clientele in the zone and her clothes orders increase accordingly.  Thanks to her effort and dedication she has been able to build a little house for herself.  She also continues running the family store with her father.

She’s asking for the loan to buy shirts, t-shirts, shorts and other clothes that are in season and that her customers ask her for a lot.  She is grateful for the support she’s receiving because everything she does is in order to provide her little son with the best.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a 50-year-old married woman with five children, all in school. She sells coconuts at wholesale from home. She also does mat weaving, which contributes to her other source of income. She intends to use the loan of KES 20,000 to pay school fees for her children. She has been in this business for the last eight years and aims to open a depot for the same business. Her customers include her neighbors and retailers. Fatuma owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. She joined Yehu to get loans to boost her business. Food is her greatest monthly expense.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is 31 years old and married with two children. He runs a general shop and a bookstore to earn a living. He has been in the business for four years and describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business and hopes to own a wholesale shop in the future. He has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy books to sell.

loans.use: To buy books to sell

loans.name: Sarly

texts.es: Sarly ha sido cliente de Fundación Mujer desde el 2005,los créditos que se le han dado han sido para invertir en la compra de equipo y materiales que utiliza en su salón de belleza, cuya actividad realiza desde aproximadamente 10 años. En esta ocasión Sarly ha solicitado un pequeño crédito para poder cubrir los gastos de trámite de su divorcio ya que si saca ese dinero de su capital de trabajo , esto le afectaría la compra de su material de trabajo. Es por esta razón y la trayectoria que ella tiene como cliente de Fundación Mujer que le ha sido aprovada su solicitud de crédito.
texts.en: Sarly has been a client of Fundación Mujer since 2005.  She has used her loans to invest in equipment and supplies to use in her beauty salon.  She has had this business for approximately 10 years.  Sarly has reqeusted a small loan this time to be able to cover the costs of her divorce since if she took this money from her working capital, it would affect her business.  This is the reason and the path that she has as a client of Fundación Mujer and she has been approved for her loan request.

loans.use: to pay for a lawyer.

loans.name: Luz Y Salvación Group

texts.es:
El grupo luz y salvación lo conforman cuatro personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Esperanza de 39 años. Ella se dedica al comercio de nacatamales este negocio lo inicio realizando unos cuantos nacatamales para ver si se vendían y poco a poco fue aumentando su negocio. Ella invertirá en la compra de un cerdo para realizar este típico platillo nicaragüense. 

Las otras integrantes son Francis quien vende perfume, prendas de oro y plata, Thelma quien trabaja en costura y tiene una pulpería y Isabel quien tiene un taller de costura.
texts.en:
The “Luz y Salvación” (Light and Salvation) group is composed of four hardworking, enterprising women.  One of them is Esperanza, 39.  She sells nacatamales [Nicaraguan-style tamales] a business she started with just a few nacatamales to see how well they sold and gradually she increased her business.  She will buy a pig to make this traditional Nicaraguan dish.

The other group members are Francis who sells perfume and gold and silver jewelry, Thelma who is a seamstress and has a grocery store and Isabel who has a sewing workshop.

loans.use: to buy pork, corn, rice, etc.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucia is 40 years old and a business lady who is married to Joseph, a businessman. They are blessed with three children. She has been running a retail shop for the past eight years with a monthly income of KES 6,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Lucia will use the loan to purchase a stock of sugar, rice and maize meal. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice and maize meal

loans.name: Kathia Evelyn

texts.es:
Kathia es una mujer de 30 años, madre de 2 pequeños, el mayor de 19 y el menor de 8, los cuales son el motivo que la impulsa a trabajar día a día con el fin de ofrecerles lo mejor que pueda. Kathia y su esposo, constantemente se apoyan mucho, ya que saben que juntos forman la base de su familia y desean poder dar lo mejor de sí cada uno, junto al otro.
