El esposo de Kathia se dedica a la construcción, lo que les permitió juntar un poco de dinero y así ella pudiese poner la bodega que tanto quería, ya que esto la ha ayudado a poder convertirse en una microempresario sin alejarse mucho de sus hijos, ya que su bodega se encuentra en la parte delantera de la casa en donde actualmente vive con su familia.

Actualmente ella desea poder comprar una nevera y también comprar algunos productos para su bodega, tales como (Arroz, Atún, Café, Bebidas, etc), lo que le permitirá incrementar sus ganancias, ya que sus clientes constantemente empiezan a comprarle casa vez más y necesita tener los productos más solicitados. Ella está muy agradecida con el apoyo que se le está brindado ya que así va poder mejorar su bodega y convertirse en una microempresaria de éxito.
texts.en: Kathia is a 30-year-old mother of two children, ages 19 and 8, who are her motivation to work every day so she can give them the best she can. Kathia and her husband constantly support each other, because they know together they form the base of the family and want to each give his or her best. Her husband makes a living in construction, which allowed him to put some money aside that Kathia could use to set up the convenience store she so wanted. This helped turn Kathia into a small businesswoman without straying far from her children, since the store is in the back of her family's home. Currently she wants to purchase a refrigerator and some products for her store like rice, tuna, coffee, beverage, etc. This will allow her to increase her profits, since her customers are constantly buying more each time and she needs to have the products they most demand. She is very grateful for the support because in this way she can improve her store and grow as a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and grocery supplies (rice, tuna, coffee, beverages, etc.)

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda, 53, a resident of Manila, Philippines. Her husband is William. She is a mother of five children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Erlinda maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others.  A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 3,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan to buy more orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Erlinda hopes to be more successful on her business and dreams to be able to give her children a good future and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to fill her customers' orders

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a 45-year-old businessman married to Judith. They are blessed with two children. He has been running an electrical installation shop for the past 10 years with a monthly income of KES 15,000, which he uses to support his family members. 

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Martin will use the loan to buy electronic cables for his shop.

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open branches of his shop.

loans.use: to buy electronic cables for his shop

loans.name: Toluca Group

texts.es:
El siguiente grupo se llama "Toluca", está ubicado en la localidad de Santo Domingo de Guzmán en el municipio de Ixtlahuaca, ésta es una localidad que cuenta con todos los servicios públicos y con muchos locales comerciales, como abarrotes, panaderías, pollerías, carnicerías, etc., este grupo que a la vez es un grupo familiar, decidió ponerle este nombre a su grupo, ya que ellos son muy aficionados al fútbol, y el equipo de su preferencia es el "Toluca" esto los motiva a ellos pues los toman como ejemplo, dicen que en el juego se pierde y se gana, lo que importa es no desanimarse y ellos lo relacionan con la vida, en la vida hay victorias y derrotas, pero ellos dicen que nunca se rinden ante las dificultades de la vida, esta es una familia muy unida y emprendedora, el nombre de los integrantes de este grupo y sus actividades son las siguientes:
1.- Agustín S. (COMPRA DE HUEVO, AZUCAR, JABON, ACEITE, LECHE, ETC. POR CAJAS PARA VENDER)
2.- Susana Adilene S. (COMPRA DE SOPAS, MERMELADA, DESECHABLES, PAPEL HIGIENICO ETC. PARA VENDER)
3.- Lourdes G. (COMPRA DE DULCES, REFRESCOS, PRODUCTOS DE HIELO, AGUA EN GARRAFON, ETC. PARA VENDER)
4.- Guadalupe Abigail S. (COMPRA DE LACTEOS, GALLETAS, ATUN, SARDINA, ETC. PARA VENDER)

El señor Agustín además de ser el padre de esta familia, es el representante de este grupo, él tiene 40 años de edad, está casado desde hace 21 años con la señora Lourdes, la cual se dedica al hogar y a atender su negocio. El señor Agustín y su familia solicitan este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de huevo, azúcar, jabón, aceite, leche, sopa, mermelada, desechables, papel higiénico, dulces, refresco, agua, galletas, atún, sardina, etc. para su negocio que es una miscelánea la cual tiene ya 15 años de estar funcionand. Esta miscelánea la decidió poner el señor Agustín por iniciativa propia, aunque al principio fue complicado por la falta de dinero, es por eso que se acercó a los créditos los cuales le han ayudado a levantar poco a poco su negocio. Su mercancía la va a traer cada 8 días a su municipio y las lleva a su tienda que está ubicada en su domicilio. Dice el señor Agustín: "Hay muchas metas, una de ellas es ser una empresa de mayoreo o medio mayoreo de mi región, quiero surtirle a tiendas de cerca" El señor Agustín es muy entusiasta lo único que necesita es un impulso más para su negocio un préstamo le ayudaría a mejorar su miscelánea y sus expectativas de la vida.
texts.en:
The following group is called “Toluca” and is located in Santo Domingo de Guzmán in the township of Ixtlahuaca.  This is a location that has all basic public services and many commercial locales like grocery stores, bakeries, chicken shops, butcher shops, etc.  This group, which incidentally is a family group as well, decided to name their group thus because they are al soccer fans and their favorite team is “Toluca” and this motivates them to use it as an example; they say that in sports one loses and one wins but what’s important is not to become discouraged.  They relate this to life; in life there are victories and defeats but they say that they never give up in face of life’s difficulties.  This is a very united, enterprising family.  The names of the group members and their activities are as follows:

1.- Agustín S. (will buy eggs, sugar, soap, oil, milk, etc. by the case to sell)
2.- Susana Adilene S. (will buy soup, marmalade, disposables, toilet paper, etc. to sell)
3.- Lourdes G. (will buy candy, soft-drinks, ice products, bottled water, etc. to sell)
4.- Guadalupe Abigail S. (will buy dairy products, cookies, tuna, sardines, etc. to sell)

Agustín, aside from being the father of this family, is also the group representative.  He’s 40 years old, married for 21 years to Lourdes who tends to their home and their business.  Agustín and his family are requesting this loan to buy eggs, sugar, soap, oil, milk, soup, marmalade, disposables, toilet paper, candy, soft-drinks, water, cookies, tuna, sardines, etc. for their general store that has been in operation for 15 years already.

Agustín decided to open this general store on is own initiative even though it was complicated at first for lack of money.  This is why he approached loans that have helped him lift up his business bit by bit.  He goes to the main town every 8 days to get merchandise for his store which is located in his house.

Agustín says:  “There are many goals.  One of them is to become a wholesale or half-wholesale firm in my region.  I want to supply nearby stores.” Agustín is very enthusiastic and all he needs is one more push for his business.  A loan will help him improve his general store and his life expectations.

loans.use: to buy eggs, sugar, soap, oil, milk, etc. by the case to sell.

loans.name: La Roca Group

texts.es:
El grupo Roca lo conforman cuatro mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas  es Elba de 25 años quien vende ropa desde hace 5 años negocio que inicio con unas cuantas ropas y poco a poco fue creciendo. Ella está casada y tiene un niño de 12 años y su bebe que pronto nacerá.

Las otras integrantes son Gloria quien vende tortillas desde hace 4 años,  Veronica vende elotes, atol, pinolillo…etc. Y Luisa tiene una pulpería desde hace 2 años.

Este grupo se le tomo la foto por separado ya que la coordinadora está embarazada en las últimas semanas para dar a luz por ende no era conveniente estarla moviendo.
texts.en:
The group "Roca" consists of four hardworking and enterprising women.  One of them is Elba, who is 25 years old and has been selling clothing for five years.  She started out selling a few garments and her business has grown slowly.  Elba is married and has a 12-year-old son.  She is expecting another child who will be born soon.  

The other members are Gloria who has been selling tortillas for four years; Veronica who sells corn on the cob, "atol" and "pinolillo" (beverages made from corn), and other products; and Luisa who has managed a grocery store for two years.

A separate photo of the group coordinator (Elba) is shown since she is pregnant and about to give birth in a few weeks.  It is not convenient for her to move around.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy furniture making supplies and to service the equipment.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina “Maria Auxiliadora”, está integrado  por  25  señoras muy activas y solidarias todas ellas amigas y vecinas del barrio, quienes vieron una gran oportunidad para salir adelante por medio del programa de la fundación paraguaya.
Luz es una de las miembros del grupo, y ella misma se define como una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante e ir creciendo para poder ayudar a su familia. Luz vende comestibles y comenta que tiene una buena clientela que siempre compra de ella sus comidas, es gracias a su trabajo y sacrificio que puede ayudar a su familia con el día a día.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos con los cuales podrá seguir preparando los alimentos que vende. Quiere comprar condimentos, carnes, discos de empanadas, harina, etc. Ella agradece por la ayuda que esta recibiendo, pues le será muy útil.
texts.en: The “Maria Auxiliadora” consists of 25 very active and united women who are all friends and neighbors who saw a great opportunity to make headway thanks to the loan program with Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya. One of the members is Luz, who defines herself as a woman with a strong desire to move up in life and keep growing to be able to help her family. Luz sells food and says that she has a good customer base that always buys her products. It's thanks to her work and sacrifice that she can help her family from day to day. She is requesting the loan to purchase the ingredients she needs to keep making the food she sells. She wants to purchase condiments, meat, empanadas, flour, etc. She is grateful for the help she is receiving because it will be very useful.

loans.use: to purchase condiments, meat, empanadas, flour, etc.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
El Señor Andrés está casado con la Señora Manuela con quien tiene tres hijos por quienes ambos luchan, ya que quieren darles lo mejor, viven en la ciudad de Carapeguá.
Don Andrés trabaja en su zapatería propia ubicada en su propia casa, hace más de 20 años, es una de las zapaterías pioneras de la ciudad. Fue su padre quien le había enseñado ese oficio y decidió dedicarse a el. Gracias a su tiempo en este trabajo ha podido formarse una buena clientela que siempre acude hasta su negocio.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de cueros en general ya que cuenta con muchos pedidos de zapatos debido a  que trabaja con macateros de la zona que le llevan a vender sus productos a diversos lugares del país.
texts.en:
Andres and his wife Manuela have three kids for whom they both struggle because they want to give them the best. They live in the city of Carapeguá.

Andres works in his shoe shop located in his home. He started this work more than 20 years ago and was one of the first cobblers in the city. His father taught him the trade and he decided to make it his living. Thanks to the time he has been doing this work he has been able to establish a good clientele that always comes to his business.

He asks for a loan to buy leathers because he has a lot of shoe orders due to his work with the door-to-door salesmen who carry his products all over the country.

loans.use: to buy leather to make shoes.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
This is Josephine, 50, a resident of Manila, Philippines. Her husband is Segismundo. She is a mother of two children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Josephine maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan to buy more orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Josephine hopes to be more successful n her business and dreams of being able to give her children a good future and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for products ordered for her customers

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 35-year-old fruit and vegetable supplier in Mombasa. She also runs a car rental business to supplement her income. She is married. She has been supplying fruits and vegetables for the last two years and she is doing great. 

This is her second loan from KADET Ltd. to finance her business. She plans to use the loan to purchase more cabbages, kale and bananas. She will use the proceeds to expand her business further. She hopes to do well in the business and live a prosperous life.

loans.use: to purchase more cabbages, kale and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Hermes

texts.es:
Don Hermes tiene 51 años, está casado con María, juntos tienen 5 hijos que dependen él. Se dedica al tambo y la venta de leñas hace más de 15 años, realiza sus ventas en zonas de la ciudad de Caacupé y alrededores.
Nos comenta que tiene muy buena clientela a quienes todos los días y semanalmente visita dependiendo los pedidos que recibe. Gracias al esfuerzo conjunto de él y su esposa están saliendo adelante y ayudan así a sus hijos.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca lechera, con lo que podrá aumentar la producción de leche de su tambo, y de esa forma tener un poco más de ingresos. Agradece por la ayuda que recibe de kiva y de fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
Hermes, 51, and his wife Maria have 5 dependent children. He has had a small dairy farm and sold firewood for more than 15 years. He sells in different neighborhoods of the city of Caacupé and nearby. 

He tells us that he has a very good customer base that he sells to on a daily or weekly basis, depending on the orders he gets. Thanks to his and his wife's efforts they are making progress and helping their children.

He asks for a loan to buy a dairy cow to increase his milk production so that he can have a little more income. He is grateful for the help from Kiva and the Fundacion Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Los Triunfadores - Chilca Group

texts.es:
La Sra. MODESTA PRIMITIVA  de 46 años de edad casada tiene 03 hijo menores de edad, actualmente es socia en la alcancía comunal “LOS TRIUNFADORES – CHILCA” grupo conformado por 08 personas. 
NERY ELIZABETH se dedica a la venta de carne de pollos al por mayor y menor vende en el mercado de su localidad, el préstamo solicito para incrementar su capital de trabajo y comprar su balanza electrónica y otros.    
Sus objetivos para el futuro es comprar otro puesto de venta de carnes y pollos. Ella se ubicada la segunda persona  lado derecha  de la fotografía viste con chompa color rosada.
texts.en:
Modesta Primitiva, 46, is married and has 3 young children. She is currently a member of the village bank "Los Triunfadores - Chilca", which is made up of 8 people. 

Nery Elizabeth sells chicken meat at wholesale and retail in the market in her town. She asked for a loan to increase her work capital and to buy an electronic scale and other things. 

Her goals for the future are to buy another sales stall for meat and chicken. She is the second person from the right in the photograph, in a pink sweater.

loans.use: to sell chicken.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en: Mwajuma is a 46-year-old married woman with five children, all in school. She has been selling coconuts for the last seven years and aspires to open a depot for the same. Mwajuma sells her goods from home at wholesale and at the market. She joined Yehu to access loans for her business. She will use her loan of KSH 20,000 to pay school fees for her children. Poor infrastructure during transportation of goods is her major challenge. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Most of her monthly expenses go to school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Dadu

texts.en:
Dadu is a 35-year-old businessman who sells shoes in Mombasa. He is married and has been selling shoes for the past three years with success. 

This marks his first business loan from KADET LTD. He plans to purchase more stock of shoes to sell to his customers. 

He will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and expand his business further. He hopes to excel in the business.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 39 years old and married with two children. He does a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in the business for two years and describes his business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. To earn extra income, he does farming. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to educate his children and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
This is Hilda, 38, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. Her husband and business partner is Cyril. She is the mother of two children. She and her husband manage their household while operating their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Hilda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal in the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 pesos worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a 39,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Hilda hopes her business will grow in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Niña

texts.en:
Niña works hard to support her 2 children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Niña requested an 1,800 PHP loan through NWTF to buy an Envirofit cookstove. She is getting the Envirofit cookstove because she wants to lessen the amount of firewood that she uses when cooking food for her family.

Niña is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase an Envirofit cookstove

loans.name: Normanita

texts.en:
Normanita works hard to support her 3 children. She is married and has an eatery business in the Philippines.

Normanita requested an 1,800 PHP loan through NWTF to buy an Envirofit cookstove. She is getting the Envirofit cookstove because she wants to make the firewood that she buys last longer because the Envirofit stove needs less fuel to cook food.

Normanita is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy an Envirofit cookstove

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: This time, for her 14th loan cycle, Marissa is borrowing PHP 50,000 which she intends to purchase more stocks of goods for her store and spare parts for her tricycle transportation businesses.  The dry goods and cosmetics retail business that was previously funded through NWTF/KIVA continues to provide for Marissa and her family and that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: purchase more dry goods to sell

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is 42 years old and married with four children. He runs a retail shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for five years and employs one person. He describes his business environment as competitive because many people have the same business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for a 50,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy sugar, rice, cooking oil and maize flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, cooking oil and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
This is Maribel, 35, a resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Sherwin, a construction worker. She together with her husband manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Maribel oversees operations of their Tricycle transportation business. They have one unit of Tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan to buy spare parts and accessories and to maintain her motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Maribel hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their Tricycle unit

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is fifty-one years old and married with three children.

Nenita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Nenita has borrowed and paid for nineteen loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nineteen years and also earns an income from a local eatery.

Nenita aspires to save money to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish selling business in the Philippines. 

She has requested to borrow PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Salvacion has been in this business for fifteen years. She earns more income from her variety store.

Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.  She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her community.

loans.name: Ma. Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Guadalupe solicita un crédito, ya que se lastimo la pierna derecha y necesita de un tratamiento pero no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para pagar.
Doña Guadalupe trabaja para el municipio de Nuevo Laredo, en el departamento de parques y jardines. Con el sueldo que obtiene de su empleo para pagar el crédito, ya que su hijo que es una persona mayo le ayuda con los gastos de su casa. 
Desea mejorar su salud y con este tratamiento su perna esta mucho mejor y podrá trabajar sin problemas.
texts.en:
Sra. Guadalupe is requesting a loan because she hurt her right leg and is in need of treatment, but she does not have enough money to pay for it. She works for the city of Nuevo Laredo in the Parks and Gardens Department. With the salary she earns from her job, she will be able to repay the loan. Her son is already grown and helps with the household expenses.

Guadalupe wants to improve her health and this treatment for her leg will enable her to get better and work without any problems.

loans.use: to pay for medical expenses and treatment.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 45 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Virginia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Virginia has been farming vegetables for five years and also earns additional income from hog raising.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
This is Delia, 53, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. Her husband is Felipe. She is a mother of three children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Delia maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan to buy more orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Delia hopes to be more successful in her business and dreams of being able to give her children a good future and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise ordered for her customers

loans.name: Glecy

texts.en:
This is Glecy, 40, a resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Rudy, a driver. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Glecy oversees operations of their Tricycle transportation business. They have one unit of Tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to buy spare parts and accessories and to maintain her motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Glecy hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their Tricycle unit

loans.name: Homer Edgardo

texts.es:
Homer, está iniciando una nueva siembra, para esto solicita un préstamo que le ayude a comprarse los insumos como abono, herbicidas, semilla, preparar el terreno, con esto contara con lo necesario para que su cultivo pueda ser abundante.
El cultivo anterior fue provechoso, con la ayuda del préstamo logro tener todo lo necesario y aplicarlo en el momento preciso, con esto pudo cancelar a tiempo la deuda y su familia ha tenido lo necesario para la alimentación.
texts.en: Homer is starting a new harvest so he is requesting a loan that will help him to purchase inputs such as manure, herbicides, and seeds to prepare the land. With this he will have what is necessary for an abundant crop. His previous crop was profitable and with the help of the loan he obtained everything he needed and applied it at the precise moment. As such, he was able to pay off his debt in time and his family has had everything they need for food.

loans.use: to purchase manure, herbicides, and seeds.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en: Mwanasha is a 36-year-old married woman with four children, all enrolled in school. She operates a kiosk and sells her goods at retail. Hair plaiting is her side job. She plans to use the loan of KSH 20,000 to purchase rice and sugar. She has been in the business for three years and aims to open a café in the future. Price fluctuation is her major challenge. She joined Yehu since they have low interest rates. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water and her greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.use: to purchase rice and sugar.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen is 28 years old and married with three children. She runs a grocery store to earn a living. She has been in the business for six years and describes her business environment as good because she has many regular customers. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her living standards and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy onions, potatoes, tomatoes and bananas to sell.

loans.use: To buy onions, potatoes, tomatoes and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
This is Salvacion, 49, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Pepito, her business partner. She is a mother of two children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 
                            
Salvacion operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She sells meat for additional income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Salvacion hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items and other products to sell

loans.name: Ma. Amie

texts.en:
Ma. Amie is 44 years old and lives in Bato, Plaridel, Philippines. She is married with three children. Ma. Amie has been a cassava farm owner and manage this as their main source of income for three years. This farm earns 2,000 PHP monthly. She is asking for a loan of 4,300 PHP to buy fertilizer and young seedlings to plant. 

In 2009, she become a partner of GDMPC. The amount she gets from her farm will be used for the tuition of her children and to cover their daily needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and young seedlings to plant

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es: Maria V. mujer trabajadora, honesta y humilde. Su esposo trabaja como albañil. Teniendo como  principal actividad la venta de pan y carne iniciando por cuenta propia. Aunque manifiesta la señora que por la situacion economica a veces sus ventas no son tan rentables es por ello que tambien lava y plancha ajeno. Una de sus metas es ir mejorando la infraestructura de su vivienda, es por ello que recurre al financiamiento ofrecido por afodenic, mismo que lo invertira en el entechado de su pequeña vivienda y en la terminacion de su cuarto para llevar a cabo este nuevo objetivo requerira comprar los siguientes materiales de construccion: laminas de zinc, cuartones de madera, reglas, clavos entre otros y asi comenzar la obra. Su plan a futuro es seguir mejorando su casita humilde que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado conseguir su terreno.
texts.en:
Maria is a hardworking, honest, and humble woman. Her husband works as a bricklayer. Her main business involves selling bread and meat, a venture she started on her own. Due to her financial situation, Maria says sometimes her sales do not result in a profit so she also does laundry and ironing for other people.

One of her goals is to improve the infrastructure of her home, which is why she has returned for a loan being offered by AFODENIC. The money will be invested in a roof for her small home and the completion of a room. This new goal requires her to buy the following construction materials: zinc roofing sheets, wooden beams, rulers, nails, and other supplies so that the work can begin. Her plan for the future is to continue making improvements to her modest home and invest a great amount of effort into obtaining her own land.

loans.use: to install a roof on her house and finish a room.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en: Zuhura is a 41-year-old married woman with four children, all in school. She has been selling firewood for the last four year and sells it at the market. Her primary customers are her neighbors. She describes her major challenge to be the high cost of transport. Zuhura aims to open a depot for her current business. With the KSH 10,000, she will be able to add to her stock of firewood. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water, and her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to add to her stock of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia es socia del Bancomunal Nueva Vida, tiene 30 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos,es socia de Finca Perú hace 2 años, se dedica a la venta de comida, con las capacitaciones de su Bancomunal ella aprendió a ser responsable, cómo ahorrar, cómo valorarse y ser autosuficiente. Gracias a Finca Perú ella pudo educar a sus hijos, ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de arroz por saco, aceite por mayor,fideos por mayor para su negocio.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the Communal Bank "Nueva Vida" (New Life). She is 30 years old and the mother of three children. Sonia has been a member of FINCA Peru for two years. She sells food and the training classes offered by her Communal Bank have taught her how to be responsible and save, as well as find value in herself and become self-sufficient. Thanks to FINCA Peru, she has been able to provide an education for her children.

With this current loan, she will invest in sacks of rice, oil in bulk, and noodles in bulk for her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, oil, and noodles in bulk.

loans.name: Lucila Viki

texts.es:
Lucila es una mujer de 34 años que día a día lucha para demostrarse que puede mejorar como persona y microempresaria en la ciudad de Ica, Perú. Lucila ha tenido que aprender muchas cosas para poder afrontar los retos que la vida le pone, es por eso que diariamente se levanta muy temprano ansiosa de mejorar su calidad de vida.

Lucila es joven y disfruta mucho de practicar el Voleibol con sus amigas y amigos que viven cerca de su casa. Para poder salir adelante, Lucila decidió poner una pequeña bodeguita en su casa, lo que le permitiría poder ganar el dinero que necesita. Ella nos comenta que fue gracias a su madre que aprendió a darles buen trato a sus clientes y de esa manera asegurarse de que compraran nuevamente.

Lucila tiene una nueva idea de negocio, para la que necesita apoyo, lo que la ayudará a poder comprar una refrigeradora y nuevos productos para su bodega (Dulces,Té, Pallares, etc), con esta ayuda Lucila se siente capaz de lograr el éxito y mejorar con la finalidad de tener mayores ingresos, poder equipar mejor su bodega y así cumplir su gran sueño “Tener una casa de material noble”
texts.en:
Lucila, 34, struggles every day to prove to herself that she can improve as a person and a businesswoman in the city of Ica, Peru. Lucila has had to learn a lot of things to be able to face the challenges that life has thrown at her; for that reason she gets up early every day, anxious to improve her quality of life. 

Lucila is young and enjoys playing volleyball with her friends who live nearby. To help her get ahead, she decided to put a small store in her home so that she can make the money she needs. She tells us that thanks to her mother she learned how to treat her customers well and assure that they'll come back to buy from her again. 

Lucila has a new business idea that she needs support for so that she can buy a refrigerator and new products for her store (candies, tea, lima beans, etc). With this help Lucila feels capable of being successful and achieving her goal of having more profits. She will be able to equip her store better and achieve her dream of "having a house made of durable material".

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and products (candies, tea, lima beans, etc)

loans.name: Dioma

texts.fr: Madame  Dioma  vit au Sénégal. Elle est âgée  de 38ans et gère 7 enfants âgés  entre 3 et 19 ans. Elle est  vendeuse de poissons depuis plus de 10 ans dans le marché de la localité ou elle habite. Elle a choisi son activité par passion mais aussi dans le but de s’occuper. Elle est très intéressée par la réalisation de profits dans son  activité. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis novembre 2003.  Elle a déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur. Elle sollicite un prêt de 100 000 frs prévu pour  financer son activité et mieux la développer d’avantage. L’augmentation de ses bénéfices lui permettra de  mieux soutenir sa famille dans l’amélioration des conditions de vie sociale.
texts.en:
Ms. Dioma lives in Senegal. She is 38 years old and manages seven children, from 3 to 19 years old. She has been a fish seller for over ten years at a market in the town where she lives. She chose her business out of passion but also with the goal of taking care of herself. She is very interested by the  making of profits from her business. 

Ms. Dioma has been a member of a U-IMCEC branch office since November 2003. She has already repaid a previous loan. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs for financing her business and developing it further. More profit will enable her to support her family better in terms of improving its standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fish to resell

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
This is Sabina, 49, a resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Jesus, a salesman. She is a mother of four children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Sabina operates a bamboo furniture business. She buys bamboo furniture from a local supplier and sells it at her store. She offers sala sets, beds and tables made from bamboo. She displays her stock of bamboo furniture in a vacant lot for customers to see. Aside from this, she operates a small variety store for added income.  Her customers usually come from the local community and nearby areas. She earns a minimum of PHP 3,000 in profit every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to buy new stock of bamboo furniture. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Sabina hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She also hopes to grow her business in the future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase more bamboo furniture to sell

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
This is Jose, 26, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Jefanese. Jose, together with his wife, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jose operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Jose hopes to be able to expand soon. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
This is Nancy, 44, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and mother to her five children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Nancy operates a direct selling business. A customer's order is bought in cash by her and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit.  Her products are RTW, cosmetics and other similar products. She sells water by container for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 28,000 loan to buy more stocks of personal merchandise to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Nancy dreams of being able to give her all her children a good future and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She also hopes to have a growing network of customers. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more stock to sell

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en: Cecile is 25 years old. She sells fish and onions. She has been running this business for the past six years. With the loan, she wants to add more fish and onions to the existing business. The profits from the business will be used to make more investments in the business. She wants her business to prosper in the future.

loans.use: To buy more fish and onions to sell.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 51 years old and a farmer. She is a widow of three adult children. She has been doing mixed crop farming for the past 11 years with a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Regina will use the loan to buy farm inputs like fertilizer, pesticides and seedlings.  

With the anticipated profit from the farming business, she plans to support her grandchildren and two sons who are not well off. Her hopes and dreams are to venture into the fish farming business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs like fertilizer, pesticides and seedlings.

loans.name: Ulziitogtokh

texts.en: Mr. Ulziitogtokh, 25, works in a construction material supply company as a team head. He has been doing his job for over two years. But he still could not earn the money needed for his family's expenses. He lives with his wife and his two children in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic tent, in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. For this reason, he decided to start a new business beyond his job. It will be a small auto repair service with garage capacity for five cars. He said that each car will pay him USD 5-10 in a day. It is quite enough for him and his family currently. Now he needs a loan to purchase the building materials to build his workshop for the new business. In addition, he very much believes in his business plan.

loans.use: To purchase building materials to build his workshop

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 46 years old. She is married to a technician and they have four children. All her children go to school. She has been selling different items such as juice, sodas, sugar and cooking oil in the boutiques. With the profits, she plans to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more juice, sodas, sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Makhsuda

texts.ru: Махсуда трудолюбивая и добрая женщина, она замужем и любящая мать троих детей. Он занимается купле- продажей продуктов питания, и начала данный бизнес семь лет назад с 2000 сомони. Затем постепенно расширяя бизнес она добавила другие виды товаров, и сейчас её оборотный капитал составляет 55681 сомони. Она каждый день с 6:00 утра до 17:00 вечера находится на своей торговой точке. Муж помогает в покупке товаров. Махсуда хотела бы получить займ для покупки продуктов питания.
texts.en: Makhsuda is a hardworking and kind woman, she is married and is a loving mother of three children. She buys and sells food and started her business seven years ago with 2,000 somoni. She then gradually expanded her business and added different kinds of goods. Right now her working capital is 55,681 somoni. She is at her vendor location every day from 6 am to 5 pm. Her husband helps her with purchasing of goods. Makhsuda wants to get a loan to buy food.

loans.use: to buy food for her store.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is 50 years of age, married and has six grown up children. He plans to improve his family's living conditions and give his family a better life. With his wife, they help each other in managing their rice farming business to ensure a high production. They have been farmers for almost 28 years and they usually earn profits of P25,000 in every harvest season. Eduardo utilizes his income for his family's food, clothing and allowances for his youngest child. 

Due to high cost of commodities and school fees, Armando planned to expand his rice plantation to increase his yields but due to inadequate capital, he is requesting a loan of P45,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and pay labor cost in planting rice. He believes that the loan will help his family improve their rice farming business and he is hoping that they will have a fruitful harvest.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and pay labor cost in planting rice.

loans.name: Dagvadorj

texts.en: Mr. Dagvadorj, 52, runs a passenger transportation business around the districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been doing his business for eight years non-stop. He lives with his family in a slum district of the city. It is the main income source for his family. Lately, his minivan has been bad and damaged some of its parts. He wants to make some repairs to it, which will cost about MNT 2.000.000 as he calculates. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to purchasing the spare parts for his minivan.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his minivan.

loans.name: Anglique

texts.en: Anglique is 33 years old. She is married with four children who range in age from 7 to 14 years old. All of her children are enrolled in school. She has decided to get a loan to buy more shoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used for savings. In the future, she wants to see her business prospering.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Marivil

texts.en:
Marivil doesn't want to rely only on her husband income because their household expenditures have increased and their three children are currently studying.  In this situation, Marivil decided to have another source of income, which is raising hogs. She currently raises five hogs for fattening and four piglets. 

Marivil is 38 years old and married. She would like that her children could finish their studies to be able for them to find better opportunities for their future. To work out this plan of Marivil and her husband, she asked for a financial assistance amount of PHP 10,000, which will be used to buy livestock feeds and vaccines to improve the growth of her raised hogs, even though they haven't yet reach their optimum growth. In this way, she can sell her hogs for a higher price, which will enable her to improve their way of living and save for her security purposes.

loans.use: buy livestock feeds and vaccines

loans.name: Mariana Del Socorro

texts.es: Mariana Del Socorro es una emprendedora que toda la vida ha luchado para salir adelante y brindarle a su familia lo mejor, esta emprendedora ya ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, durante el crédito otorgado ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con objetivos en la vida de superar cada día. Actualmente la emprendedora está solicitando financiamiento para comprar productos para la pulpería y la elaboración de las cajetas con el crédito comprara dulces, bolsas, canela, vasos, leña,  entre otros productos.
texts.en: Mariana del Socorro is an entrepreneur who has struggled all her life to get ahead and give her family the best she could.  She has been working with Fundación León 2000, and during her loan cycle demonstrated that she is a responsible person with daily goals in her life.  She is currently requesting a loan to buy products for her grocery store and to make "cajetas" (caramel).  The loan will be used to buy sweets, bags, cinnamon, cups, firewood and other products.

loans.use: To buy sweets, bags, cinnamon, cups, firewood and other products.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila's first business was selling fish, which she did for almost one year. According to Leonila, she didn't continue this business due to the many credit sales on which she was unable to collect payment. Her situation during that time was difficult, but since she joined ASKI she has been eager to obtain success in life. As the days passed by, she became involved in the hog-raising business. In the hog business, her income increased, and this enabled her to start a sewing business. Leonila couldn't really explain what she felt at that time because, after the suffering she had undergone, the sun was still shining and she was achieving success in life.

At this time, Leonila runs her sewing business. At her age--64 years old--she is still able to sew different kinds of curtains, pants, pillowcases, blouses, and short pants. She really enjoys running her business because she is able to earn approximately 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). This is really a big blessing to her because she can cover all her household expenses and provide feed for her hogs. As a responsible borrower, Leonila has maintained a good track record and is now asking for a bigger loan of 30,000 PHP so she can buy stock garments, thread, and other materials needed in her sewing business. She hopes to have continued access to the financial services of ASKI to be able to improve her living conditions and her financial stability.

loans.use: to buy stock garments, thread, and other materials needed in her sewing business

loans.name: Los Girasoles - Huancayo Group

texts.es:
La Sra. NILDA de 33 años de edad casada tiene 01 hijo menores de edad, actualmente es socia en la alcancía comunal “LOS GIRASOLES - HUANCAYO” grupo conformado por 08 personas. 
NILDA se dedica a la venta de aceites y lubricantes de automotores, vende como aceites para autos, grasas, gasolina, repuestos, etc, su tienda de ventas esta ubicada en su localidad. el préstamo solicito para incrementar su capital de trabajo y comprar neumáticos y otros.    
Sus objetivos para el futuro es comprar un automóvil. Ella se ubicada en la fotografia la primera persona  lado izquierda sentada viste con chompa color marrón y pantalón color celeste.
texts.en: Mrs. Nilda, 33, is married and has a minor son.  She is currently a member of the communal bank "LOS GIRASOLES - HUANCAYO" which is comprised of eight people.  Nilda sells automotive lubricants and oils, as well as gasoline, spare parts, etc.  Her store in located in her town.  The loan she is requesting is to increase her working capital to buy tires and other items.  Her goal for the future is to buy a car.  In the photograph she is shown sitting on the left in a beige sweater and blue trousers.

loans.use: To sell automotive lubricants and oils.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is married to a farmer and they are raising their family in a village of Guayabal. They were gifted with one child and they plan to educate her and give her a better life. Due to the hardships of life, Jenny is involved in a business buying and selling feed to generate additional income. She has been operating this business for almost three years and usually earns a profit of 1,500 PHP a day that she uses for their necessities. 

Jenny plans to improve her business. But due to inadequate capital, she wants to ask for an additional 15,000 PHP to buy more stock of feed to sell in their village. She believes that this loan will help them to carry out their plan, and she hopes to be successful.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and materials needed in hog-raising.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single.

Meriam is making and peddling home-made "siopao" (steamed buns) and boiled quail eggs. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 8,000 to buy stocks of quail eggs & ingredients for making snacks.

Meriam has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future,Meriam hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of quail eggs & ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Ferdinan

texts.en:
Ferdinan is a 32-year-old man and is married to Dor, a 32-year-old lady. At the moment they haven’t had any children yet. Ferdinan and Dor are still living with Ferdinan’s parents. To cover their daily needs Ferdinan runs a kiosk business. 

Ferdinan provides daily necessities such as biscuits, detergent, bath soap, cigarettes, candies and snacks. Ferdinan was thinking to improve his business by providing more stock such as rice, sugar, coffee, cigarettes, instant noodles, etc.  To make it happen he is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 4,000,000.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as rice, sugar, coffee, cigarettes, instant noodles, etc.

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en:
Chea lives in Banteay Meanchey province. She is married and has four boys, who are now construction workers. She does many kinds of work such as farming, raising pigs and also works as a construction worker. She has been doing these activities for fifteen years to make a living. She received the first loan from VisionFund in 2009.

Chea is now a group leader of a loan group with two members. After she completely repaid her third loan, she requested the another loan from VisionFund to buy piglets, fertilizers for her paddy and hire workers to plough her rice paddy so that she can generate more income to make her family’s living conditions better.  The loans from VisionFund have helped to improve her business as well as to make more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets, fertilizer, and hire farm labor

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Secundino Antonio

texts.es: El señor Secundino de 63 años de edad, padre de cinco hermosos hijos, de los cuales solo uno de ellos depende de el. Tiene como oficio el ser guarda de seguridad trabajo de mucho sacrificio y responsabilidad. Ademas de contar con el ingreso extra por ser el ya jubilado. Su objetivo hasta el dia de hoy ha sido el ir mejorando su vivienda y con el apoyo de la institucion y el de su señora esposa  han logrado las mejoras que se han propuesto a su hogar. Con este ciclo de prestamo llevara a cabo la terminacion del muro de su hogar. Lo que comprara los siguientes materiales de construccion: bloques, arena, piedrin, cemento, hierro, reglas entre otros. Secundino agradece el apoyo incondicional de Kiva y Afodenic. Logrando con los anteriores creditos y este nuevo ampliar su humilde hogar y ofrecerle a los suyos una seguridad mas solida.
texts.en:
Secundino, 63, is the father of five lovely children, one of whom is still in his care.  He works as a security guard, which is a job requiring much sacrifice and responsibility.  He also has an extra income because he is retired.  His goal up until now has been to improve his house, and with the support of the institution and his wife, has been able to fix up the house.  

He plans to use this loan to finish the wall around the house, and will buy the following construction materials: blocks, sand, gravel, cement, iron, rulers, etc.  Secundino is grateful for the unconditional support of Kiva and Afodenic.  With his previous loans he has been able to expand his humble dwelling and give his family more safety.

loans.use: To finish a wall.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Analiza has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Analiza has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Jeheka Group

texts.es:
El comité "Kuña Aty Jeheka"se formo a traves de promociones  que se hicieron en el barrio de estas señoras. Todas las integrantes son vecinas de la zona, conocidas y amigas del barrio. El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es trabajar en forma conjunta, fomentar el espiritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa de comité de mujeres.
La sra Sabina, es Presidenta del grupo, ella se dedica en la venta de leche. Su deseo es progresar junto con la Fundación Paraguaya y que el grupo se vaya fortaleciendo cada día más,  se siente muy a gusto en su comité y espera seguir creciendo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de leche, con lo cual tendrá suficiente en stock y de esa forma ofrecer buena variedad a sus clientes
texts.en:
The communal bank "Kuña Aty Jeheka" was formed through campaigns carried out in the neighborhood where these ladies live.  All of the members live in the same area, know each other and are friends.  The goal of each member is to work together, promoting team spirit and reaching the maximum level of the group's program.

Mrs. Sabina, the president of the group, sells milk for a living.  Her goal is to get ahead through the Fundación Paraguaya, and see the group get stronger every day.  She is very happy with her committee and hopes to continue growing.

She is requesting a loan to buy milk so she will have enough stock to provide her customers with a wide variety.

loans.use: To buy milk to sell.

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
El comité La Amistad  se formó con la unión de 13 vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.  Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, pero también trabajan juntas para fomentar su compañerismo.
La Señora Cecilia es una de las integrantes del comité, está casada y tiene dos hijos. Su marido se dedica a la albañilería y por medio del trabajo de los dos ayudan a mantener la casa. Cecilia tiene una mercería donde vende todo tipo de productos, como ser ropas, artículos de bazar, calzados y demás. Su meta es seguir creciendo y de esa forma seguir luchando por sus hijos.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, calzados y demás productos para surtir su mercería.
texts.en:
The communal bank "La Amistad" was formed by 13 neighbors in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.  All the members of the committee carry out independent activities, but also work together to promote team spirit.

One of the members of the committe, Mrs. Cecilia, is married and has two children.  Her husband is a bricklayer and through both of their jobs they support the household.  Cecilia has a store where she sells all kinds of products such as clothing, bazaar items, shoes, etc.  Her goal is to keep expanding and continue to get ahead for her children.

She is requesting a loan to buy clothing, shoes and other products for her store.

loans.use: To buy shoes and clothing.

loans.name: Amparo Justina

texts.es: Amparo, mujer luchadora, comerciante luego de dedicarse a la venta de tortillas y nacatamales actividad que le perjudico su salud manifiesta que decide cambiar de negocio por lo que hoy en dia su principal fuente de ingresos es la pulperia que tiene hace un año aproximado en su vivienda. Su esposo es contador en una cooperativa de buses y le ayuda con los gastos de la casa. Siendo su tercer credito sus poyectos con este es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda, tambien generar mayores utilidades, cambiando su nivel de vida y opcionando a ofrecer a un mejor futuro a sus hijos por lo que comprara los siguientes materiales de construccion: cemento, arena, ladrillos, piedrin entre otros  y de esta manera llevar a cabo la instalacion de piso en cuartos y sala de su hogar. Agradece el apoyo a la oportunidad de optar a un credito para mejorar sus condiciones de la infraestructura de su vivienda. Su plan a futuro es construir toda su casa de concreto.
texts.en:
Amparo is a determined woman. She was a merchant who sold tortillas and Nicaraguan tamales. Due to failing health, she decided to change businesses and now her main source of income is a grocery store that she opened in her home approximately a year ago. Her husband works as an accountant for a bus cooperative and helps with the household expenses.

Amparo is receiving her third loan to fund her projects. This loan will be used to improve the infrastructure of her home so that she can generate more income, change her standard of living, and provide a better future for her children. In order to do this, she will buy the following construction materials: cement, sand, bricks, gravel, and other supplies. This will allow her to install floors in the bedrooms and living room of her home. She is grateful for the opportunity of having a loan to improve the condition of the infrastructure of her home. Her plan for the future is to fully build her house out of concrete.

loans.use: to install a floor in her home.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora Gregoria tiene ya más de dos años con su negocio, el cual es la venta de ropa usada, juguetes y zapatos. Esta solicitando un crédito para comprar ropa por mayoreo de temporada de verano y zapatos para toda la familia que le están ofreciendo a buen precio. Con esta inversión beneficiara mucho al negocio ya que tendrá mas variedad de mercancía y los clientes podrán tener más de donde escoger.
Doña Gregoria es originaria de Durango, pero ya tiene tiempo radicando en Nuevo Laredo, en el cual ha podido desempeñarse como comerciante y así poder sustentar a su familia ya que tiene dos hijos adolecentes que están estudiando.
texts.en:
Sra. Gregoria has already been in business for two years. She sells used clothing, toys, and shoes. Gregoria is requesting a loan in order to buy summer clothing in bulk and shoes for the entire family that she can offer at a good price. This investment will be a great benefit to her business since she will have a wider variety of merchandise from which her customers can choose.

Doña Gregoria is originally from Durango, but she eventually moved to Nuevo Laredo, which is where she works as a merchant. Her business enables her to support her family, which includes two teenage children who are studying.

loans.use: to buy summer clothing.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es: Emilia es socia del Bancomunal Las Entusiastas, tiene 61 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de repuestos de para motos, es madre de 6 hijos, y es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 2 años, esta muy contenta porque en las capacitaciones de su Banco Comunal aprendió a ahorrar, así como también esta aprendiendo mucho sobre la puntualidad y se esfuerza cada día más. Con los préstamos recibidos en Finca Perú ella pudo mejorar su casa y también le ayudó en la educación de sus hijos. El préstamo que ahora solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de una moto para que su negocio crezca con la venta de motos.
texts.en:
Emilia is a member of the Communal Bank "Las Entusiastas" (The Enthusiasts). She is 61 years old and sells motorcycle parts. Emilia is the mother of six children and has been a member of FINCA Peru for two years. She is very pleased because the training classes from her Communal Bank have taught her how to save. Emilia has also learned a lot about being punctual and working hard each day. With the loans she has received from FINCA Peru, Emilia has been able to improve her home and help her children with their education.

The loan she is now requesting will be invested in the purchase of a motorcycle. She plans to grow her business by also selling motorcycles.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to sell in her business.

loans.name: Marie Rose

texts.en: Marie Rose is 34 years old. She has 4 children. She sells charcoal and owns a beauty salon. With the loan, she wants to expand the business of charcoal through buying more charcoals for sell and the profits will be used to make savings.

loans.use: To buy more charcoals to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine has 32 years old. She is married and has three children aged between 1 and 8 years. She has owned a store for 8 years. With this loan, she will buy rice, sugar and cooking oil to sell. She plans to use the profits from the business to renovate her house.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Ulugbek

texts.ru: Улугбек трудолюбивый и добрый человек, ему 33 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Более 12 лет он занимается купле – продажей скота, его жена помогает ему по бизнесу. Улугбек хочет улучшить свои жилищные условия семьи, и с этой целью запрашивает займ в размере 10000 Сомони для ремонта своего дома. Улугбек надеется на вашу помощь и щедрость.
texts.en:
Ulugbek is a hard working and good man, he is 33 years old. He is married and raising three children. He has been engaged in buying and selling livestock for more than 12 years, and his wife helps him with this business. 

Ulugbek wants to improve the family's living conditions, and with this aim requests a loan in the amount of 10,000 somoni for the repair of the house. Ulugbek hopes for your help and generosity.

loans.use: To repair his house

loans.name: Gappor

texts.ru: Гаппор женат и на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Более 12 лет он занимается откормом и продажей скота. У него богатый опыт в этом бизнесе и хорошо знает специфику бизнеса. Его жена помогает ему по бизнесу, и они дружно вместе работают. Гаппор запрашивает займ для покупки скота с целью пополнения оборотного капитала. Он надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en:
Gappor is married and raising two children. He has been engaged in fattening and selling cattle for more than 12 years. His has a rich experience with this business and knows the specifics well. His wife helps him in the business, and they work together in a friendly fashion.

Gappor requests a loan for the purchase of cattle with the aim to replenish working capital. He hopes for your help and compassion.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Hamro

texts.ru: Хамро добрый и трудолюбивый семьянин, который на воспитании имеет троих детей. Более 5 лет он занимается купле- продажей ковров и ваты, он начинал свой бизнес с продажи тканей. Его точка находится в центре города в многолюдном месте. Хамро запрашивает займ в размере 10000 Сомони для покупки товара с целью расширения бизнеса и получения прибыли.
texts.en:
Hamro is a good and hard working family man, who is raising three children. He has been engaged in buying and selling carpets and wool for more than 5 years. He started his business selling fabric. His point of sales is in the center of the city, in a crowded place.

Hamro requests a loan in the amount of 10,000 somoni for the purchase of merchandise with the aim to expand his business and profits.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Tsoghik

texts.ru:
Цохик (Tsoghik) занимается сельскохозяйственным бизнесом на протяжении 10 лет. Она разводит кур, выращивает овощи и фрукты на продажу. Раньше Цохик также разводила свиней, но из-за прошлогодней болезни свиней в Сюникском регионе, у нее не осталось ни одной свиньи. 
Полученную сельскохозяйственную продукцию: яйца, овощи и фрукты, Цохик реализует в городах Капане и Каджаране. 
Цохик 45 лет. Она проживает в Капане. Цохик замужем и у нее трое детей: две дочери и сын. Дочери уже замужем и проживают отдельно от родителей, сын в настоящее время живет в России. Муж Цохик работает водителем в одной из организаций Капана и одновременно помогает жене в ведении сельского хозяйства, благодаря которому они содержат семью. 
Цохик хочет возобновить занятие свиноводством, так как это довольно  прибыльное занятие. Для этого Цохик необходим кредит на сумму 550.000 драм, который она потратит на покупку нескольких поросят.
texts.en:
Tsoghik has been engaged in agriculture for 10 years. She raises chickens and grows vegetables and fruit for sale. Earlier Tsoghik also raised pigs, but due to last year's pig disease in the Syunik region, she does not have any pigs left. Tsoghik sells the resulting products - eggs, vegetables and fruits -  in Kapan and Kajaran. 

Tsoghik is 45 years old. She lives in Kapan. Tsoghik is married and has three children: Two daughters and one son. The daughters are already married and live separately from their parents, and the son currently lives in Russia. Tsoghik's husband works as a driver in one of Kapan's organizations and at the same time helps his wife with the farming, thanks to which they support the family. 

Tsoghik wants to resume the raising of pigs, since it is very profitable. For this, Tsoghik needs a loan in the sum of 550,000 dram, which she will spend on buying some piglets.

loans.use: To buy some piglets for her farm

loans.name: Zukhra

texts.ru:
Зухре  45 лет, вдова, воспитала 2 детей. В качестве  источника дохода для семьи, с 1992 года семья Зухры занимается животноводством и полеводством.  Начатое со стартовой суммы в 15,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. На сегодня ее поголовье насчитывает 3 головы дойных коров и 2 теленка. Также, Зухра обрабатывает 4 ,5 га земли, где сажает кукурузу и ячмень.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Зухра обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян кукурузы и пахотные работы. Доходы Зухра планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего  хозяйства.
texts.en:
Zukhra is 45 years old, a widow, and has raised two children. As a source of income for the family, Zukhra's family has been engaged in livestock breeding and crop cultivation since 1992. Starting the farm with a sum of 15,000 som (KGS), today it brings in around 10,000 som (KGS) per month from selling milk and dairy products. Today the number of livestock includes three dairy cows and two calves. Further Zukhra processes 4.5 hectares of land, where she plants corn and barley. 

With the aim of further developing her business, Zukhra turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of corn seeds and plowing work. Zukhra plans to invest the income in further improving her farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a married man with 7 children, and five are enrolled in school. He operates a tailoring business and has been in this business for the last 6 years. His customers are mostly students. He intends to use the loan of Ksh20,000 to buy clothing materials. He has rented a house that has electricity but no piped water. Ali aspires to open a wholesale shop in the future. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials.

loans.name: Isatu's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Kenema, in eastern Sierra Leone. Teachers of this school have come to SMT for a loan of 5,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) in order to improve their standard of living. Some of them will use this loan to buy house-building materials, some to buy pieces of furniture, others to pay school fees for their children. 

At the end of each month, the school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting their repayment amount and pays SMT. This is the first loan that this school has applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders.
