Isatu is the leader of this group of teachers, and she has been in the teaching profession for five years now. The 30-year-old was born in Seidumei, in eastern Sierra Leone. Isatu is single with no children. She has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials, iron corrugated zincs, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials, iron corrugated zincs, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Hadija operates a grocery selling business, selling at retail prices to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, onions, vegetables and tomatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, onions, vegetables and tomatoes.

loans.name: Dzua

texts.en: Dzua is a married man with 6 children, and 4 are in school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. He operates a kiosk and intends to use the Ksh 50,000 to pay school fees and expand his business by buying sugar and rice. His customers are the neighbors and passersby. Seasonality is his major challenge. Dzua has been in the business for the last 2 years. He joined Yehu to get capital for his business.

loans.use: to pay school fees and to expand his business by buying sugar and rice.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a charcoal and firewood selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transporting firewood. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase three sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

For the past year, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a stall in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Martin M's Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of a vocational institute based in Kenema city. This institute was founded in 1993. Teachers of the institute have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan. They requested a loan of 16,800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for the entire group. With the help of this loan, these teachers are in a better position to buy or invest in something that their mere salaries cannot let them do. 

Martin is the leader of the group. He is age thirty-five. He was born in Bo. He is married and has two children attending primary school. Martin has been in the teaching profession for eight years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials – cement, sand, rods, iron corrugated zincs, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house for the family.

loans.use: to buy house building materials – cement, sand, rods, iron corrugated zincs, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house for the family.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 4 children, and 3 of her children are in school. She also takes care of an additional family member (her sister’s daughter). She sells secondhand clothes. She sells her products on a door–to-door basis. She has been in this business for the last 6 years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of secondhand clothes. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a plot of land and also to get a permanent business premises. She lives in a rented house where the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, food and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Mwanaiki

texts.en:
Mwainiki is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and medical bills. 

She operates a fresh water selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 12,725 she wants to pay for her medical insurance coverage. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to pay for her medical insurance coverage.

loans.name: Mjeni

texts.en:
Mjeni, a married woman with three children, two of whom are enrolled in school, owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her biggest expense is food for the family.

Mjeni, who has been operating a bodaboda (motor bike) business for two years, is requesting a loan of KES 30000 to service her motor bike and buy spare parts. Seasonality is her major challenge, especially the rainy season, and her customers are neighbors and passersby. The family's other source of income is her husband's earnings

loans.use: to service her motor bike and buy spare parts.

loans.name: Mwanamvua

texts.en: Mwanamvua is taking out another Kiva loan of KSE 30,000 to establish an open food market. With the loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, cereals, cooking fat oil and utensils for cooking. Thanks for Yehu and Kiva lenders for giving her an opportunity to access loans.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, cereals, cooking fat oil and utensils for cooking.

loans.name: Tima

texts.en:
Tima is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transporting clothes from the market to her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase bundles of Khanga’s (traditional African sarongs) and shoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of Khanga’s and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 4 children and all her children are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (two orphans). She is a tailor. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 5 years. She works six days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more rolls of clothing materials (Bitengi). She generates additional income from her primary school and a day and night parking lot. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. 

Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and to buy a plot of land. She lives in her own house where the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing materials (Bitengi).

loans.name: Rebacca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 32-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has 3 children between the ages of 10 and 2. Two of them go to school. 

She runs a tea business, and she has been in the business for 2 years. She has 1 employee. Rebecca heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients and from outreach and promotions done by the loan officers. She is taking a loan of 2,000 SDG to purchase more items like milk, sugar, and many others. She has no other source of income in addition to this business.

In 5 years time, she would like to hope for increments in the business size and also to build a house. Her major challenges include her low income rate and government plans. Rebecca says that she is happy for Finance Sudan’s support as it’s going to eradicate their poverty and make them able to pay for their children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items like milk, sugar, and many others.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson runs a motorcycle transport business in Nakuru town. He is 22 years of age and the father of one child. Besides the motorcycle transport business, he also supplies and sells bread to various shops and markets in Nakuru, using his motorbike as a secondary business. 

He plans to use this loan amount to buy more bread to sell, both within the town and other areas. This will enable him meet his clients' high demands and also serve them well.

In the future, Benson hopes to grow his business and buy a pickup to supply bread to all of Nakuru and to other regions, hence increase his income.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread to sell.

loans.name: Jaime Alberto

texts.es:
Jaime, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, para seguir cultivando la tierra, preparando el terreno y comprarse insumos agrícolas como abono, semilla, pago de mozos, con esto espera iniciar el proceso, del que espera tener buenos resultados.
El efecto del préstamo anterior en su trabajo, fue positivo, ya que hizo las inversiones necesarias y su cultivo dio una buena producción, ha logrado mantener a su familia, tambien ha tenido trabajo con su ganado.
texts.en:
Jaime decided to take out a new loan in order to continue farming his land, preparing the ground and to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, seeds, and to pay workers. With this he hopes to start the process and he expects to have good results.

The previous loan had a good effect on his work as he made the necessary investments and his harvest produced a good yield. He managed to maintain his family and he has also had work with his cattle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and to pay workers.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en: Hadija is a married woman who has 6 children, 4 attending school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She has been selling paraffin for the last 2 years. She sells her paraffin to her neighbors from home. With the loan of KES 15,000, she plans to add to the stock for her business. She describes her major challenge to be high transportation cost, and her monthly expenses to be food and school fees.

loans.use: to add paraffin to stock for her business.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a washing soap and clothes-selling business. She sells from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. Dama faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation, moving from door to door. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase chemicals for making soap for sale and bundles of clothes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals for making soap for sale and bundles of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Paulo

texts.en:
Paulo is a 50-year-old married man with 12 children living in Hioma, Uganda. 

He a farmer and has been farming for 30 years. He faces a challenge of seasonal weather and price fluctuations. His personal goal is to educate his children and build a permanent house for his family. His business goal is to buy land to grow crops and expand his business to new markets.

Paulo intends to use the loan to hire employees to help him in farming.

loans.use: to hire employees to help him in farming.

loans.name: Bihija

texts.en:
Bihija is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her basic needs. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more items like beer, sodas, plastic chairs, tables and many others.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 8 children and two of her children are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She is a poultry farmer. She sells her products retail and from home. She has been in this business for the last 9 months. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of poultry feed and medicine. 

Victoria's major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to expand her business so that she owns 2000 chickens and also to educate her children up to university. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feed and medicine

loans.name: Zula

texts.en:
Zula lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children and three of her children are in school. She has no additional family members. She lives in her own house and her family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

She sells second-hand clothes on a door-to-door basis. She has been in this business for the last eight years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of a second-hand clothes. 

Her major business challenges are the rainy season and the increasing prices of used clothes. Her goals and aspirations are to get a permanent business premise where her customers can find her and also to start importing used clothes.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sodas for resale.

loans.name: Jorame

texts.en:
Jorame is a 33-year-old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda.

He has been in a tailoring business for 12 years. He was formerly employed but later started his own shop.

His hardships are customers not paying on time, seasonal weather and high taxes. His personal goal is building a permanent home and his business goal is expanding his business into new markets.

Jorame wants a loan to buy clothes to resell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Abadahemuka Group

texts.fr:
Séraphine fait partie du groupe Abadahemuka et habite à Gitega. Elle a 43 ans et est mariée à Joseph, marchand d’habits. Ensemble ils ont  2 enfants, l’aîné de 8ans, est à l’école primaire.

Elle fait le commerce de beignets depuis 8ans.

Elle est à son quinzième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter des kilos de farine additionels, pour fabriquer une grande quantité de beignets, à vendre pour gagner plus.

Grâce au gain de son commerce, elle assure les soins de santé, les frais scolaires de son enfant, et la ration alimentaire de la famille. Elle a déjà acheté 3 porcs et 4 chèvres pour préparer l'avenir des enfants.
texts.en:
Séraphine is a member of the ABADAHEMUKA group and lives in Gitega.  She is 43 years old and is married to Joseph, a clothes merchant.  They have two children together.  The oldest is 8 years old and is in elementary school.

Séraphine has been selling fritters for 8 years.

This is her 15th loan with Turame.  With her Kiva loan, she will increase her capital and buy extra kilos of flour.  She will then prepare a large quantity of fritters which she will sell to make more money.

With the earnings from her business, Séraphine takes care of her family's health costs and food expenses.  She also pays her child's tuition fees.  She has already bought 3 pigs and 4 goats to prepare her children's future.

loans.use: to buy several kilos of flour, which will serve to make large quantities of fritters for resale.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated a water supply business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also owns real estate houses which earn her another source of income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing more real estate houses in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase a water tank for storing more water for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank for storing more water for sale.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en: Sauda  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with 4 children and all her children are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her sister’s daughter). She operates a restaurant. She has been in this business for the last 15 years. She works seven days a week and has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas, rice, beef, and sweet potatoes. Her major business challenges are seasonality and increasing prices of foodstuffs. Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked restaurant and also to educate her children up to university. She lives in her own house but her family does not have access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, beef, rice and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Cuatro Fantasticos Group

texts.es: El señor José Luis tiene 48 años de edad, el esta casado con la señora Soira la cual le ayuda a cuidar su tienda de abarrotes, ellos tienen dos hijos estudiantes de secundaria. El es parte del grupo llamado los cuatro fantásticos y dice que se les ocurrió ese nombre porque son cuatro integrantes los cuales son personas que le echan muchas ganas al trabajo y muy emprendedores para los negocios que les han funcionado muy bien. El tiene un negocio de abarrotes en una localidad llamada Crescencio Morales donde todavía se habla y se viste la cultura mazahua, dice que tiene con su negocio desde hace mas de 6 años y platica que lo puso porque ahí no había tantas tiendas antes y como tiene muy bien surtida su tienda la gente no se traslada hasta otros lugares  comprar lo necesario para vivir. Aparte también don José Luis tiene un par de Taxis en la ciudad de México y parte de la semana se va a trabajarlos para estar al pendiente de ellos. El esta pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para la compra de artículos como aceite, leche, huevo, azúcar, sal, galletas,, papel higiénico, cloro, detergentes, sopas, focos etc. Dice que el surtirá en tiendas en la ciudad de México para tener muy bien surtido su negocio que es el mejor surtido de su localidad. Los otros 3 integrantes del grupo se llaman Maribel, Idilberto y Lilia ellos invertirán sus créditos en la compra de frutas y legumbres de temporada, en una pollería para vender el pollos por kilos y en un depósito de refrescos y jugos.
texts.en:
José Luis is 48 years old. He is married to Soira, who helps him in his grocery store. They have two children who study at secondary school. He is part of a group called 'Los Cuatro Fantásticos' [The Fantastic Four] and he says that they came up with this name because there is four of them, they all commit themselves fully to their work and they are all entrepreneurs who have made their businesses work well.

José Luis has a grocery store in an area called Crescencio Morales, where people still talk and dress according to the Mazahua culture. He says that he has had his business for more than 6 years and he explains that he located it there because there weren't so many shops there before and as he has a good range of products people don't need to travel to other places to buy what they need to live.

Apart from this José Luis also has a couple of taxis in Mexico City and he goes there to work in this activity and watch over it for part of the week. He is requesting a loan from the MFI to buy products such as oil, milk, eggs, sugar, salt, biscuits, toilet paper, chlorine, detergents, soaps, light bulbs, etc. He says that he will stock up from shops in Mexico City in order to well stock his business, which is the best stocked in the area.

The three other members of the group are Maribel, Idilberto and Lilia. They will invest their loan in buying seasonal fruit and vegetables, in a poultry shop to sell chickens per kilo and in a drinks store.

loans.use: to stock their grocery store with sugar, milk, eggs, salt, fried foods, drinks, biscuits, oil, etc.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is a 45-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married with 6 children between the ages of 19 and 3 years old. Five of them go to school. 

Benjamin runs a food store business, and he has been in the business for 3 years.  He has 1 employee. Benjamin heard about Finance South Sudan from a radio advert as well marketing and promotion done in the market by the officers.  He is taking a loan of 3,000 SDG to purchase more items like maize flour, wheat flour and many others. In addition to this business, Benjamin has no other source of income. 

In 5 years time, Benjamin would like to hope for building a good house for his family. His major challenges include bringing the foodstuffs in from another country to South Sudan.
 
Benjamin says that he has a lot of appreciation for Finance South Sudan for supporting him with additional capital for the business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like maize flour, wheat flour and many others

loans.name: Jesus Misericordioso Group

texts.es:
El comité está compuesto por 13 integrantes de la ciudad de Encarnación. El grupo está aprendiendo el trabajo en equipo y desean poder todas juntas ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes, Lidia, está casada con José quien es chófer, tienen 2  hijos, por quienes ambos se esfuerzan al máximo día a día. Lidia se dedica a la venta de ropa, con lo cual puede ayudar a su familia a salir adelante. Su deseo es poder tener más variedad de ropas para vender y así poder ayudarle a su marido a poder generar un poco mas de ingresos.
Solicita el crédito para abastcerse con variedad de prendas, con lo cual podrá ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes. Agradece por la ayuda que esta recibiendo de kiva y de fundacion paraguaya.
texts.en:
This group is formed by 13 members from the city of Encarnación. The group is learning to work in a team and they wish to be able to work together to help their families.

One of the members, Lidia, is married to José, who is a chauffeur; they have 2 children for whom both provide for day by day. Lidia makes a living selling clothes, which allows her to help her family get ahead. Her wish is to be able to have a greater variety of clothing to sell and this way help her husband by generating a little more income.

She is requesting a loan in order to stock her business with a variety of clothes, which she will be able to her customers. She appreciates the help she is receiving from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en:
Raymond is 45 years old, married to Lilian and they have been blessed with six children. He has had a house rental business in Nakuru town now for the last eight years. Besides this, he also operates a retail shop. 

He plans to use this loan amount to buy more stock: cooking fat, sugar, soap and also rice for sale in his business.This will enable him to meet his clients' demand and also make more profits. 

In the future, Raymond hopes to grow both his house rental and retail businesses and own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To add more stock of  cooking fat, sugar, soap and also rice for sale

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munira is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has owned real estate houses, so tenants are her other source of income. In addition she also operates a food stall business from which she earns her other source of living. Munira faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing other real estate houses in the future.

With the Kshs 120,000 she wants to boost her juice business, purchase fruit for making juices for sale and renovate her real estate houses. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to boost her juice business, purchase fruit for making juices for sale and renovate her real estate houses.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children and all her children are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. She lives in a rented house and her family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.
 
Maria is a tailor at the market. She is also a seamstress. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last nine years. She works six days a week. 

She has requested for a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy rolls of clothing materials. 

Her major business challenges are seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also to build her house.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing materials.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is 42 years old, married, and has seven children living in Hioma, Uganda. 

He owns a retail shop and has been running it for three years. He faces challenges of price fluctuations and high fuel and transport costs. 

His family goal is to educate his children and build a permanent home. His business goal is to expand to new markets.

Andrew intends to use the loan to purchase salt and sugar for resale.

loans.use: to buy salt and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Eriab

texts.en:
Eriab is 46 years old, married, and has five children living in Hioma, Uganda.

He is a farmer and he grows maize and beans. He started by farming on his father's land but now he has his own small piece of land. He faces challenges of inadequate capital and price fluctuations. 

His personal goal is educating his children and building a permanent house. His business goal is diversifying his business and hiring employees to expand his business. 

Eriab needs the loan to buy maize and beans for planting as the rains have started.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans for planting.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent.

For the past six months, she has operated a beauty salon business where her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Clara dreams of expanding her business. 

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase a motorcycle to start a transport business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to start a transport business.

loans.name: Braulio

texts.es:
El Sr. Braulio es de la ciudad de Encarnación,  está casado. Comenta que se dedica a la compra y venta de celulares lleva a comercializar a la Argentina.
Se dedica a esto hace ya 9 años, lo que le ayuda a tener una buena clientela debido a la experiencia que tiene. Su meta es seguir trabajando y de esa forma seguir creciendo como microempresario. Su constante trabajo es para darle a su familia todo lo que ellos necesitan para un futuro mejor.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de celulares de diversos modelos, con lo que podrá surtirse y tener mayor variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes y de esa forma seguir trabajando. Agradece por la ayuda que está recibiendo pues es muy importante para él.
texts.en:
Braulio is from the city of Encarnación and he is married. He mentions that he makes a living buying and selling mobile phones, which he commercializes in Argentina. He has worked in this activity for the past nine years, which has helped him to form a good client base due to his experience. His goal is to continue working and in this way grow as a micro-businessman. His continual job in to provide everything that his family needs for a better future. 

He is requesting a loan to buy various models of mobile phones with which to stock his business. Then he will have a greater variety to offer to his customers and can continue working. He appreciates the help he is receiving as it is very important to him.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones for resale.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children and all her children are in school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

She sells fruits and vegetables at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last six years. She works six days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of passion fruits, watermelon, tomatoes, and onions. 

Her major business challenges are seasonality and perishability. Her goals and aspirations are to start going to villages for fruits and also to see her business grow big in order to sell on wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more bags of passion fruits, watermelon, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Abdou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdou, est commerçant depuis 30 ans maintenant. Il a ouvert une mercerie dans le marché du quartier. Abdou est marié et père de famille. 
Il est à son 3ème crédit et sollicite pour cette fois ci un montant de 300000FCFA pour  renouveler son stock  de mercerie (fils, fermeture, soye,  popeline, renfort) et divers autres  garnitures utilisées pour la couture. Il possède un bâtiment qu’il veut aussi réfectionner pour le mettre en location afin de diversifier ses sources de revenus et de pouvoir bien s’occuper  de la dépense quotidienne de son foyer.
Il a comme projet futur, d’ouvrir une autre cantine dans le même marché en comptant sur l’appui des préteurs.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdou has been a merchant for 30 years. He runs a haberdashery shop at the local market. He is married with children. 

He is seeking a third loan, this one in the amount of 300,000CFAF to replenish his stock of merchandise (thread, zippers, silk, poplin, lining) and various other sewing notions. 

He owns a building that he wishes to renovate to use as a rental property. This would allow him to diversify his sources of income and better handle the daily household expenses.  

His goal for the future is to open another shop at the same market with the support of his lenders.

loans.use: to buy haberdashery items for resale.

loans.name: Triunfadoras Leales De Motupe Group

texts.es: La Sra. Cristina de 52 años de edad, es separa y tiene 4 hijos los cuales ya no dependen de ella. Tiene 4 años como cliente de Edaprospo y se dedica a la venta de cosméticos en su hogar. Tiene 2 años en este negocio y comenzó con la idea de mejorar sus ingresos. También se dedica al servicio de limpieza. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado hacer crecer su negocio y aumentar su ingreso el cual lo destina al gasto de alimentación. Su plan para el futuro es construir el segundo piso de su casa y abrir un nuevo negocio. Ella usó el préstamo en la compra de más productos para su negocio ya que en estas fechas tiende a aumentar sus ventas. Cristina pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Triunfadoras Leales de Motupe”, el cual esta conformado por 7 personas y lleva más de 1 año como presidenta del grupo.
texts.en:
Cristina is 52 years old; She is separated and has four children who no longer depend on her. She has been a member of Edaprospo for four years and she makes a living selling cosmetics in her home. She has carried out this activity for two years and she started with the idea of improving her income. She also makes a living providing a cleaning service. With the efforts and hard work she has managed to make her business grow and increase her income, which she uses to buy food. 

Her plan for the future is to build a second floor onto her house and open a new business. She used her loan in buying more products for her business as at this time of year her sales tend to increase. Cristina belongs to the communal bank "Triunfadoras Leales de Motupe", which is formed by 7 people. She has been the president of the group for more than a year.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her cosmetics business.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a 41-year-old married lady with two children. She sells fruits and has been in this business for three years now. She earns a monthly income of 40,000 KES. 

This will be Irene's first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to increase her stock of assorted fruits and vegetables. In the future, she wants to expand her business and support her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan is 35 years old, married, and has three children who are all in school. 

Allan has a retail business that has been in operation for the last 10 years. 

He has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him buy more soap, cooking oil, etc. 

He hopes to open a big supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To buy soap, cooking oil, etc., for resale.

loans.name: Adelio

texts.es:
La Sr. Adelio tiene 41 años de edad, es macatero (Vendedor ambulante), está casado con el Sra. Julia de 43 años quien trabaja de empleada domestica. Ellos tienen tres hijos, todos son estudiantes.
 Don  Adelio empezó este negocio desde muy joven, tiene experiencia de 14 años. Se inicio en Asunción y Caacupé, hasta que decidió instalarse en Caaguazú hace algunos años y continúo por cuenta propia. Con las ganancias del negocio siempre pudo mantener su hogar y quitar adelante a su familia.
El Sr. Adelio solicita este crédito para la compra de ropas de  temporada invernal, y prepararse para la semana santa y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Adelio is 41 years old, he is a street vendor, he's married to Julia who is 43 years old and works as a housekeeper. They have three children who are all studying.

Adelio started his business when he was very young; he has 14 years experience. He started out in Asunción and Caacupé, until he decided to set up in Caaguazú some years ago and he continued on his own. With the profits from his business he has always been able to maintain his house and get his family ahead. 

Adelio requests this loan to buy clothing for the winter season and to prepare for Easter, thus satisfying his customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 31 años, vive en pareja con Ani,  en su casa la cual está terminando de a poco en la ciudad de Carapeguá.
Desde sus 18 años trabaja como albañil, ya que no tenía tantas oportunidades para el estudio y vio que esta profesión le podía dar un buen futuro. Los vecinos le tienen gran admiración por el espíritu servicial que posee, rescatando su honestidad y emprendedurismo.
Solicito el crédito para la compra de algunas herramientas, ya que las que posee están viejas y desgastadas y no le ayuda mucho en su trabajo. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la ayuda que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Manuel is 31 years old. He lives with his partner Ani, in the house they are finishing little by little in the city of Carapeguá.

He has worked as a bricklayer since he was 18. As he didn't have many opportunities to study, he saw that this profession could give him a good future. His neighbours admire his helpful spirit, his honesty and entrepreneurship.

He requests a loan to buy some tools as the ones he has are old and worn out and don't help him much in his work.

He appreciates the help he is receiving from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy is 45 years old, single, and has three children, one of whom attends school.  She lives in Nasana in the Kampala east region of Uganda.  For the past 10 years, Cissy has been working hard to manage her boutique where she sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Cissy is requesting a loan for 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda, which she will use to buy more clothes to sell.  The loan will help Cissy to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Cissy hopes that in the future she will be able to start a business of supplying cloth materials. 

Cissy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Cissy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.fr: Adjoa est femme de 30ans. Elle est mariée à un chaudronnier et a 02 enfants dont 01 à l’école. Le premier a 08ans et le dernier 02ans. Elle est revendeuse et jardinière. Elle sollicite ce premier crédit de WAGES pour acheter de l’engrais et des graines pour le jardinage.  Elle réinvestir dans son activité, acheter un autre terrain pour le jardinage et impliquer la famille dans l’activité. Elle a démarré en 2001.
texts.en: Adjoa is a 30-year old woman. She is married to a boilermaker and has two children, one of whom goes to school. Her children are 8 and 2 years old. She works as a retailer and gardener. Adjoa is asking for her first loan from WAGES to buy fertilizer and seeds for gardening.  She plans to reinvest in her business, buy another piece of land to cultivate, and get her family involved in her activity. Adjoa started her business in 2001.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Mayra Rosa

texts.es: Mayra Rosa es una emprendedora que ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, en el crédito anterior todo lo invirtió en el negocio en la compra de materiales para la producción del pan. La emprendedora nos expresa que con el apoyo que se le ha brindado ha aumentado la producción y sus clientes. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para la comprar productos como harina, huevos, manteca, levadura, mantequilla, vainilla entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Mayra Rosa is an entrepreneur who has been working with the Fundación León 2000 on her last loan.  She invested all of it in her business by purchasing materials to make bread.  

This entrepreneur says that with the support she has been given her production has increased, and she has more customers. 

She is currently requesting a loan to buy products like flour, eggs, lard, yeast, butter, and vanilla, among other products.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, lard, yeast, butter, and vanilla, among other products.

loans.name: Khanlar

texts.ru: Khanlar jenat, emu 52 goda, u nego chetvero detey vozrastov ot 20 do 27. Khanlar upravlayet svoim biznesom na protajenii 18 let. Osnovnaya sfera ego deyatelnosti eto pokupka I prodaja krupnogo rogatogo skota I moloka. Krome etogo on sobiraet moloko u mestnix jiteley I pereprodayet v molochnuyu firmu “Bilasuvar Agro”. Khanlar planiruet uvelichit kolichestvo jivotnix chtobi nachat rasshirit biznes I dla etogo emu nujni dengi v 1000 AZN. Na eti dengi on kupit baran.
texts.en: Khanlar is married. He is 52 years old, and has four children ranging between 20 and 27 years of age. Khanlar has been running his business for 18 years. His main business activity is buying and reselling cattle and milk. In addition, he collects milk from local and resells it to a dairy firm “Bilasuvar Agro.” Khanlar plans to  increase his livestock in order to expand his business. In order to do this, he needs 1,000 AZN. With this money, he plans to buy sheep.

loans.use: to buy sheep so as to expand the business.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 4 children and all her children are in school. She takes care of additional family members. 

Joan has a pub. She sells her products on retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 7 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more crates of beer and soda. Her major business challenges are seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked pub and also to build  her own house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel tiene 42 años de edad, es soltero, es de la ciudad de Villarrica.
El es taxista, y con mucho esfuerzo logró comprar para su vehículo propio. Comenta que su puesto está ubicado en un punto estratégico, lo cual le ayuda a tener buena clientela y a la vez buenos ingresos. Su meta es seguir creciendo y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia con el día a día.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de una batería para su vehículo, y también para reparaciones en general. El esta muy agradecido por la oportunidad que le esta dando la fundación y Kiva.
texts.en:
Miguel is 42 years old. He is single and comes from the city of Villarrica.

He is a taxi driver and with a lot of effort he managed to buy his own vehicle. He comments that his post is located in a strategic spot, which helps him to have a good customer base as well as a high income. His goal is to continue growing and in this way be able to continue helping his family with their daily needs. 

He requests a loan to buy a battery for his vehicle and also to pay for general repairs. He is very grateful for the opportunity that he has been given by the Fundación and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a battery and to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en: Ronald is 28 years old and married with one child. He is a farmer who faces challenges such as price fluctuations and seasonal weather variations. His personal goal is to educate his children and build a permanent home. His business goals are to buy land, grow crops and expand to new markets. He intends to use the loan to pay for the cost of hiring labor.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of hiring labor.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred is a hardworking farmer living in Hioma, Uganda. He has been farming for three years, and he farms on the family's land. However, Alfred faces challenges such as price fluctuations and inadequate capital. His family goals are to build a permanent house and buy a car. He hopes to diversify his business and hire employees. Alfred needs the loan to buy maize and beans for planting.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans for planting.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is a 36-year-old single mother of one child who lives in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in cosmetics sales for 10 years. 

She began as a helper in a salon and later started a cosmetic shop. 

Her hardships are price fluctuations, inadequate capital to purchase stock and high taxes. Her personal goals are educating her child, building a permanent home and buying a car. Her business goals are diversifying her business and buying land on which to grow crops. 

Teddy is requesting a loan to buy hair weaves and other cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy hair weaves and other cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala east region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children, with one of them currently in school. For the past 7 years, Emmanuel has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar and soap, etc. 

To help expand his business, Emmanuel has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities and will help Emmanuel to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his child. Emmanuel hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Emmanuel is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Emmanuel who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kasangati in the Kampala east region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children who are both currently in school. For the past 3 years, Lawrence has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar and soap, etc. 

To help expand his business, Lawrence has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential goods and will help Lawrence to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Lawrence hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Lawrence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Lawrence who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more essential goods

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Antonio es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 35 años de edad, es soltero y tiene un hijo pequeño que va a la escuela, el cual depende de el.
Antonio tiene una Oleria en su casa, mediante este trabajo ha podido dar a su familia todo lo que ellos necesitan para una vida digna y sin privaciones. El es una persona muy trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar, y es por ello que siempre se esfuerza.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de arcilla, lo cual es el elemento fundamental de su trabajo. Esta agradecido por la ayuda que recibe de la fundación y de kiva, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Antonio is from the city of Santaní. He is 35 years old, single and has a young son who goes to school and depends on him.

Antonio runs a 'olería', a place where bricks are made from clay, in his house. By means of this work he has been able to give his family all that they need in order to have a dignified life without suffering hardships. He is a hard working person who wants to get ahead and progress and this is why he always makes a great effort.

He is requesting a loan to buy clay, which is fundamental for his job. He is grateful for the help he receives from the Fundación and from Kiva, as it is of great help.

loans.use: to buy clay.

loans.name: Guido

texts.es:
El señor Guido de 30 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. Mirna, tienen un hijo, ella le ayuda en su negocio, tienen una casa de venta de celulares y accesorios bien surtidos, además el Sr Guido realiza reparaciones de celulares de todas marcas y modelos.
Guido comenzó desde muy joven vendiendo mercaderías de forma ambulante por toda la ciudad de Villarrica, hace 5 años pudo con un ahorro y créditos obtenidos abrir su negocio en un lugar bastante concurrido. Desde siempre recibe la ayuda de su esposa quien hace las ventas especialmente recargas de saldos y activaciones, mientras él repara celulares y realiza compras de Ciudad del Este.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de celulares, carcasas, estuches, cargadores, con lo que quiere tener un buen stock y de esa forma seguir manteniendo sus ventas, e incrementar sus ingresos que le permitirá seguir mejorando su nivel de vida y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Guido is 30 years old. He is married to Mirna and they have a son. She helps him in his business; they have a phone shop where they sell mobile phones and a wide range of accessories. Guido also carries out repairs on all makes and models of mobile phone.

Guido started selling stocks as a street vendor when he was very young in all the city of Villarrica. Five years ago, thanks to his savings and conceded loans, he was able to open his business in a fairly busy place. He has always received the help of his wife who makes sales, especially phone credit top ups and activations, while he repairs mobile phones and buys in Cuidad del Este.

He requests a loan to buy mobile phones, shells, cases, chargers, etc. with which he wants to have a good stock. In this way he will continue maintaining his sales and will increase his income, which will allow him to continue improving his and his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones, shells, cases, chargers, etc.

loans.name: Ada Luz

texts.es: Ada Luz de 53 años de edad vive en un tradicional barrio de la ciudad con su esposo y tiene una hija de 28 años. Ella vende medicamentos en un local arrendado, ubicado  frente al hospital de la ciudad; su negocio inició hace 15 años, con recursos propios provenientes de su trabajo como instrumentadora, para apoyar el bienestar de su familia, contribuyendo con los gastos del hogar. La ubicación de su negocio frente a un hospital es oportunidad de incrementar sus ventas cada vez más y aumentar sus utilidades y su capital de trabajo para comprar las medicinas que se requieren, son su mayor desafío porque se torna insuficiente ante su propósito de ventas.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual comprará medicina que tiene mayor rotación en su farmacia, con el fin de aumentar el volumen de sus ventas y mantener  la farmacia siempre bien surtida. Su sueño mas adelante es tener una casa propia y en esto enfoca sus esfuerzos para lograr un mañana mas tranquilo.
texts.en:
Ada Luz, age 53, lives in a tradional neighborhood with her husband.  She has a 28 year old daughter.  She sells medicine at a rented spot in front of the city hospital.

She started her business 15 years ago with her own resources from her work as a nurse.  She did this in order to support her family’s well-being and to contribute to the household expenses.

Her business location in front of the hospital is opportune for increasing her sales more and more, her profits, and her work capital to buy the medicines she needs.  They are her greatest challenge because they do not have a sufficient turn around for her sales plan.

She is currently applying for her first Kiva loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy medicine that turns around more quickly for her pharmacy. 

Her goal is to increase her volume of sales and to keep her pharmacy well-stocked.

Her dream for later on is to have her own home.  She focuses her efforts on this dream in order to have a more comfortable future.

loans.use: to buy medicine that turns around more quickly for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es: Luis con su credikiva anterior compró en mayor cantidad sus víveres de mayor rotación como aceites, pastas, leche en polvo, café detergente etc. El agradece y pide a sus  financiadores lo siguiente: “Sigan apoyando a este programa ya que estamos logrando objetivos pendientes de realizar. “ En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el que comprará un mayor número de artículos de la canasta familiar que están siendo ofrecidos por sus proveedores con descuentos al ser comprados en mayor volumen; con ello tendrá un buen inventario y muy elegantemente surtida su tienda, ofreciendo a su clientela diversidad de artículos, con los que satisfacer sus necesidades y esto es justamente lo que garantiza el éxito de su inversión.
texts.en:
With his previous Kiva loan Luis bought wholesale his supplies that sell the most, such as oil, pasta, powdered milk, coffee, detergent, etc.  He thanks his lenders and requests the following: "Continue supporting this program because we are achieving our unrealized goals."

Currently he is applying for another Kiva loan with which he will buy a greater number of staple items being offered by his providers with discounts for wholesale purchases.  With this he will have a good inventory and a very elegantly stocked store to offer his customers a variety of articles to satisfy their needs.  This is exactly what guarantees the success of his investment.

loans.use: to buy a greater number of staple items.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen is 30 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom attend school.  She lives in Nasana in the Kampala east region of Uganda. For the past six years, Allen has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells food and vegetables. 

To help expand her business, Allen is requesting a loan for 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda, which she will use to buy more food and vegetables to sell.  This loan will help Allen to generate greater profits and pay for her children's medical expenses. Allen hopes that in the future she will be able to open a grocery business. 

Allen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Allen who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase food and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Sol Marina

texts.es: Sol con su anterior credikiva compró de contado y en mayor volumen  medicinas naturales, ropa, cosméticos, calzado y variedades; ella  aprovechó  las fechas especiales como día de la secretaria y día de la madre, comercialmente le fue muy bien, obtuvo  sus mejores  ingresos en cuanto se incrementaron sus ventas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva y está haciéndolo en la misma temporada que el anterior; ahora responderá a pedidos de sus clientes y ajustará sus compras a sus solicitudes de ropa cosméticos, calzado y variedades. Con ello una vez mas aumentará su capital de trabajo y cada día crecerá un poco más su negocio; esto es justamente lo que garantiza el éxito de su inversión. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva el es siguiente: Muchos agradecimientos a Kiva y a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, deseo que me sigan apoyando, para continuar progresando personal, familiar y profesionalmente.”
texts.en:
Sol used her previous Kiva loan to buy natural medicines, clothes, cosmetics, shoes, and a variety of ítems for cash and in greater volumen.  She took advantage of special dates like Secretary’s Day and Mother’s day.  Sales went very well for her.  She got better income as she increased her sales.

She is now applying for a new Kiva loan.  She is doing so in the same season as the previous loan.  She will now fill her customers’ orders, and she will adjust her purchases to requested items like clothes, cosmetics, shoes, and a variety of items.  

With these purchases she will once again increase her working capital, and her business will grow a little more every day.  This is exactly what guarantees the success of her investment.  

Her message to the Kiva lenders is the following:  “Many thanks to Kiva and the Fundación Mario Santo Domino.  I hope you continue supporting me in order for me progress personally, professionally, and with my family."

loans.use: to buy clothes, cosmetics, shoes, and a variety of items.

loans.name: Gumane Group

texts.fr:
J.Marie fait partie du groupe Gumane  et habite à Ruyigi. Il a 31 ans et est marié à Noëlla, cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants, l’un  étudie en première maternelle,l'autre n'étudie  pas encore.

Il  fait le commerce de boutique (riz, haricot, sel,…) depuis 12 ans. 

Il est à son cinquième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter des articles de plusieurs sortes pour satisfaire ses clients.Cela va lui permettre de gagner plus.
texts.en:
J. Marie lives in Ruyigi and is a member of Gumane Group. He's 31 years old and married to Noëlla, a cultivator. Together, they have two children. One goes to kindergarten, the other doesn't go to school yet.

For twelve years, J. Marie has been selling various products (rice, beans, salt, etc.) in his shop. He's seeking his fifth loan from Kiva's partner, Turame.

He will use it to bolster his working capital and purchase various sorts of products to meet customer demand. This will enable him to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy various products, such as rice, beans, salt, etc.

loans.name: Avtandil

texts.en:
Avtandil is 50 years old. He lives in a small village of the Samtredia District with his family; wife, Marina and a 21-years-old daughter who is a student. Marina works as a sales lady at a local store. She gets monthly salary in the amount of 200 Laris per month. The family also sells a small harvest of nuts every year. The total average monthly income of the family is 250 Laris. According to Credo estimations, they are in the subsistence poor category. 

With the requested credit Avtandil will re-start the functioning of a family owned bread bakery. A year ago Avtandil stopped the business, because he didn’t have any funds for financing the bakery’s ongoing costs. His loan request was approved based on a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program credits businesses in areas with soft financial conditions, such as the rural poor, who do not have access to credit products as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Avtandil will purchase flour and wood. He will produce traditional Georgian bread and sell it in the village. The income of the family will increase by 300 – 400 Laris, which will mean 120 – 160% increase. The living conditions of the family will significantly improve and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market.

loans.use: to purchase flour for re-starting the bakery.

loans.name: Las Tinyarinas Group

texts.es:
La Srta. EDITH CONSUELO de 22 años de edad soltera, actualmente es socia en la alcancía comunal, siempre carismática y emprendedora del grupo “LAS TINYARINAS” grupo conformado por 07 personas. 
EDITH CONSUELO se dedica a la venta cosméticos de belleza productos EVON que vende en el local de su casa, ya que ella se esmera en aperturas otros nuevos locales de ventas
El préstamo solicito para incrementar su capital de trabajo y comprar accesorios de cosméticos, perfumes, etc. 
Sus objetivos para el futuro es aperturar su salón de belleza. Ella se ubicada la segunda persona  lado derecha viste con polo color celeste casaca color negro.
texts.en:
Mrs. Edith Consuelo is 22 years old, single and lives in a village. She a charismatic and enterprising member of “The Tinyarinas” group, made up of seven members.
Edith Consuelo sells Avon beauty products and cosmetics. She sells them dooor-to-door. She is always looking for new places to sell her products.
This loan, which she is requesting, will be used for working capital and to buy accessories such as cosmetics, perfumes, etc.
Her future goal is to open a beauty salon. She is the second person from the right in the photo. She is wearing a light blue shirt and black jac

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is 26 years old. He lives in the Khoni District of West Georgia with his family: his wife, Tamar, his two sons (3 and 2 years old), his father and grandmother. Zurab is the only income provider in the family. He trades on the local open market, selling nuts and maize. The family lives below the poverty line, and they receive social assistance from the local government. The total average monthly income of the family is 270 Laris, including social assistance. Zurab requested credit for the start-up of a trade business. 

His loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits, with soft conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Zurab will purchase a mini-bus. He will use it for trade activity, selling fruits and vegetables. He will purchase fruits and vegetables from local farmers at wholesale prices and take them with the mini-bus to nearby towns for resale. According to Zurab’s estimations, the monthly income of the family will increase by approximately 300 Laris, which means a 110% increase. Zurab will be able to create better living conditions for his children, as well as the other family members. Also, the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market in the future, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-bus for trading with fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Valeri

texts.en:
Valeri is 56 years old. He lives in the Khoni district with his 14-year-old daughter Khatia. She goes to school. Valeri’s wife is out of the country. She works abroad and helps her family financially. Valeri grows maize on a family-owned plot of land. He sells harvested maize in the village. The total average monthly income of the family equals 200 Laris. The family lives in poverty.  

Valeri requested credit for the start-up of a grocery store. He has constructed a small building for the store. It is located near his house. With the requested credit he will purchase refrigerators for the store as well as some grocery products for resale. According to his estimations, his store will work well, as there are no more similar stores. Also he will attract clients with quality service and a wide assortment of products. 

Valeri’s loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-ups and re-startup credits, with soft conditions to the country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. After the start-up of the business, the living conditions of the family will significantly improve and they will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase refrigerators for the start-up of a grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pagnes (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is 27 years old.  She lives in a small village of Tskaltubo District.  She lives with her family: husband – Zaza, her five-year-old daughter, her four-year-old son and her father in law.  The family earns a living through agricultural business.  They have a plot of land, where greens are grown.  Zaza sells harvested greens at Kutaisi (a nearby town) market. The total average monthly income of the family is 150 Laris per month.  According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the category 'subsistence poor'. 

Manana has requested credit for the construction of greenhouses.  Her loan request was approved in the frame of new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo.  The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit Manana will purchase materials to construct greenhouses (iron pillars and polyethylene) and vegetable seeds. Zaza and Manana will grow greens, cucumbers and tomatoes in the greenhouses throughout the whole year.  They will sell the harvested products on Kutaisi Market.  The income of the family will significantly increase.  They will be able to combat their poverty and in the future the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase materials to construct greenhouses and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 56 years old. He lives in a small village of Zestaponi District with his family: his two sons (21 and 15 years old), his daughter-in-law and his one-year-old granddaughter. David’s wife is an emigrant; she works abroad and assists her family financially. 

David earns a living through agricultural business. They have a milk cow and 200 nut trees. Dairy products are mainly consumed by the family; a small surplus and the nut harvest are sold in the Zestaponi District by David. Total average monthly income of the family from the above-mentioned activities is 150 Laris. David’s wife sends them money monthly, but still, according to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

David requested credit for the start up of a small poultry farm. His loan request was approved in the framework of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with easy conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

 With the received credit David will purchase chickens and place them in the old hen-house, located in the family yard. Also, part of the credit will be used for purchasing feed for the chickens.  He will grow chickens and start selling them in 3-4 months. Also, David will sell eggs as well. According to his estimations, the monthly income of the family will increase by 300 – 350 Laris. That will mean a 100 – 133% increase. The family will be able to improve their living conditions. In addition to the above-mentioned, in the future the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on country’s capital market, for further expansion of their new business.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to start up a poultry farm

loans.name: Sayangana Group

texts.fr:
Edouard fait partie du groupe Sayangana et habite à Gitega. Il  a 33 ans et est marié à Frédérique, cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont  2 enfants,  dont un,  étudie à l’école primaire.

Il fait le commerce du riz, haricot,… depuis 8ans.

Il est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de riz, haricot,... à revendre pour gagner plus.

Les gains tirés du commerce, lui permet d’améliorer la ration alimentaire. Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  acheter des terres cultivables.
texts.en:
Edouard lives in Gitega and is a member of the Sayangana group. He is 33 years old and married to a farmer named Frédérique. They have two children, one of whom is in primary school.

He has been selling rice, beans,...for the past eight years.

He is on his third loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan that he receives, he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity of rice, beans,...to resell in order to earn more.

The profit that he makes from his business allows him to improve his food intake. In the coming years, he would like to buy some farmland.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of rice, beans,...to resell in order to earn more

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 50 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala east region of Uganda. He is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 5 years, Samuel has been working hard to manage his stationery shop, which also sells books. 

To help expand his business, Samuel has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more books, pens and printing paper for resale and will help Samuel to generate greater profits and cover medical expenses. Samuel hopes that in the future he will be able to expand with various branches of the same business. 

Samuel is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Samuel who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more books, pens and printing paper for resale

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es: Angélica de 34 años de edad vive en el municipio de Soledad y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 9 y 12 años. Ella se dedica al comercio mediante una miscelánea ubicada en su casa donde vende artículos de misceláneas, como accesorios femeninos, de hogar y ofrece el servicio de telecomunicaciones mediante celulares, vendiendo minutos, productos alimenticios y ofrece el servicio de impresiones. Su vida de negocio inició porque no tenía un trabajo formal y fueron muchas las hojas de vida que llevara a empresas, donde no pudo ingresar para obtener un empleo formal y de calidad. Con la responsabilidad de sus dos hijos,  su inquilino de un local de su propiedad, le insinuó que emprendiera su propio negocio y esto fue hace 4 años, desde los cuales ha ido poco a poco creciendo, compró dos vitrinas, un computador, impresora y cada día que pasa resulta desafiante atender  la clientela, con la infraestructura que hoy cuenta. Su mercado le señala la necesidad de tener una impresora mas, una fotocopiadora para ofrecer un nuevo servicio y mantener las vitrinas bien surtidas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará una fotocopiadora y mercancía variada con la cual surtirá sus vitrinas. La inversión planea ser exitosa porque responde a la demanda y la hace en el marco de su experiencia como comerciante. Su sueño más adelante es tener un café internet, con la infraestructura necesaria para que sus clientes se sientan en un ambiente confortable,  mientras satisfacen sus necesidades de estos servicios tan modernos.
texts.en: Angélica is 34 years old and lives in the town of Soledad. She has two children, ages 9 and 12. She sells miscellaneous merchandise from her house such as feminine and household accessories and telecommunications services such as cell phones, cell phone usage minutes, food products and printing services. She began this business because she didn’t have a formal job. She needed a lot of documentation to get a formal job and she wasn’t able to get the paperwork for a good job. With the responsibilty of two children and her rent for her house, she began her own business four years ago. Little by little it has been growing. She has bought two display cabinets, a computer and a printer. Each day it is challenging to serve her customers with the infrastructure that she currently possesses. She needs a second printer to keep up with her business, a copy machine to offer a new service and she needs have a variety of products in her display cabinets. This is her first application with KIVA through “The Mario Santo Domingo Foundation”. With this loan she will buy a copy machine and various merchandise to provide a variety of items in her display cabinets. This investment will be successful as it is in response to customer demand. She is making these purchases with the knowledge she has as a businessperson. Her dream for the future is to have an internet café with the infrastructure necessary to make her customers comfortable while they participate in these modern services.

loans.use: to buy a copy machine and various merchandise to restock her display cabinets.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kisasi in the Kampala east region of Uganda. He is married and has 6 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Isaac has been working hard to manage his stationery shop, which also sells books. 

To help expand his business, Isaac has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more books, pens and printing paper for resale and will help Isaac to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Isaac hopes that in the future he will be able to improve his business by buying more inventory that will attract more customers. 

Isaac is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Isaac who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more books, pens and printing paper for resale

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kasangati in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children. For the past 8 years, Aisha has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale and will help Aisha to generate greater profits and reduce poverty in her family. Aisha hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business more. 

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Aisha who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Hanifah

texts.en:
Hanifah is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are both currently in school. For the past 2 years, Hanifah has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells video CD's. 

To help expand her business, Hanifah has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more video CD's for resale, and will help Hanifah to generate greater profits and cover medical expenses for her family. Hanifah hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Hanifah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hanifah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more video CD's for resale

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 32 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, one of whom is currently enrolled in school. For the past five years, James has worked hard to manage his small business, which involves selling building bricks. 

To help expand his business, James has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. He will use this loan to buy more materials for making bricks, generate greater profits and pay school fees for his child. James hopes that in the future he will be able to start a retail shop. 

He is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP), which serves small entrepreneurs who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making bricks,

loans.name: Alba

texts.es: Alba está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva porque necesita comprar tanques plásticos para comercializarlos y aumentar su capital de trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Con su anterior credikiva logró comprar tambores plásticos y los comercializó en las ciudades de Montería, Sincelejo y Magangúe, lugares también ubicados en la costa  Caribe de Colombia. Con ellos les fue muy bien porque rotó rápidamente su capital y logró un ligero aumento en sus ventas. En su mensaje a los financiadores dice lo siguiente: “Muy agradecida con esas personas que nos han ayudado para seguir adelante en nuestros negocios y continúen con esta bonita labor. “.
texts.en: Alba is applying for a new Kiva loan because she needs to buy plastic tanks to sell and increase her working capital as she has been doing.  With her previous Kiva loan, she was able to buy plastic drums. She sold them in the cities of Montería, Sincelejo, and Magangúe, also located on the Caribbean coast of Colombia. She did very well with them because she quickly turned over her capital and achieved a slight increase in her sales. In her message to the lenders she says the following: "Very grateful to these people who have helped us to move forward in our businesses, and may they continue with this beautiful work."

loans.use: to buy plastic tanks to sell

loans.name: Gurenik

texts.en:
Gurenik is 54 years old. He lives in Stepanavan town, in the North of Armenia, with his family: his wife, son and two daughters. Gurenik is a fireman and works at the city fire service. Besides that, Gurenik also runs a little farm where he breeds cattle. Gureneik has been breeding cattle for 3 years.

Gurenik has applied for this loan to expand his farm. With the loan's help he will purchase cattle and forage to feed them. This will allow Gurenik to gather more income, which is important for him to be able to renovate the barn and create better conditions for cattle breeding.

loans.use: to pay for cattle and forage

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 47 years old and lives in the town of Kasangati in the Kampala east region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 2 years, Henry has been working hard to manage his small business, which does welding, making metal doors and windows. 

To help expand his business, Henry has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more metal materials for making doors for resale and will help Henry to generate greater profits and pay his children's school fees. Henry hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Henry is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Henry who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more metal materials for making doors for resale

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es: Rosa tiene un negocio de variedades como ropa, calzado, perfumes, desodorantes, sombrillas entre otros artículos y también vende queso y suero costeño, que constituyen sus ingresos adicionales. Rosa inició vendiendo pocas mercancías y con el transcurrir del tiempo ha ido creciendo y agregando opciones como la venta de suero y queso que ofrece a su ya fiel clientela.
