loans.use: buy cattle and fodder

loans.name: Yesika

texts.en:
Yesika is 29 years old and has been selling footwear for about seven years. One day, she would like to open her own store, but for now she sells shoes in the market. When it rains, she says she has to find cover or she will get wet. Yesika will use the loan in order to purchase more merchandise from wholesalers who come to Cusco from Arequipa on the weekends. Given her experience in the business, Yesica says she understands the current fashion and has a good sense of what styles will sell. Her customers can purchase everything from sandals to boots to high heels from Yesica, for men, women, and children.

Yesika recently gave birth to her first daughter, whom she is raising with her partner. In addition to opening her own storefront, she hopes to buy a house to accommodate her growing family. 

Yesika is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Las Mercedes de Kataniray" in Cusco, which is located close to the Incan ruins of Macchu Picchu in the Andean mountains. The bank is in its fourth cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy shoes at wholesale

loans.name: Mujeres De Union Y Paz 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Rosa is the coordinator of the group called Mujeres de Union y Paz (Women of Union and Peace) 1, 2, 3 & 4. She is a single mother of two children, and they live together in a modest home. This group is located in the rural areas surrounding San Pedro de Macoris. They all live in a rural community, surrounded by sugarcane fields.

Rosa has operated her used clothing business for about eight years, having started it with some capital she saved from her former enterprise selling underwear. Having promptly repaid her previous loans, Rosa is excited to be taking her 10th loan from Esperanza with which she will invest in her business and buy two packages of clothing. She is planning to use her profits to build her house and further develop the business.

Rosa says that her most difficult challenge has been to stop selling on credit, because sometimes clients do not pay on time; however, not all of her clients can make cash purchases. Meanwhile, she plans to continue to enjoy working, and dreams of completing her house.

loans.use: to buy used clothes, bags and underwear.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar has been working in the public domain for 16 years as an employee of the Ministry of the Interior. He is now 42 years old and married with two children. He says that he likes working with Asociación Arariwa because the village bank fosters a sense of community and teamwork between members. Also, he likes that the village bank enables him to save money and generate interest from his savings.

Edgar is requesting a loan in order to start a business raising chickens and guinea pigs in his home. He will use the loan to buy the animals, and later he will sell them for a profit. In the long run, Edgar would like to buy and sell agricultural products.

Edgar is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Las Mercedes de Kataniray" in Cusco, which is located close to the Incan ruins of Macchu Picchu in the Andean mountains. The bank is in its fourth cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy chickens and guinea pigs

loans.name: Zonia

texts.en:
Zonia is a 30-year-old mother of a baby girl who is 1 year and 8 months old. Zonia stays at home in the house taking care of her daughter while her partner works. Depending on the season, Zonia may take her daughter with her when she goes to sell clothes in one of the city plazas. She says that her business is largely seasonal, with the best times of year being Christmas and the start of the school year. 

Zonia is requesting a loan in order to buy clothing from wholesalers in Cusco, so that she can continue her microbusiness. In the future, she would like to have a fixed storefront from which she can sell her merchandise.

Zonia is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Las Mercedes de Kataniray" in Cusco, which is located close to the Incan ruins of Macchu Picchu in the Andean mountains. The bank is in its fourth cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy clothing at wholesale

loans.name: Marleni

texts.en:
Marleni is 32 years old. She and her husband recently welcomed into the world their first daughter six months ago. Unfortunately, their daughter was born with hip dysplasia, which means that her hip socket is abnormally formed and can cause crippling lameness and joint pain if left untreated. Marleni is requesting the loan in order to pay for her daughter’s medical treatment.

Marleni currently works for a business, but is planning to open a store selling children’s clothes. She wants to have the new business open in time for Christmas, and hopes to leverage her previous retail experience working in a clothing store while she was in school.

Marleni is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Las Mercedes de Kataniray" in Cusco, which is located close to the Incan ruins of Macchu Picchu in the Andean mountains. The bank is in its fourth cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to pay for her infant daughter's medical treatment

loans.name: Franklin David

texts.es: Franklin tiene 31 años. Nació en Jipijapa donde predomina la ganadería. Hace ya varios años que dejo su ciudad natal, actualmente vive en Guayaquil con su esposa  y sus 3 hijos de 4, 7 y 9 años de edad quienes estudian en una escuela fiscal. Con visión de salir adelante inicio vendiendo leche de casa en casa para mejorar su economía. Su hija le ayuda en la repartición de leche de lunes a domingo desde las 7 de la mañana. Su esposa trabaja en quehaceres domésticos y le ayuda solo los fines de semana. Su mayor preocupación es la delincuencia por que recorre los sectores. Con el préstamo va a comprar yogurt para aumentar su venta y poderles dar una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Franklin, 31, was born in Jipijapa where cattle raising predominates.  Several years ago he left the city of his birth and currently lives in Guayaquil with his wife and three children who are 4, 7 and 9 years old and attend public school.

Aiming at getting ahead he started selling milk door to door to improve his economy.  His daughter helps him deliver the milk from Monday to Sunday starting at 7am.  His wife works doing domestic chores so she only helps him on the weekend.  His greatest concern is the widespread delinquency in the neighborhoods.  He will use the loan to buy yoghurt to increase sales and be able to give his children a better education.

loans.use: to buy milk and yoghurt.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 25 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala east region of Uganda. For the past three years, she has worked hard to manage her salon, where she does hairdressing. 

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. She will use this loan to buy more supplies for her business and will help Aisha to generate greater profits and take care of herself. Aisha hopes that in the future, she will be able to start a training school. 

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Aisha who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for her business

loans.name: Dina Maria

texts.es: Dina Maria tiene 53 años de edad, su actividad es una pulpería ya tiene años de experiencia en el negocio, esta actividad la tiene ubicada en sus casa de habitación donde atiende a sus clientes con variedad de productos. Esta emprendedora toda la vida ha buscado en brindarle a su familia lo mejor, desde hace mas de 20 años que tiene este negocio y siempre ha soñado en tener variedad de productos para ofrecerle a sus clientes es por ello que está solicitando financiamiento para comprar productos como granos básicos, jabón, detergente, papel higiénico, aceite, entre otros productos que solicitan sus clientes.
texts.en: Dina María, 53, has a grocery store; she has years’ experience in this business.  The store is located in her house where she tends to customers with a variety of products.  This entrepreneur has sought her entire life for ways of providing the best for her family.  She’s had this business for more than 20 years and she’s always dreamed with having a wide variety of products to offer her customers which is why she’s asking for a loan to buy such things as basic grains, soap, detergent, toilet paper and oil, among other products her customers request.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Sergio Rene

texts.en:
Sergio Rene is 28 years old and uses his background in veterinary studies to run a guinea pig farm. He is currently raising 250 guinea pigs, but has a goal of increasing his farm to 2,000 animals. He feeds the animals every morning, and then drives to Cusco in order to focus on his second job driving a taxi. He offers transport services within the city of Cusco as well as between Cusco and his hometown of Anta, which is a rural community located about an hour away. During the daytime, Sergio Rene hires one employee who tends to the guinea pigs.

Sergio Rene is requesting a loan in order to make infrastructure investments, specifically to improve the cages where he keeps his guinea pigs. His dream is to have a large farm and build a house. Additionally, he would like to buy a truck so that he can transport food for his guinea pigs. His current taxi vehicle is too small to use for this purpose. 

Sergio Rene is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Las Mercedes de Kataniray" in Cusco, which is located close to the Incan ruins of Macchu Picchu in the Andean mountains. The bank is in its fourth cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to improve the cages where he keeps his guinea pigs

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 46 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is married and has six children with two of them currently in school. For the past five years, Harriet has been working hard to manage her retail shop where she sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase more stock in her business and will help Harriet to generate greater profits and pay half of the school fees for her children. Harriet hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her business. 

Harriet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Harriet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her business,

loans.name: Richard Ernesto

texts.en:
Richard is 24 years old and has worked as a taxi driver in Cusco for four years. He drives his own vehicle, which he tries to replace every two years. He is requesting a loan in order to invest in a new and better car. In the future, he dreams of buying a house and furthering his education by studying tourism. He would also like to buy a bigger car.

Richard is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Las Mercedes de Kataniray" in Cusco, which is located close to the Incan ruins of Macchu Picchu in the Andean mountains. The bank is in its fourth cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy a better taxi vehicle

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.en:
Cesar Augusto is a taxi driver in Cusco. He is requesting a loan in order to renovate his car, which is eight years old. For example, he needs to buy new tires for the car. Cesar Augusto is 22 years old and in the future would like to study English, which he thinks will be very useful because Cusco attracts many tourists. One day, he would like to open a travel agency.

Cesar Augusto is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Las Mercedes de Kataniray" in Cusco, which is located close to the Incan ruins of Macchu Picchu in the Andean mountains. The bank is in its fourth cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to renovate his car

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria De Los Ángeles es una emprendedora que se le brindo financiamiento para comprar productos para la pulpería y ofrecerle a sus clientes. Esta emprendedora ya ha trabajado con Fundación León 2000 en el crédito otorgado ha demostrado ser responsable pero sobre todo deseo de superación en el negocio y en lo personal. Actualmente esta solicitando financiamiento para la compra de productos como granos básicos, detergentes, golosinas, pan, sopas, huevos, tan, entre otros productos.
texts.en: María De Los Ángeles is an entrepreneur who got financing to buy merchandise for her grocery store to sell to her customers.  This entrepreneur has already worked with Fundación León 2000 and showed responsibility and above all a wish to improve both personally and in business with the loan granted.  She is currently asking for financing to buy products like basic grains, detergents, snacks, bread, soup, eggs and Tang, among others.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Carla Lorena

texts.es: La Sra. Carla tiene 21 años no esta casada pero convive con su pareja, no tiene hijos todavía pero en un futuro piensa tener mas hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de chocolate, vive en la zona del Gallito,  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Carla va a usar este préstamo para la compra de un lote de terreno,  la Sra. Carla enfrenta retos en su negocio que son falta de publicidad de sus productos ya que son chocolates elaborados artesanalmente, y va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de distintos utensilios para la elaboración de chocolates y así generar mayores ingresos, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Carla is 21 years old. She is not married but lives with her significant other. She does not have children yet but wants to have some in the future. She makes her living making and selling chocolates and lives in the region of Gallita.

This is her second loan with the institution. Carla will use the loan to purchase a parcel of land. She faces challenges in her business such as the lack of publicity of her products since they are handmade chocolates. She will use the benefits to purchase different utensils for making the chocolates in order to generate more income. Carla is happy an grateful to the the institution for the support of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a parcel of land.

loans.name: Juan Hernan

texts.en:
Juan Hernan drives a taxi in Cusco on weekdays and on weekends he goes to the countryside to work on a farm raising potatoes and corn. He has done this work for the past 10 years. At this time, he is requesting a loan in order to make payments on his car and to buy treatments for crop diseases. In the future, Juan Hernan dreams of running a small taxi business, in which he will employ others to drive vehicles.

Juan Hernan is 29 years old and lives with his partner. He serves as the fiscal officer for his village bank, through which he is receiving this individual loan. Members of the village bank "Las Mercedes de Kataniray" meet monthly in Cusco, which is located close to the Incan ruins of Macchu Picchu in the Andean mountains. The bank is in its fourth cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy treatments for crop diseases and make payments on his car

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
Willy is 25 years old and recently started a business raising guinea pigs in his house in the countryside. He currently has 200 guinea pigs and is requesting a loan that will help him buy 100 more guinea pigs. 

Willy was elected by other members of his village bank to serve as the group secretary. His role is to maintain records of all of the group’s meetings and transactions. Willy dreams of buying a house in Cusco in the future.

Willy is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Las Mercedes de Kataniray" in Cusco, which is located close to the Incan ruins of Macchu Picchu in the Andean mountains. The bank is in its fourth cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs

loans.name: Maria Narcisa

texts.es: María  de 56 años vive (duran  Guayaquil). El decidió entrar a este negocio porque es una buena manera de tener dinero para poder darles lo necesario a sus hijos. Este negocio  que es el de vender ropa  a parte se dedica a vender cosméticos  le gusta y le va bien gracias a Dios. Trabaja todos los días con  solo tiene hijos mayores . La dificultad que tiene es la delincuencia. A futuro anhela tener su negocio grande para los cosméticos y tener su vivienda en buen estado. Con el préstamo comprara (ropa, cosméticos   )
texts.en:
María is 56 and lives in Duran. She decided to pursue this line of work because it is a good way to have money to buy the things her children need. Her business is selling clothing and cosmetics. She enjoys it, and, thankfully, it is doing well.  Since her children are grown, she works every day. Crime, however, is a problem for her. 

Her desire is to have a large cosmetics business and to keep her home in good condition. She will buy clothing and cosmetics with this loan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Jessica Fernanda

texts.es:
La Señora Jessica es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Luchadoras, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca capital de la provincia del Azuay, es reconocida como la "Atenas del Ecuador" y la ciudad cultural del país. Su centro histórico es el más grande y el mejor conservado del país,  podemos encontrar muchas artesanías como: tejidos, bordados, cerámica, orfebrería, platería y sombreros de paja toquilla.

La Señora. Jessica tiene 21 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido un hijo de nueve meses de edad. Su esposo labora prestando sus servicios como guardia de seguridad, la casa en la que habitan es arrendada.

La Señora. Jessica es una profesional en la costura ya que ha estudiado y hace un año se encuentra ejerciendo su profesión, labora de lunes a viernes todo el día, hace 6 meses también tiene su negocio propio, instaló una tienda en la que trabajan de domingo a domingo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 11 de la noche, en el tiempo que se encuentra trabajando su madre es quien atiende la tienda.

Este es el primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su suegra. Su crédito lo va a invertir comprando productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda.

Su meta es comprarse un vehículo.
texts.en:
Jessica is a member of the “Mujeres Luchadoras” (Tenacious Women) communal bank. She lives in the city of Cuenca, capital of Azuay Province and known at the “Athens of Ecuador” and the country’s cultural city.  Its historic city center is the largest and best preserved in the country.  We can find many crafts like weaving, embroidery, ceramics, pottery, silver and straw hats.

Jessica, 21, is married and has a nine month old son.  Her husband works as a security guard.  The house they live in is rented.  Jessica is a sewing professional since she’s studied it and has been working in her profession for a year.  She works all day from Monday to Friday.  

Six months ago she also opened her own business.  She opened a store that they work from Sunday to Sunday from 6am until 11pm.  In the time it’s been in operation, it’s been her mother who’s been tending to the store.

This is the first loan she’s taken in the communal bank that her mother-in-law invited her to join.  She will use the loan to buy basic staple items to stock her store.  Her goal is to buy a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy basic staple items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more palm oil in a very large quantity

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en: This is 36 year old Abibatu.  She is married, and has 2 children aged 10 and 4 years.  In 2005, Abibatu established her Clothing, Ladies Shoe and Cosmetics business. She began her business because she wanted to be self employed so as to get reliable source income to provide livelihood for her family . Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Abibatu requires a loan in order to buy more clothing and cosmetics to meet the needs of her customers . In the future, Abibatu plans  to expand her business and build her own house.   She is thanking you for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: This is 26 year old Sarah.  She is married, and has 2 children aged 6 and 2 years. She has 3 additional dependents, who live with her because of schooling.  In 2008, Sarah established her clothing business. She began her business because she wants to be self employed. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,300,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Sarah requires a loan in order to buy more clothing. In the future, Sarah plans to establish other shops in different areas.   She is thanking you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for her business.

loans.name: Yesica

texts.en:
Yesica is 30 years old and works at a bar in a restaurant. She has held this job for about eight years. She lives with her partner who drives a taxi in Cusco on weekdays and works on a farm on weekends. Yesica is requesting a loan in order to help her partner make payments on his car and buy treatments for crop diseases. In the future, Yesica and her partner dream of running a small taxi business, in which they will employ others to drive vehicles.

Yesica was elected as the treasurer for her village bank, through which she is receiving this individual loan. This means that she is responsible for dispensing and tracking payments to other group members. Members of the village bank "Las Mercedes de Kataniray" meet monthly Cusco, which is located close to the Incan ruins of Macchu Picchu in the Andean mountains. The bank is in its fourth cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to make car payments and buy treatments for crop diseases

loans.name: Marcial

texts.en:
Marcial is 51 years old and married with two children. He drives a taxi, transporting passengers in and around Cusco. He has been working as a taxi driver since he was about 25 years old. He is requesting a loan in order to buy replacement parts to fix his car. For example, he needs to pay for new tires and an oil change. His dream is to eventually buy a new car and to open another business with his wife, perhaps selling beer.

Marcial serves as the president of his village bank, through which he is receiving this individual loan. Members of the village bank "Las Mercedes de Kataniray" meet monthly in Cusco, which is located close to the Incan ruins of Macchu Picchu in the Andean mountains. The bank is in its fourth cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for his car

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 53 years old. He lives in a small village of Lanchkhuti District with his family: wife – Gulsunda, 28 years old son, daughter in law, 3 years old granddaughter and father (retired). George’s son and daughter in law are employees of a local private company. George leads the agricultural business of the family, which is the main source of the income for them. He grows maize on family owned 0.6 hectare land and tangerine of 0.1 hectare. George sells harvested products locally to greengrocery products retailers. Along with the abovementioned George runs a small bee-keeping business. He has 3 bee-hives with bees. George harvest honey twice a year. He sells on average 50 liters of honey per month. Total average monthly income of the family is 650 Laris, including pension of George’s father. 

George requested credit for purchasing wooden materials for construction of additional 6 bee-hives. He will put bee-families in new bee-hives. He will harvest and sell 120% more honey per year. It will increase the income of the family and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase wooden materials for production of new bee-hives

loans.name: Elguja

texts.en:
Elguja is 48 years old. He lives in a village of Lanchkhuti District with his wife – Irma. Elguja is a joiner. He has a small workshop at home. He mainly produces furniture and sells them in nearby town. Also he produces various wooden goods, which can be used in household. Along with the abovementioned, the family runs family agricultural business, led by Irma. They have a maize cornfield on 0.6 hectare. Also the family has a Kivi garden; they sell on average 1 tone of maize and 400 kg of Kivi per year. Total average monthly income of the family is 500 Laris. 

Elguja requested credit for purchasing wooden materials for his workshop. He will be able to increase production. Also part of the credit he will use for purchasing fertilizers for the cornfield. As a result of the abovementioned investment the income of the family will increase. They will be able to purchase additional household goods for improvement of their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase wooden materials for joiner's workshop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve on her business capital

loans.name: Ana Leonarda

texts.es: Ana  de 37 años vive (Quevedo  Guayaquil ). Ella   decidió entrar a este negocio porque quería ayudar en la situación económica de su familia  ya que su esposo no esta con ella por motivo de trabajo . haci que decidió poner la tienda en su domicilio y le va bien. Trabaja todos los días solo. Tiene 3 hijos menor. La dificultad que tiene es  la delincuencia. A  futuro el anhela mejorar su negocio y tener un  local. Con el préstamo comprara (bebidas, enlatados, arroz)
texts.en:
Ana is 37 and lives in Quevedo (Guayaquil). She decided to pursue this business to help her family's financial situation. Her husband's job keeps him away from home. She chose to set up the store in her house, and the business is doing fine.  She works every day by herself and has 3 young children. Crime is a problem for her. 

She aspires to grow her business and have a separate space for it. She will buy beverages, canned goods, and rice with this loan.

loans.use: to buy beverages, canned goods, and rice.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a twenty seven year old hardworking man living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in tailoring business for nine years. His hardship is customers not paying on time, personal goal is marrying and business goal is to become one of the renown expert tailors in town. Julius wants the money to buy suit materials for sewing.

loans.use: to buy suit materials for sewing.

loans.name: Ezra

texts.en: Ezra is a twenty two year old hardworking man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in tailoring business for four years in which he started with 70,000 shillings and now has one million shillings as his working capital. His hardships are customers not paying on time and seasonal weather. Personal goal is building a permanent home. His business goals are buying land to grow crops, expanding business into new markets and moving business to more permanent location. Ezra wants the money to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy plot of land

loans.name: Kahangi United Group

texts.en: Asia is 40 years old and the father of five children who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. His personal goals are to educate his children and build a permanent home. For the last five years, he has earned a living by running a retail shop. He started as a market vendor but now has his own shop. His major challenges are price fluctuations, customers not paying on time and high fuel and transportation costs. However he has a goal of diversifying his business to include farming and wants to buy land on which to grow crops. Asia is requesting this loan to buy sugar, soap and beans to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and beans to sell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a thirty one year old married man living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in tailoring business for five years. His hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, customers not paying on time and seasonal weather. His personal goals are building a permanent house, buying a car and saving for a wedding. His business goals are expanding business to new markets and moving it to more permanent  location. Francis wants the money to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en: Micheal is a twenty seven year old married man living in Fort Portal Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children. He has been operating a retail shop for now three years and his hardship is price fluctuation and inflation, however, he has a goal of diversifying his business to include farming. Micheal needs a loan to buy stock like soap and sugar for resale.

loans.use: to buy stock  like soap and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Bashir

texts.en: Bashir is a twenty eight year old married man with three children living in Fort Portal Uganda. His personal goals are to educate his children and build a permanent house. He has been a farmer for the last three years after starting from a family land and thereafter bought his own. His major hardship is the unpredictable seasonal weather changes and he has a goal of diversifying his farm to include transport, buying land to grow crops and hiring employees to help expand his farm. Bashir needs a loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a forty nine year old married man living in Fort Portal Uganda.His personal goal is to educate his children. He has been a farmer for a long time after starting on family land and thereafter bought his own. His main hardships are pests and diseases that affect the cattle, however, he has a goal of expanding his farm to a ranch. Emmanuel wants a loan to buy cows for rearing.

loans.use: to buy cows for rearing.

loans.name: Dimitri

texts.en:
Dimitri is 56 years old. He lives in a small village of Lanchkhuti District with his family: wife – Semie, 30 years old son, daughter in law and three granddaughters (11, 10 and 8 years old). All three of them go to school. Semie leads the agricultural business of the family. They have a small dairy farm with 3 milk cows. Semie produces cheese and sells on average 60 kg of this product on local open market. Also the family grows potato and maize on family owned 0.5 hectare land. They sell harvested products on local open market as well. Dimitri has a small grocery store in the village. He purchases grocery products in nearby towns for wholesale prices and sells them in his store. His monthly profit reaches on average 500 Laris. 

Dimitri requested credit for purchasing additional grocery products, for diversifying the assortment in the store and increasing the turnover. It will increase his profit and total monthly income of the family will grow. Dimitri will be able to create better living conditions for his grandchildren and other family members.

loans.use: to increase stock in trade in the grocery store

loans.name: Kamulikwizi  Women Group

texts.en: Robert is 42 years old, married and lives with his wife and two children in Kasese, Uganda. He has made a living selling electronic appliances for ten years, beginning with 800,000 shillings which has now increased to 2,500,000 shillings in working capital. His main problems are price fluctuations, customers not paying on time and taxes. His personal goals are educating children, building a permanent house and buying a car. His business goals are hiring employees to help expand business and moving to a more permanent location. Robert is applying for this loan to buy phones to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy phones to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: This is 40-year-old Fatmata.  She is married and has two children who are 14 and 16 years old.. In 2009, Fatmata established her hairdressing salon and hair products. She began her business because after she graduated as a hairdresser, she decided to start a business. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 900,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 3,000,000. Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy hair cream and artificial hair. In the future, Fatmata plans to open another hairdressing salon in another place. She is thanking you for your support.

loans.use: To buy hair product for her business

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is 30 years old, married and lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. His personal goals are educating his children and building a permanent house. For the last seven years, he has earned a living by selling pork. He opened this business with some savings he earned while farming. His major hardship is inadequate capital to purchase pigs, since the demand is very high. His dream is to open his own pig-raising business. Charles intends to use this loan to buy pigs to sell.

loans.use: to buy pigs for his business.

loans.name: Kasika Business Group

texts.en: John is a twenty eight year old married man with two children living in Kasese,Uganda. He has been in shop business for three years. His hardship is inadequate capital to purchase stock, personal goal is to educate children and business goal is to expand business to new markets. John wants the money to buy soap and sugar for sell.

loans.use: to buy soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a forty three year old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been teaching for twelve years. His personal goal is educating children, business goal is to start up a business. Joseph wants money to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en: Phoebe is a thirty four year old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling clothes for five years in which she started with 200,000 shillings and now has 500,000 shillings. Her hardships are price fluctuation, high fuel and transportation costs. Her personal goals are educating children, building a permanent home and buying a car. Her business goals are diversifying businesses, buying land to grow crops and moving businesses to more permanent location. Phoebe wants money to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a forty year old married woman with seven children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in hotel business and clothes business for eight years in which she started with 300,000 shillings and now has 2,600,000 shillings. Her hardship is inadequate capital to purchase stock, her personal goal is educating children and business goal is expanding business into new markets. Janet wants money to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a twenty five year old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in pub business for two years in which he started with 500,000 shillings and now has 1,000,000 shillings. His hardships are price fluctuation, customers not paying on time and inadequate capital to purchase stock. His personal goals are educating children, building a permanent house and buying a car. His business goals are diversifying business and expanding business into new markets. Joseph wants money to buy beers for sell.

loans.use: to buy beers to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a twenty eight year old woman with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in fresh foods for three years in which she started with 300,000 shillings and now has 1,000,000 shillings. Her hardship is price fluctuation and inflation. Her personal goal is educating the child. Her business goal is to expand businesses into new markets. Florence wants money to buy beans for planting.

loans.use: to buy beans for planting.

loans.name: Djiguène Bakhna 6 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Djiguène Bakhna  6  a été formé par 5 femmes membres d’un même réseau : Association pour le développement des femmes de cette localité qui se trouve à environ 60 km de la ville principale. Ces dames font de la vente de fruits.
La présidente, Madame Mame Bousso, s’active dans le commerce depuis 15 ans. Avec ce crédit qu’elle sollicite, elle va acheter 2 cartons de mandarine clémentine ,80 kg d’orange et 50kg de mandarine simple. Il faut noter que Mame Bousso participe aux charges quotidiennes de sa famille.
Elle aimerait augmenter son pouvoir d’achat si son fond de roulement peut augmenter et cela avec l’appui de l’IMCEC.
texts.en:
The  “Djiguène Bakhna 6”    group is composed of six women who belong to the same network of the Women Development Association in their village, some 60 km from the capital. These women work as fruit vendors.

The group’s leader, Mrs. Mame Bousso, has been in commerce for 15 years. With the credit requested, she is going to buy two boxes of clementine tangerines, 80 kg [176 lbs] of oranges and 50 kg [110 lbs] of ordinary tangerines. It should be noted that Mame Bousso contributes to the everyday expenses of her family. She would to increase her purchasing power with the increase of her work capital, thanks to the support of IMCEC

loans.use: to buy fruits (tangerines, oranges, and clementines) for resale.

loans.name: Apophia

texts.en:
Apophia is 26 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi, in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past year, Apophia has been working hard to manage her agro shop, which sells agro chemicals. 

To help expand her business, Apophia has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more chemicals for resale, and will help Apophia to generate greater profits and increase more on her business. Apophia hopes that in the future she will be able to open another shop of the same business. 

Apophia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Apophia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more chemicals for resale.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John, a 47-year-old married father of seven children, lives in Bundibugyo-Uganda where he grows cocoa to sell. Though he faces hardships in price fluctuations for his produce, his business goal is to become one of the largest cocoa growers in the area. His personal goal is educating his children. John is requesting this loan to plant more cocoa.

loans.use: to plant more cocoa.

loans.name: Alegria Group

texts.es: La señora Santa Catarina es casada, tiene 29 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 4 hijos 2 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a los oficios domésticos como también al comercio ya que tiene una tienda de venta de artículos de consumo diario, inicio este negocio gracias al apoyo de su esposo y lleva 7 años de experiencia, su esposo se dedica a la confección de tejidos. En el futuro espera ver su negocio más amplio y con mejores ganancias, por la misma razón decide organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para ampliar su capital de trabajo y compras más producto para la tienda que tiene, va a comprar: aguas gaseosas, golosinas, especias, alimentos en lata, azúcar, etc. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican: a la atención a tienda, a la confección de ropa, a la tejeduría de sabanas, servilletas y cortes, confección de faldas y blusas, y a la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
Santa Catarina is 29 and married. Though she did not have the opportunity to go to school, her 4 children are students. She sells cosmetics and also has a store where she sells consumer staples. She started the business with her husband's help, and she now has 7 years of experience. Her husband is a weaver.

She hopes her business will grow and generate more profit. This is the reason she decided to organize a group to request a loan that will increase her working capital and allow her to purchase more goods for her store. She is going to purchase water, sodas, sweets, spices, canned goods, sugar, etc. The other group members work in the store; tailor clothing; weave sheets and napkins; make skirts and blouses; and raise livestock.

loans.use: to buy products for her store.

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida is 40 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi, in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is married and has five children, three of whom are currently in school.

For the past 6 years, Hamida has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. To help expand her business, Hamida has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities, and will help Hamida to generate greater profits and take care of herself. Hamida hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house for herself. 

Hamida is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hamida who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities.

loans.name: Tinah

texts.en:
Tinah is 29 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi, in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is marrried and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past 2 years, Tinah has been working hard to manage her agro shop, which sells agro chemicals. 

To help expand her business, Tinah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more agro chemicals for resale, and will help Tinah to generate greater profits and take care of herself. Tinah hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a motorcycle. 

Tinah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Tinah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more agro chemicals for resale.

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en:
Mareta runs pig breeding and gardening ventures in Getahovit village, Tavush region. Mareta breeds sows and piglets and grows apples, pears and plums. She sells pork to her neighbours. She sells fruit at her husband’s stall in the food market, as her husband is engaged in selling fruit and vegetables. Also Marieta has some chickens and turkeys, but  she uses  the eggs, chicken and turkey meat produced for her big family’s needs.

Mareta is 39 years old and she has 4 children: 3 daughters and a son. Her eldest daughter is a student, and the other children are pupils. 

Thanks to her occupation Mareta has covered part of her family’s needs; also she was able to buy necessary furniture for her house. 

Mareta says that pig breeding is a rather profitable business so she intends to develop it. Therefore she is asking for a 1,000,000 Armenian dram loan to buy some more sows and piglets. This will allow Mareta to increase her family’s income in future.

loans.use: to buy some more sows and piglets

loans.name: Luz Y Vida Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria Antonia es casada tiene 42 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educación primaria, tiene 2 hijos los cuales estudian, se dedica a la elaboración de bordado de blusas, inicio este trabajo siendo operaria y hasta el momento lleva 17 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos de diferente colores y mejorar su producción de bordado de blusas, espera en el futuro dejar este trabajo a sus hijos. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedica a la artesanías producción de tejido y bordado y a la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
Maria Antonia is married and is 42 years old. She completed three years of primary education. She has two children who are both studying. She makes a living embroidering blouses. She started as a worker and now has 17 years of experience. 

She is organizing this group to request a loan that she will use to purchase different colored thread and to improve her production in embroidering blouses. In the future she hopes to leave this work to her children. 

The other members of the group make their livings in artisan crafts, weaving and embroidery, as well as raising animals.

loans.use: to buy different colored thread and improve her production in embroidering blouses.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
41-year-old Ruzanna is engaged in cattle breeding and gardening. For more than 20 years she and her family have bred cows and calves and grown fruit and vegetables. From obtained milk, Ruzanna produces butter, cheese and sour cream which she sells at the market. Also Ruzanna and her family sell meat, fruit and vegetables and thus support themselves. 

Ruzanna is married and she has 3 children: 2 daughters and a son. Her husband and her son  go to Russia once a year for several months for seasonal work. Her elder daughter helps Ruzanna in the agricultural business; Ruzanna’s younger daughter attends school. 

Ruzanna needs a $2,000 loan to buy some dairy calves which will allow her to produce more dairy products in future to resell. This is Ruzanna’s third loan from Nor Horizon and she always makes her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy some dairy calves which will allow her to produce more dairy products in future to resell

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es de la ciudad  de Encarnación, surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la fundación, se trata de un grupo antiguo que trabaja con la fundación desde el año 2008. Actualmente se encuentran en el ciclo numero 15 y desean poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa.
Ls Sra. Juliana es la presidenta del grupo y ella nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, tiene un pequeño puesto en su casa, el cual es muy concurrido por todos sus amigos y vecinos. Su sueño es poder ampliar su pequeño negocio y de esa forma tener un mayor ingreso para su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de frutas y verduras, con lo cual podrá surtir su negocio y ofrecer la misma variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group is in the city of Encarnación, and came about because one of the members contracted the Foundation. This is a long-standing group which has been working with the Foundation since 2008. Currently they are in their 15th loan cycle and want to be able to get to the program's maximum level.

Juliana is chairperson of the group, and tells us that she sells fruits and vegetables. She has a small stand in her home, that is very popular with all her friends and neighbors.

Her dream is to be able to expand her small business, and this way have greater income for her family. She is applying for the loan in order to buy fruits and vegetables, which will enable her to stock her business, and offer variety to her customers.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Intiqam

texts.en:
Intiqam is a 41-year-old man, and he is married with three children. He is a market vendor and sells different kind of goods such as flour, beverages, macaroni, butter, ketchup, and candies. He has 8 years of experience and has deep knowledge of the market and demands of his clients. 

The food products he sells are very popular among people and in high demand, especially goods like butter, candies, and beverages. His monthly profit from selling foods is 250 Azerbaijan New Manats (AZN). His mother helps to purchase products and brings them to the shop. This business is the sole financial income for his family. Intiqam is a very successful entrepreneur because of his good location, in the central bazaar of his home town.

Intiqam applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN to purchase more food products and diversify his range of goods to cover customers` demands.

loans.use: to buy more food products and diversify his range of goods.

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik has been engaged in beekeeping and gardening for 16 years.  Andranik sells the honey he produces from his home. He uses the fruit from his garden for his family. Also Andranik grows ornamental trees, especially firs. Andranik says that the main customers for ornamental trees are from Yerevan, as they always order many trees from Andranik. 

Andranik is 44 years old; he is married and lives with his wife and 3 school-aged children in Ijevan. Andranik’s wife helps him in beekeeping and with joint effort they produce high quality honey which is always in popular demand. Simultaneously with beekeeping and gardening Andranik works as a boxing teacher at a sports school. Thanks to his occupation Andranik is able to support his big family.

Andranik is seeking a 600,000 Armenian dram loan to buy some more bee families, which will allow him to produce more honey in future and thus to increase his family's income.

loans.use: to buy some more bee families, which will allow him to produce more honey in future

loans.name: Aku

texts.fr: Coiffeuse de profession et âgée de 36ans, Aku est mère de 04enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Le premier a 13ans et le dernier 05ans. Son conjoint est couturier de profession. Pour bien répondre aux besoins de ses nombreux clients, Aku ajoute à son activité la vente des produits cosmétiques (mèches, tissages, maquillage). Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et exerce son activité dans un atelier.  Elle a une difficulté financière et sollicite ce second prêt pour acheter des produits cosmétiques. Elle veut réinvestir le profit dans son activité et assurer sa pérennité. Aku voudrait voir ses enfants évoluer. Elle a démarré en 2002 son activité.
texts.en:
Aku, age 36, is a hairdresser. She has four children aged 5 to 13 who all go to school. Her spouse is a tailor. To meet the needs of a large customer base, Aku also sells cosmetic products (hair extensions, weaves, makeup). She buys her stock in Lomé and works out of her shop. She started her activity in 2002.

She is facing financial difficulties, which has prompted her to seek a second loan to stock up on cosmetic products. She wants to reinvest her profits in her activity and ensure its sustainability. Aku wishes to see her children prosper.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Lusya

texts.en:
Lusya sells clothes, food and household goods at her own small stall in Ijevan city. She has been running her business for more than 15 years. Lusya buys women’s, men’s and children’s clothes from Yerevan and also from one of the neighboring countries. Food and household goods are bought from suppliers. Lusya says that towels, children’s sets and confectionery are always in demand without reference to the season so she puts an emphasis on this merchandise. 

Lusya is 62 years old. She is widow and she lives with her son’s family in Ijevan. Lusya has 3 grandchildren. 

Thanks to her business Lusya solves most of her family’s needs, as her daughter-in-law stays at home and takes care of her children. Lusya’s son is an employee in one of Ijevan’s companies.

Lusya needs a 550,000 AMD loan to develop her shop assortment. She will especially buy spring season clothes and a lot of candy and confectionery to resell.

loans.use: to buy spring season clothes and a lot of candy and confectionery to resell

loans.name: Vahe

texts.en:
Vahe has been making furniture for the last 10 years. He makes cupboards, bookcases, chairs, tables, sofas, armchairs, etc. in his own garage, which he remodeled as a workshop. Vahe repairs old furniture as well. He fulfills private orders and also sells his production in Ijevan's shops. Vahe always has many customers as he does his work very well and his furniture is very durable. 

Vahe brings raw materials and necessary items for his business from Yerevan. He needs a 700,000 Armenian dram loan to buy a car, which he will use for  bringing materials from Yerevan and also to transport his products to his clients. 

Vahe is 27 years old and he lives in Ijevan. Vahe's family consists of his parents, two brothers and his brother's family. Thanks to his business Vahe covers the major part of his big family's needs, as his parents, as one of his brothers and sister-in-law don't have a job. 

This is Vahe's second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: To buy a car for his furniture production business

loans.name: Clara Luz

texts.es: Clara está tiene 37 años está casada con Ronald. Tienen 3 hijos de que asisten a la escuela fiscal. Desde que nació ha vivido en La Libertad. Su esposo trabaja desde hace 7 años en Pacipetrol. Empezó aperturando una pequeña tienda en su sector y hoy en día está muy surtida. Se decidió a abrir la tienda porque en la parte de atrás de su casa hay una escuelita es por ese motivo que tiene mucha acogida. Ahora la tienda la maneja con sus hijas de lunes a domingo, su esposo también colabora en sus días libres. Como es muy conocida no ha tenido problemas con robos y se siente segura en su barrio. Su inconveniente principal es la temporada invernal por la lluvia. Solicita el crédito para comprar bebidas, snack, dulces, helados etc. productos que tiene mucha demanda por los estudiantes. Su meta es incrementar su negocio y poder tener más estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Clara is 37 years old and is married to Ronald. She has three children who go to public school. She has lived in La Libertad since she was born. Her husband has worked at Pacipetrol for seven years. 

She started a small store in her neighborhood and now it sh very well stocked. She decided to open the store because at the back of her house there is a little school. This is why she is so well received. Now she runs the store with her daughters Monday through Friday and her husband helps out on his days off. As she is very well known, she has not had any problems with robberies and she feels safe in her neighborhood. Her biggest issue is the winter season due to the rain. 

She is requesting a loan to buy drinks, snacks, sweets, ice cream, etc. These products are in high demand from the students. Her goal is to expand her business and have more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy drinks, snacks, sweets and ice cream.

loans.name: Emerenciana

texts.es: Emerenciana es socia del Bancomunal Bienestar II, tiene 50 años de edad, es dueña de una empresa de transportes, es madre  de 3 hijos, es socia de Finca Perú hace más de 16 años, inició vendiendo golosinas, ceviche y chicha,gracias a las capacitaciones de su Bancomunal ella aprendió la responsabilidad y como progresar en su negocio,y también en su hogar,ella dice que Finca Perú le brinda las oportunidades que otras entidades no , el préstamo que esta solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de llantas y repuestos para sus vehículos.
texts.en:
Emerenciana is a member of the Bancomunal Bienestar II communal bank. She is 50, and owns a transportation company. She is the mother of three children, and has been a member of Finca Perú for more than 16 years. She started out selling candy, ceviche and chicha (traditional Peruvian drink made from corn). 

Thanks to the training in Bancomunal, she learned how to be responsible, and how to move forward in her business and also in her home life. She says that Finca Perú offers her the opportunities that other institutions did not.  

She will invest the loan she is applying for, in tires and spare parts for her vehicles.

loans.use: To buy tires and spare part for her transportation company.

loans.name: Arus

texts.en:
59-year-old Arus is engaged in running a business in Achajur village, Tavush region. She rents a shop where she sells clothes, food, household goods and tableware as well. Her husband helps Arus in the business.  Arus brings merchandise from Yerevan and also buys from suppliers in her village. Arus says that food and clothes-selling brings in good profit so she always tries to diversify her shop's assortment. She has been running her business for almost 20 years.

Arus has a big family and her business allows her to support her family. Arus's family consists of her husband, her son, daughter-in-law and 3 grandchildren. Arus's son fulfills private orders for construction, and her husband works as a watchman. 

Arus is asking for an 800,000 Armenian dram loan to buy spring season clothes, and a lot of foods and household goods to resell.   This is Arus's second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: to buy spring season clothes and a lot of foods and household goods to resell

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina breeds cows, pigs and chickens in Sevan. From produced milk Alina makes cheese, curd and sour cream which she sells to a neighbor restaurant. Beef, pork and chicken meat she sells to a butcher’s shop. 

Agricultural business is the only source of income for Alina’s family, as her mother is retiree, and Alina’s daughter is a pupil. Alina’s mother tries to help her in her occupation as far as possible.  Alina is 43 years old and she is divorced. For many years she has worked as a waitress in a restaurant. 

This is Alina’s second loan from Nor Horizon and now she needs $2,000 loan to repair her tumbled down barn.

loans.use: to repair her tumbled down barn

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en:
Elshad is a 40-year-old man, married with three children. He is an Internally Displaced Person and lives with his family in Bilasuavr IDP Settlement. Elshad repairs vehicles such as dump trucks, tractors and other farm vehicles. He has 10 years of experience in this field.  He is considered a specialist in this area and has a lot of orders.

His monthly income from the service he provides is 200 AZN.  Now more and more farmers are buying modern tractors and other vehicles useful in farming places, and Elshad needs to satisfy his customers and be able to repair modern cars, to change oil in them from time to time. He will buy modern tools and will take training in a nearby city to achieve his goals. 

He applied for 1000 AZN loan and promises to pay back on time.

loans.use: to buy modern tools and take professional development  training

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy egg plant seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Con Dios Adelantre 1, 2 & 6 Group

texts.en:
Xiomara is the coordinator of Con Dios Adelante  (Forward with God) 1, 2 & 6. This group is made up of fifteen micro-entrepreneur women and it is located in the city of La Romana, a rural area of the country dedicated to the harvest of sugar cane, in a batey founded for sugar cane workers, especially for Haitians.

Xiomara lives with her long-term partner and her three children. She says that her most important challenges are to continue improving her business and to provide change for her family. After the loans, her business is expanding her business and getting more clients. She enjoys working and cooking for her family.

She is running a miscellaneous sales business where she sells cosmetics, shoes, clothes, and other items. She will use her loan to purchase many items to increase her businessinventory. She is excited to receive her 6th loan with Esperanza. She has been part of this group for almost 4 years and with each loan she has been able to improve her business. With her business profits, she has been able to save and reinvest in her business when she needs to buy bigger orders. Xiomara thanks all of you for your support of her business and her group.

loans.use: to buy different miscellaneous products

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married mother of three children of primary school going age. She lives with her family in her rural home in Western Kenya. She has been in farming for four years and operates a hotel in the local market to supplement her farming income. She sells her farm produce which are majorly onions and milk to the local market.

Christine has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She believes her hotel business will benefit much with increase in milk production and generate better income to meet other family needs. Her focus is to own rental houses and venture into transport business and scale up her dairy business.

She says challenge posed by animal diseases is the most significant in farming.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Bakir

texts.en:
Bakir is 30 years old and a married man. He is an Internally Displaced Person and lives with his family in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.   He breeds sheep for meat and wool purposes for local butchers. Bakir has more than 5 years of experience in this field, thank to his father who taught him how best to look after sheep. He receives 120 AZN financial support from government monthly, but this is too low to cover family needs.

Bakir usually buys lambs, raises and fattens them for 4-5 months and resells them for a more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar.  His monthly income is 230 AZN.  People use meat in everyday national dishes as "pilau" and "dolma" and always use yoghurt sauce. Mutton is considered as very healthy and is also present in everyday life. Wool is very useful for blankets and mattresses made by local woman. 
   
This is only one financial income in his family.  Bakir applied for 1500 AZN to purchase 15 sheep and fodder.

loans.use: to buy 15 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Qahraman

texts.en:
Qahraman is a 30-year-old man, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) who lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and two children. He is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruit and vegetables for the last 5 years. During these years Qahraman gained enough skills and experience  to run the business. He chose this crop business because it  is profitable and fresh fruit and vegetables are in high demand. 

People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy; many national dishes made of vegetables, like "pilau" and "dolma". Fresh fruits are served on every table in Azerbaijan and also used to make fresh punch.  Qahraman raises pears, apples, peaches, plums, pomegranates, cucumbers, tomatoes, carrot and potatoes.   He usually sells his crop in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 240 AZN.

As these products are in high demand, Qahraman wants to expand his business and produce more fruit and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose he applied for 1500 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to invest in new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Chistine

texts.en:
Christine is a resident of Kitale in Western Kenya where she lives with her  husband and three children aged between eight and two  years. She has been in farming for five years  with her farm currently producing mainly  milk and eggs for the local market.She  is a tailor as well which provides additional income.

Christine has requested a loan of  82,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her buy and insure a dairy cow at 52,000 KES  and  build a zero grazing unit for her animals. She says  both will help  improve her milk  and  enable her  provide milk for family consumption as well as provide income to meet other family needs.

She laments of food shortage for animals which usually become very expensive during dry seasons. She appreciates Juhudi Kilimo loans services and reiterates she will pay in time.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow and construct a zero grazing unit

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has been in active farming for four years in his rural home in Kitale area of Western Kenya where he also trades in livestock which currently  provides significantly for family needs. His farm produces milk, bananas and onions which he sells on the local market. He is married with three children aged between ten and six years.

Joseph has made a loan request amounting to 62,400 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says this will help ease the provision of family needs and improve his farming business. His focus is to increase his dairy cow herd and make it his core business.

Joseph laments poor infrastructure and animal diseases as the leading challenges in farming business since deliveries to markets are costly, especially for faraway markets which give better prices for farm produce.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is a 49 year old business man married with six children living in Bundibugyo-Uganda. 
He deals in cocoa selling and has been in the business for 20 years though price fluctuations has been a major hardship in his business. He hopes to educate his children and buy land to grow crops for sale. Boniface needs the loan facility to purchase cocoa for sale.

loans.use: to purchase cocoa for sale

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 8 children. 
Rebecca has a food shop or carenderia that sells viands (an item of food; especially a choice or tasty dish) like vegetables saute, afritada and caldereta. She had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.
Rebecca has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rebecca hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands

loans.name: Yahve Yire Group

texts.es: Miguel es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “Yahve Yire” la cual está conformada por 10 socios responsables y trabajadores. El tiene  23 años de edad, soltero y no tiene hijos. Actualmente vive con sus padres, la cual han sido su motivo para seguir adelante. Miguel cuenta con un estudio de grabaciones. Este negocio surgió con la idea de obtener ganancias y así seguir pagando sus estudios de ingeniería de sistemas. Su mayor deseo es  de terminar satisfactoriamente su carrera de ingeniería de sistemas, pues al culminar desea buscar trabajo en una empresa reconocida. Con el crédito que solicito va a implementar su estudio de grabaciones comprando instrumentos como tarjeta de sonido, amplificadores etc la  cual le permita trabajar mejor. La Alcancía Comunal “Yahve Yire” agradece el crédito brindado ya que hacen posible su progreso. Miguel está ubicado en la primera fila, él viste un polo rojo y pantalón color beige.
texts.en:
Miguel is a member of the Yahve Yire comunal bank, which is comprised of ten responsible and hard-working members.  He is 23 years old, single, and has no children.  He is currently living with his parents, which has been his motivation to get ahead.

Miguel has a recording studio.  This business emerged from the idea of getting income to continue paying for his systems engineering studies.  His greatest wish is to satisfactorily complete his systems engineering studies.  Upon completion he wishes to look for work in a well-known company.

He will use the requested loan to purchase instruments like a sound card and amplifiers, etc. to equip his recording studio.  The will allow him to work better.

The Yahve Yire communal bank is grateful for the loan they were granted because it makes their progress possible.  

Miguel is in the first row wearing a red shirt and beige pants.

loans.use: to buy musical instruments.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a farmer in Kitale area of Western Kenya where he has had twenty years in active farming and meets all family needs through farming income. His farm currently produces milk, millet, eggs, sorghum, beans and potatoes.

William has requested a third loan of 100,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to help him put up a dairy unit at a cost of 30,000 KES and also boost his poultry business by expanding the housing unit at 40,000 KES with the remaining 30,000 KES to go into purchasing chicks. William is planning on concentrating more on poultry and dairy farming in the coming years.

William says Juhudi Kilimo loans have empowered smallholder farmers with him being among the beneficiaries of the loans. He however notes poultry diseases are a challenge and farmers must learn management to avoid gross losses in their businesses.

loans.use: To construct a dairy unit and buy poultry

loans.name: Renson

texts.en:
Renson is a farmer in Western Kenya and a father of five children all of school-going ages. He has a farm which produces milk and vegetables for the local market. He also runs a cereals processing business in the local market where he sells his farm produce.

Renson has made a loan request of 82,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow at 52,000 KES as well as construct a zero grazing unit for his dairy cows at a cost of 30,000 KES.This is his second loan request after the first loan of 40,000 KES which was repaid in a timely manner. He believes his family will benefit greatly with improved farming and more specifically with good milk production both for family consumption and for resale.

Renson concurs that the major challenge in farming remains feed shortages and common diseases for animals. He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's loan services.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and construct a zero grazing unit

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is a father of six children with the first three being adults and the other three being of school-going ages. He has been in farming for eight years and currently sells his produce at the local market. He mainly produces milk, maize and other horticultural products.

He has requested a loan of 80,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to venture into the poultry business. He plans to construct a poultry housing unit at 50,000 KES and buy chicks for 30,000 KES. Besides farming he operates a motorcycle transport business which he adds will improve too, once the farming business picks up.

He says sourcing capital has been the main challenge in farming and Juhudi Kilimo loans will help small holder farmers significantly.

loans.use: To construct a poultry housing unit and buy poultry birds

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is aged 49 and has been in farming for twelve years in his rural home in Western Kenya. His farm produces milk and maize among other items which all go to the local market. Joseph deals in scrap metals besides farming.

Joseph has requested a loan of 71,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow at 41,600 KES and build a dairy unit at 30,000 KES. He says these will improve his dairy business income. He believes the income will permit a better living standard for his family and make them more secure financially.

He however laments fluctuations in market prices for farm produce, coupled with unreliable rains and rampant diseases. He reiterates that Juhudi Kilimo loans have helped bridge small holder farmers'  capital challenge.

loans.use: To construct a dairy unit and buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Maria Nicolasa

texts.es: Doña Maria Nicolasa, es una persona casada, tiene 44 años de edad, cuenta con 6 hijos 5 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la artesanía al tejido de cortes típicos, cuenta con 5 años de experiencia, inicio siendo trabajadora para otras personas y con el apoyo de su esposo, actualmente ampliar su producción, por lo que solicita un préstamo para compra de hilo que le servirá como materia prima para su trabajo, espera que con el préstamo pueda mejorar y crecer su negocio.
texts.en: Maria Nicolasa, 45, is married and has 6 children, 5 of whom are in school.  She has a business weaving traditional Guatemalan skirts.  She has 5 years of experience with this work, having started out working for other people.  With the support of her husband she is now expanding her production.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy thread that she will use as a raw material for her work.  She hopes that with this loan she can improve and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy thread to weave skirts

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is aged 63 and has practiced mixed farming for thirty-eight years in his rural home in Western Kenya, mainly producing milk and tea which are sold to Kenya Co-Operative Creameries and Kenya Tea Development Authority respectively. He also produces poultry which go to the local market.

Jonathan has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo  to improve his dairy farming business. He says he will buy a chuff cutter at 30,000 KES to ease the feeding of his animals as well as constructing a dairy unit at a cost of 30,000 KES. He says the income will majorly go into providing basic needs for his last four children who are still schooling.

He is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo's loans services which he adds have changed the lives of many farmers.

loans.use: To construct a dairy unit  and purchase a chuff cutter

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil is a 31-year-old man, IDP who lives in Bilasuvar, IDP Settlement with his wife and two children. He is farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 7 years. He chose this business because it is profitable and in fresh crops are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits serve every table in Azerbaijan family and are also used to make fresh punch.

Ramil sells his crops in the BIlasuvar central bazaar. His monthly income is 250 Azerbaijan New Manats (AZN). His wife actively helps him to raise crops.

Because his products are in high demand, Ramil wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose he applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds, and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ingrid Raquel

texts.es: Ingrid Raquel tiene 26 años de edad, es una emprendedora que su actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación donde atiende a sus clientes a quienes les ofrece sus producto. Esta emprendedora es una luchadora desde muy joven inicio a trabajar para apoyar a su familia en los gastos del hogar. Ingrid Raquel está solicitando financiamiento para comprar productos para la pulpería como granos básicos, aceite, detergente, pan, huevos entre otros productos.
texts.en: Ingrid Raquel, 26, is an enterprising woman who has a grocery store business.  Her store is located in her house, which is where she tends to the customers to whom she offers her products.  This entrepreneur is a fighter.  From the time she was very young she started to work to support her family with the household expenses.  Ingrid Raquel is requesting a loan to buy products for her grocery store such as: staple grains, cooking oil, detergent, bread, eggs and other products.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, cooking oil, detergent, bread, eggs and other products

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es:
Janeth, se dedica a la confección de ropa deportiva para ambos sexos; su capacidad de producción mínima es de 16 prendas deportivas por mes, las cuales son vendidas con seguridad a intermediarias que le compran inmediatamente pues los pedidos ya están hechos con anterioridad.  Esta es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener a su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar más tela para la confección de los deportivos, pues tiene un pedido mayor y así obtendrá mejores ingresos.
Janeth, es casada y tiene dos hijos con los cuales vive en la casa de sus suegros en la zona Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la séptima vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la cuarta vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Janeth manufactures sportswear for both sexes.  Her minimum production capacity is 16 sportswear items per month that are guaranteed to sell to intermediaries who buy them immediately because the orders have been placed beforehand.  This is her only source of income to support her family.

She needs the loan to buy more fabric to make sportswear because she has a large pending order and she will earn better income.

Janeth is married and has two children she lives with in her in-laws’ house in the city of La Paz’s Tembladerani zone.

This is the 7th time she’s worked with IMPRO and fourth with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make sportwear for men and women.

loans.name: Ramil

texts.es:
Ramil ha dejado su trabajo anterior por motivos de familia.Ahora Ramil, trabaja como administrador en una empresa de bebidas energizantes propiedad de su hijo, del cual percibe un sueldo cada mes.
El crédito lo requiere para realizar los trámites de ingresos de materias primas en aduanas, ya que el negocio es de su hijo y de esta forma ayudar al negocio familiar.
Ramil, es casado y tiene un hijo vive en la casa de sus suegros en la zona El Rosario en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Due to family motives, Ramil has left his previous employment.  He now works as an administrator in his son’s energy drink firm earning a monthly salary.

He needs the loan to pay customs fees to import raw materials since the business is his son’s and this is a way to help the family business.

Ramil is married and has a son.  He lives in his in-laws’ house located in the city of La Paz’s El Rosario Zone.

This is the second time he’s worked with IMPRO and second with KIVA.

loans.use: to pay customs fees on imported raw materials.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a farmer in Litein, South Rift area of Kenya, and mother of four children with ages ranging from seventeen to one year old. Her farm produces milk and tea which both go to the local market. She runs a retail shop business besides farming.

Caroline has made a loan request amounting to 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her venture into poultry farming by buying chicks worth 30,000 KES and improve the dairy business by buying a chuff cutter to ease feeding and reduce the wastage in dairy feeds.

Caroline says harsh weather conditions in the area have always been a challenge, coupled with poor markets locally.

loans.use: To buy a chuff cutter and poultry birds

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a resident of Litein, South Rift, Kenya, aged 36 and married with two children aged ten and two years old. He has been in farming for nine solid years. He states that farming income meets all  his family's needs.

Geoffrey has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. His main focus is to own five dairy cows and a motorcycle to ease timely delivery of milk to the market. He adds the income will be used to educate his two children.

He points at lack of finance and animal diseases as the major challenges for farmers.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
